class.name: @GDScript
class.description: This contains the list of built-in gdscript functions. Mostly math functions and other utilities. Everything else is expanded by objects.

method.name: Color8
method.description: Make a color from red, green, blue and alpha. Arguments can range from 0 to 255.

method.name: abs
method.description: Remove sign (works for integer and float).

method.name: acos
method.description: Arc-cosine.

method.name: asin
method.description: Arc-sine.

method.name: assert
method.description: Assert that the condition is true. If the condition is false, generates an error.

method.name: atan
method.description: Arc-tangent.

method.name: atan2
method.description: Arc-tangent that takes a 2D vector as argument, returns the full -pi to +pi range.

method.name: bytes2var
method.description: Decode a byte array back to a value.

method.name: ceil
method.description: Ceiling (rounds up to nearest integer).

method.name: clamp
method.description: Clamp both values to a range.

method.name: convert
method.description: Convert from a type to another in the best way possible. The "type" parameter uses the enum TYPE_* in [@Global Scope].

method.name: cos
method.description: Standard cosine function.

method.name: cosh
method.description: Hyperbolic cosine.

method.name: db2linear
method.description: Convert from decibels to linear energy (audio).

method.name: decimals
method.description: Return the amount of decimals in the floating point value.

method.name: dectime
method.description: Decreases time by a specified amount.

method.name: deg2rad
method.description: Convert from degrees to radians.

method.name: dict2inst
method.description: Convert a previously converted instances to dictionary back into an instance. Useful for deserializing.

method.name: ease
method.description: Easing function, based on exponent. 0 is constant, 1 is linear, 0 to 1 is ease-in, 1+ is ease out. Negative values are in-out/out in.

method.name: exp
method.description: Exponential logarithm.

method.name: floor
method.description: Floor (rounds down to nearest integer).

method.name: fmod
method.description: Module (remainder of x/y).

method.name: fposmod
method.description: Module (remainder of x/y) that wraps equally in positive and negative.

method.name: funcref
method.description: Return a reference to the specified function.

method.name: hash
method.description: Hash the variable passed and return an integer.

method.name: inst2dict
method.description: Convert a script class instance to a dictionary (useful for serializing).

method.name: instance_from_id
method.description: Get an object by its ID.

method.name: lerp
method.description: Linear interpolates between two values by a normalized value.

method.name: linear2db
method.description: Convert from linear energy to decibels (audio).

method.name: load
method.description: Load a resource from the filesystem, pass a valid path as argument.

method.name: log
method.description: Natural logarithm.

method.name: max
method.description: Return the maximum of two values.

method.name: min
method.description: Return the minimum of two values.

method.name: nearest_po2
method.description: Return the nearest larger power of 2 for an integer.

method.name: parse_json
method.description: Parse json text to a Variant (use [method typeof] to check if it is what you expect).

method.name: pow
method.description: Power function, x elevate to y.

method.name: preload
method.description: Preload a resource from the filesystem. The resource is loaded during script parsing.

method.name: print
method.description: Print one or more arguments to strings in the best way possible to a console line.

method.name: print_stack
method.description: Print a stack track at code location, only works when running with debugger turned on.

method.name: printerr
method.description: Print one or more arguments to strings in the best way possible to standard error line.

method.name: printraw
method.description: Print one or more arguments to strings in the best way possible to console. No newline is added at the end.

method.name: prints
method.description: Print one or more arguments to the console with a space between each argument.

method.name: printt
method.description: Print one or more arguments to the console with a tab between each argument.

method.name: rad2deg
method.description: Convert from radians to degrees.

method.name: rand_range
method.description: Random range, any floating point value between 'from' and 'to'.

method.name: rand_seed
method.description: Random from seed: pass a seed, and an array with both number and new seed is returned. "Seed" here refers to the internal state of the pseudo random number generator. The internal state of the current implementation is 64 bits.

method.name: randf
method.description: Return a random floating point value between 0 and 1.

method.name: randi
method.description: Return a random 32 bits integer value. To obtain a random value between 0 to N (where N is smaller than 2^32 - 1), you can use remainder. For example, to get a random integer between 0 and 19 inclusive, you can use randi() % 20.

method.name: randomize
method.description: Randomize the seed (or the internal state) of the random number generator. Current implementation reseeds using a number based on time.

method.name: range
method.description: Return an array with the given range. Range can be 1 argument N (0 to N-1), two arguments (initial, final-1) or three arguments (initial, final-1, increment).

method.name: round
method.description: Round to nearest integer.

method.name: seed
method.description: Set seed for the random number generator.

method.name: sign
method.description: Return sign (-1 or +1).

method.name: sin
method.description: Standard sine function.

method.name: sinh
method.description: Hyperbolic sine.

method.name: sqrt
method.description: Square root.

method.name: stepify
method.description: Snap float value to a given step.

method.name: str
method.description: Convert one or more arguments to strings in the best way possible.

method.name: str2var
method.description: Convert a formatted string that was returned by [method var2str] to the original value.

method.name: tan
method.description: Standard tangent function.

method.name: tanh
method.description: Hyperbolic tangent.

method.name: to_json
method.description: Convert a Variant to json text.

method.name: typeof
method.description: Return the internal type of the given Variant object, using the TYPE_* enum in [@Global Scope].

method.name: var2bytes
method.description: Encode a variable value to a byte array.

method.name: var2str
method.description: Convert a value to a formatted string that can later be parsed using [method str2var].

method.name: weakref
method.description: Return a weak reference to an object.

method.name: yield
method.description: Stop the function execution and return the current state. Call [method GDFunctionState.resume] on the state to resume execution. This invalidates the state. Returns anything that was passed to the resume function call. If passed an object and a signal, the execution is resumed when the object's signal is emitted.

constants.constant: Constant that represents how many times the diameter of a circumference fits around its perimeter.

class.name: @Global Scope
class.description: Global scope constants and variables. This is all that resides in the globals, constants regarding error codes, scancodes, property hints, etc. It's not much. Singletons are also documented here, since they can be accessed from anywhere.

members.member: [AudioServer] singleton
[Geometry] singleton
[IP] singleton
[Input] singleton
[InputMap] singleton
[Marshalls] singleton
[OS] singleton
[Performance] singleton
[Physics2DServer] singleton
[PhysicsServer] singleton
[ResourceLoader] singleton
[ResourceSaver] singleton
[TranslationServer] singleton
[VisualServer] singleton

constants.constant: Left margin, used usually for [Control] or [StyleBox] derived classes.
Top margin, used usually for [Control] or [StyleBox] derived classes.
Right margin, used usually for [Control] or [StyleBox] derived classes.
Bottom margin, used usually for [Control] or [StyleBox] derived classes.
General vertical alignment, used usually for [Separator], [ScrollBar], [Slider], etc.
General horizontal alignment, used usually for [Separator], [ScrollBar], [Slider], etc.
Horizontal left alignment, usually for text-derived classes.
Horizontal center alignment, usually for text-derived classes.
Horizontal right alignment, usually for text-derived classes.
Vertical top alignment, usually for text-derived classes.
Vertical center alignment, usually for text-derived classes.
Vertical bottom alignment, usually for text-derived classes.
Scancodes with this bit applied are non printable.
Functions that return Error return OK when everything went ok. Most functions don't return error anyway and/or just print errors to stdout.
Hints that the string is a range, defined as "min,max" or "min,max,step". This is valid for integers and floats.
Hints that the string is an exponential range, defined as "min,max" or "min,max,step". This is valid for integers and floats.
Property hint for an enumerated value, like "Hello,Something,Else". This is valid for integer, float and string properties.
Property hint for a bitmask description, for bits 0,1,2,3 and 5 the hint would be like "Bit0,Bit1,Bit2,Bit3,,Bit5". Valid only for integers.
String property is a file (so pop up a file dialog when edited). Hint string can be a set of wildcards like "*.doc".
String property is a directory (so pop up a file dialog when edited).
String property is a resource, so open the resource popup menu when edited.
Property will be used as storage (default).
Property will be visible in editor (default).
Variable is of type nil (only applied for null).

class.name: AcceptDialog
class.description: This dialog is useful for small notifications to the user about an event. It can only be accepted or closed, with the same result.

method.name: add_button
method.description: Add custom button to the dialog and return the created button. The button titled with [i]text[/i] and the [i]action[/i] will be passed to [custom_action] signal when it is pressed.

method.name: add_cancel
method.description: Add custom cancel button to the dialog and return the created button.

method.name: get_hide_on_ok
method.description: Return true if the dialog will be hidden when accepted (default true).

method.name: get_label
method.description: Return the label used for built-in text.

method.name: get_ok
method.description: Return the OK Button.

method.name: get_text
method.description: Return the built-in label text.

method.name: register_text_enter
method.description: Register a [LineEdit] in the dialog. When the enter key is pressed, the dialog will be accepted.

method.name: set_hide_on_ok
method.description: Set whether the dialog is hidden when accepted (default true).

method.name: set_text
method.description: Set the built-in label text.

signal.name: confirmed
signal.description: Emitted when accepted.

signal.name: custom_action
signal.description: Emitted with a custom button is added.

class.name: AnimatedSprite
class.brief_description: Sprite node that can use multiple textures for animation.
class.description: Sprite node that can use multiple textures for animation.

method.name: get_animation
method.description: Return the name of the current animation set to the node.

method.name: get_frame
method.description: Return the visible frame index.

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Return the offset of the sprite in the node origin.

method.name: get_sprite_frames
method.description: Get the [SpriteFrames] resource, which contains all frames.

method.name: is_centered
method.description: Return true when centered. See [method set_centered].

method.name: is_flipped_h
method.description: Return true if sprite is flipped horizontally.

method.name: is_flipped_v
method.description: Return true if sprite is flipped vertically.

method.name: is_playing
method.description: Return true if an animation if currently being played.

method.name: play
method.description: Play the animation set in parameter. If no parameter is provided, the current animation is played.

method.name: set_animation
method.description: Set the current animation of the node and reinits the frame counter of the animation.

method.name: set_centered
method.description: When turned on, offset at (0,0) is the center of the sprite, when off, the top-left corner is.

method.name: set_flip_h
method.description: If true, sprite is flipped horizontally.

method.name: set_flip_v
method.description: If true, sprite is flipped vertically.

method.name: set_frame
method.description: Set the visible sprite frame index (from the list of frames inside the [SpriteFrames] resource).

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Set the offset of the sprite in the node origin. Position varies depending on whether it is centered or not.

method.name: set_sprite_frames
method.description: Set the [SpriteFrames] resource, which contains all frames.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop the current animation (does not reset the frame counter).

signal.name: animation_finished
signal.description: Emitted when the animation is finished (when it plays the last frame). If the animation is looping, this signal is emitted every time the last frame is drawn, before looping.

signal.name: frame_changed
signal.description: Emitted when frame is changed.

method.name: get_animation
method.description: Return the name of the current animation set to the node.

method.name: get_frame
method.description: Return the visible frame index.

method.name: get_sprite_frames
method.description: Get the [SpriteFrames] resource, which contains all frames.

method.name: is_playing
method.description: Return true if an animation if currently being played.

method.name: play
method.description: Play the animation set in parameter. If no parameter is provided, the current animation is played.

method.name: set_animation
method.description: Set the current animation of the node and reinits the frame counter of the animation.

method.name: set_frame
method.description: Set the visible sprite frame index (from the list of frames inside the [SpriteFrames] resource).

method.name: set_sprite_frames
method.description: Set the [SpriteFrames] resource, which contains all frames.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop the current animation (does not reset the frame counter).

signal.name: frame_changed
signal.description: Emitted when frame is changed.

class.name: Animation
class.brief_description: Contains data used to animate everything in the engine.
class.description: An Animation resource contains data used to animate everything in the engine. Animations are divided into tracks, and each track must be linked to a node. The state of that node can be changed through time, by adding timed keys (events) to the track. Animations are just data containers, and must be added to odes such as an [AnimationPlayer] or [AnimationTreePlayer] to be played back.

method.name: add_track
method.description: Add a track to the Animation. The track type must be specified as any of the values in the TYPE_* enumeration.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the animation (clear all tracks and reset all).

method.name: find_track
method.description: Return the index of the specified track. If the track is not found, return -1.

method.name: get_length
method.description: Return the total length of the animation (in seconds).

method.name: get_step
method.description: Get the animation step value.

method.name: get_track_count
method.description: Return the amount of tracks in the animation.

method.name: has_loop
method.description: Return whether the animation has the loop flag set.

method.name: method_track_get_key_indices
method.description: Return all the key indices of a method track, given a position and delta time.

method.name: method_track_get_name
method.description: Return the method name of a method track.

method.name: method_track_get_params
method.description: Return the arguments values to be called on a method track for a given key in a given track.

method.name: remove_track
method.description: Remove a track by specifying the track index.

method.name: set_length
method.description: Set the total length of the animation (in seconds). Note that length is not delimited by the last key, as this one may be before or after the end to ensure correct interpolation and looping.

method.name: set_loop
method.description: Set a flag indicating that the animation must loop. This is uses for correct interpolation of animation cycles, and for hinting the player that it must restart the animation.

method.name: set_step
method.description: Set the animation step value.

method.name: track_find_key
method.description: Find the key index by time in a given track. Optionally, only find it if the exact time is given.

method.name: track_get_interpolation_type
method.description: Return the interpolation type of a given track, from the INTERPOLATION_* enum.

method.name: track_get_key_count
method.description: Return the amount of keys in a given track.

method.name: track_get_key_time
method.description: Return the time at which the key is located.

method.name: track_get_key_transition
method.description: Return the transition curve (easing) for a specific key (see built-in math function "ease").

method.name: track_get_key_value
method.description: Return the value of a given key in a given track.

method.name: track_get_path
method.description: Get the path of a track. for more information on the path format, see [method track_set_path]

method.name: track_get_type
method.description: Get the type of a track.

method.name: track_insert_key
method.description: Insert a generic key in a given track.

method.name: track_is_imported
method.description: Return true if the given track is imported. Else, return false.

method.name: track_move_down
method.description: Move a track down.

method.name: track_move_up
method.description: Move a track up.

method.name: track_remove_key
method.description: Remove a key by index in a given track.

method.name: track_remove_key_at_pos
method.description: Remove a key by position (seconds) in a given track.

method.name: track_set_imported
method.description: Set the given track as imported or not.

method.name: track_set_interpolation_type
method.description: Set the interpolation type of a given track, from the INTERPOLATION_* enum.

method.name: track_set_key_transition
method.description: Set the transition curve (easing) for a specific key (see built-in math function "ease").

method.name: track_set_key_value
method.description: Set the value of an existing key.

method.name: track_set_path
method.description: Set the path of a track. Paths must be valid scene-tree paths to a node, and must be specified starting from the parent node of the node that will reproduce the animation. Tracks that control properties or bones must append their name after the path, separated by ":". Example: "character/skeleton:ankle" or "character/mesh:transform/local"

method.name: transform_track_insert_key
method.description: Insert a transform key for a transform track.

method.name: transform_track_interpolate
method.description: Return the interpolated value of a transform track at a given time (in seconds). An array consisting of 3 elements: position ([Vector3]), rotation ([Quat]) and scale ([Vector3]).

method.name: value_track_get_key_indices
method.description: Return all the key indices of a value track, given a position and delta time.

constants.constant: Value tracks set values in node properties, but only those which can be Interpolated.
Transform tracks are used to change node local transforms or skeleton pose bones. Transitions are Interpolated.
Method tracks call functions with given arguments per key.

class.name: AnimationPlayer
class.description: An animation player is used for general purpose playback of [Animation] resources. It contains a dictionary of animations (referenced by name) and custom blend times between their transitions. Additionally, animations can be played and blended in different channels.

method.name: add_animation
method.description: Add an animation resource to the player, which will be later referenced by the "name" argument.

method.name: advance
method.description: Used to skip ahead or skip back in an animation. Delta is the time in seconds to skip.

method.name: clear_caches
method.description: The animation player creates caches for faster access to the nodes it will animate. However, if a specific node is removed, it may not notice it, so clear_caches will force the player to search for the nodes again.

method.name: clear_queue
method.description: If animations are queued to play, clear them.

method.name: find_animation
method.description: Find an animation name by resource.

method.name: get_animation
method.description: Get an [Animation] resource by requesting a name.

method.name: get_animation_list
method.description: Get the list of names of the animations stored in the player.

method.name: get_animation_process_mode
method.description: Return the mode in which the animation player processes. See [method set_animation_process_mode].

method.name: get_autoplay
method.description: Return the name of the animation that will be automatically played when the scene is loaded.

method.name: get_blend_time
method.description: Get the blend time between two animations, referenced by their names.

method.name: get_current_animation
method.description: Return the name of the animation being played.

method.name: get_current_animation_length
method.description: Get the length (in seconds) of the currently being played animation.

method.name: get_current_animation_pos
method.description: Get the position (in seconds) of the currently being played animation.

method.name: get_default_blend_time
method.description: Return the default blend time between animations.

method.name: get_pos
method.description: Return the playback position (in seconds) in an animation channel (or channel 0 if none is provided).

method.name: get_root
method.description: Return path to root node (see [method set_root]).

method.name: get_speed_scale
method.description: Get the speed scaling ratio in a given animation channel (or channel 0 if none is provided). Default ratio is [i]1[/i] (no scaling).

method.name: has_animation
method.description: Request whether an [Animation] name exist within the player.

method.name: is_active
method.description: Return true if the player is active.

method.name: is_playing
method.description: Return whether an animation is playing.

method.name: play
method.description: Play a given animation by the animation name. Custom speed and blend times can be set. If custom speed is negative (-1), 'from_end' being true can play the animation backwards.

method.name: play_backwards
method.description: Play a given animation by the animation name in reverse.

method.name: queue
method.description: Queue an animation for playback once the current one is done.

method.name: remove_animation
method.description: Remove an animation from the player (by supplying the same name used to add it).

method.name: rename_animation
method.description: Rename an existing animation.

method.name: seek
method.description: Seek the animation to a given position in time (in seconds). If 'update' is true, the animation will be updated too, otherwise it will be updated at process time.

method.name: set_active
method.description: Set the player as active (playing). If false, it will do nothing.

method.name: set_animation_process_mode
method.description: Set the mode in which the animation player processes. By default, it processes on idle time (framerate dependent), but using fixed time works well for animating static collision bodies in 2D and 3D. See enum ANIMATION_PROCESS_*.

method.name: set_autoplay
method.description: Set the name of the animation that will be automatically played when the scene is loaded.

method.name: set_blend_time
method.description: Specify a blend time (in seconds) between two animations, referenced by their names.

method.name: set_current_animation
method.description: Set the current animation (even if no playback occurs). Using set_current_animation() and set_active() are similar to calling play().

method.name: set_default_blend_time
method.description: Set the default blend time between animations.

method.name: set_root
method.description: AnimationPlayer resolves animation track paths from this node (which is relative to itself), by default root is "..", but it can be changed.

method.name: set_speed_scale
method.description: Set a speed scaling ratio in a given animation channel (or channel 0 if none is provided). Default ratio is [i]1[/i] (no scaling).

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop the currently playing animation.

method.name: stop_all
method.description: Stop playback of animations (deprecated).

signal.name: animation_changed
signal.description: If the currently being played animation changes, this signal will notify of such change.

signal.name: animation_finished
signal.description: Notifies when an animation finished playing.

signal.name: animation_started
signal.description: Notifies when an animation starts playing.

constants.constant: Process animation on fixed process. This is specially useful when animating kinematic bodies.

class.name: AnimationTreePlayer
class.brief_description: Animation Player that uses a node graph for the blending.
class.description: Animation Player that uses a node graph for the blending. This kind of player is very useful when animating character or other skeleton based rigs, because it can combine several animations to form a desired pose.

method.name: add_node
method.description: Add a node of a given type in the graph with given id.

method.name: animation_node_set_animation
method.description: Set the animation for an animation node.

method.name: node_exists
method.description: Check if a node exists (by name).

method.name: node_get_input_count
method.description: Return the input count for a given node. Different types of nodes have different amount of inputs.

method.name: node_get_input_source
method.description: Return the input source for a given node input.

method.name: node_get_type
method.description: Get the node type, will return from NODE_* enum.

method.name: node_rename
method.description: Rename a node in the graph.

class.name: Area
class.brief_description: General purpose area detection and influence for 3D physics.
class.description: General purpose area detection for 3D physics. Areas can be used for detection of objects that enter/exit them, as well as overriding space parameters (changing gravity, damping, etc). For this, use any space override different from AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLE and point gravity at the center of mass.

method.name: get_angular_damp
method.description: Return the angular damp rate.

method.name: get_collision_mask
method.description: Return the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

method.name: get_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Return an individual bit on the collision mask.

method.name: get_gravity
method.description: Return the gravity intensity.

method.name: get_gravity_distance_scale
method.description: Return the falloff factor for point gravity.

method.name: get_gravity_vector
method.description: Return the gravity vector. If gravity is a point (see [method is_gravity_a_point]), this will be the attraction center.

method.name: get_layer_mask
method.description: Return the physics layer this area is in.

method.name: get_layer_mask_bit
method.description: Return an individual bit on the layer mask.

method.name: get_linear_damp
method.description: Return the linear damp rate.

method.name: get_overlapping_areas
method.description: Return a list of the areas that are totally or partially inside this area.

method.name: get_overlapping_bodies
method.description: Return a list of the bodies ([PhysicsBody]) that are totally or partially inside this area.

method.name: get_priority
method.description: Return the processing order of this area.

method.name: get_space_override_mode
method.description: Return the space override mode.

method.name: is_gravity_a_point
method.description: Return whether gravity is a point. A point gravity will attract objects towards it, as opposed to a gravity vector, which moves them in a given direction.

method.name: is_monitorable
method.description: Return whether this area can be detected by other, monitoring, areas.

method.name: is_monitoring
method.description: Return whether this area detects bodies/areas entering/exiting it.

method.name: overlaps_area
method.description: Return whether the area passed is totally or partially inside this area.

method.name: overlaps_body
method.description: Return whether the body passed is totally or partially inside this area.

method.name: set_angular_damp
method.description: Set the rate at which objects stop spinning in this area, if there are not any other forces making it spin. The value is a fraction of its current speed, lost per second. Thus, a value of 1.0 should mean stopping immediately, and 0.0 means the object never stops. In practice, as the fraction of speed lost gets smaller with each frame, a value of 1.0 does not mean the object will stop in exactly one second. Only when the physics calculations are done at 1 frame per second, it does stop in a second.

method.name: set_collision_mask
method.description: Set the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

method.name: set_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Set/clear individual bits on the collision mask. This makes selecting the areas scanned easier.

method.name: set_gravity
method.description: Set the gravity intensity. This is useful to alter the force of gravity without altering its direction. This value multiplies the gravity vector, whether it is the given vector ([method set_gravity_vector]), or a calculated one (when using a center of gravity).

method.name: set_gravity_distance_scale
method.description: Set the falloff factor for point gravity. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.

method.name: set_gravity_is_point
method.description: When overriding space parameters, this method sets whether this area has a center of gravity. To set/get the location of the center of gravity, use [method set_gravity_vector]/[method get_gravity_vector].

method.name: set_gravity_vector
method.description: Set the gravity vector. This vector does not have to be normalized. If gravity is a point (see [method is_gravity_a_point]), this will be the attraction center.

method.name: set_layer_mask
method.description: Set the physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers are not visual, but more of a tagging system instead. A collidable can use these layers/tags to select with which objects it can collide, using [method set_collision_mask]. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

method.name: set_layer_mask_bit
method.description: Set/clear individual bits on the layer mask. This makes getting an area in/out of only one layer easier.

method.name: set_linear_damp
method.description: Set the rate at which objects stop moving in this area, if there are not any other forces moving it. The value is a fraction of its current speed, lost per second. Thus, a value of 1.0 should mean stopping immediately, and 0.0 means the object never stops. In practice, as the fraction of speed lost gets smaller with each frame, a value of 1.0 does not mean the object will stop in exactly one second. Only when the physics calculations are done at 1 frame per second, it does stop in a second.

method.name: set_monitorable
method.description: Set whether this area can be detected by other, monitoring, areas. Only areas need to be marked as monitorable. Bodies are always so.

method.name: set_monitoring
method.description: Set whether this area can detect bodies/areas entering/exiting it.

method.name: set_priority
method.description: Set the order in which the area is processed. Greater values mean the area gets processed first. This is useful for areas which have an space override different from AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED or AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE, as they replace values, and are thus order-dependent. Areas with the same priority value get evaluated in an unpredictable order, and should be differentiated if evaluation order is to be important.

method.name: set_space_override_mode
method.description: Set the space override mode. This mode controls how an area affects gravity and damp. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE_REPLACE: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE_COMBINE: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

signal.name: area_entered
signal.description: This signal is triggered only once when an area enters this area. The only parameter passed is the area that entered this area.

signal.name: area_exited
signal.description: This signal is triggered only once when an area exits this area. The only parameter passed is the area that exited this area.

signal.name: area_shape_entered
signal.description: This signal triggers only once when an area enters this area. The first parameter is the area's [RID]. The second one is the area as an object. The third one is the index of the shape entering this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the entering.

signal.name: area_shape_exited
signal.description: This signal triggers only once when an area exits this area. The first parameter is the area's [RID]. The second one is the area as an object. The third one is the index of the shape entering this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the entering.

signal.name: body_entered
signal.description: This signal is triggered only once when a body enters this area. The only parameter passed is the body that entered this area.

signal.name: body_exited
signal.description: This signal is triggered only once when a body exits this area. The only parameter passed is the body that exited this area.

signal.name: body_shape_entered
signal.description: This signal triggers only once when a body enters this area. The first parameter is the body's [RID]. The second one is the body as an object. The third one is the index of the shape of the body that entered this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the entering.

signal.name: body_shape_exited
signal.description: This signal triggers only once when a body exits this area. The first parameter is the body's [RID]. The second one is the body as an object. The third one is the index of the shape exiting this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the exit.

class.name: Area2D
class.brief_description: General purpose area detection and influence for 2D physics.
class.description: General purpose area detection for 2D physics. Areas can be used for detection of objects that enter/exit them, as well as overriding space parameters (changing gravity, damping, etc). For this, use any space override different from AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLE and point gravity at the center of mass.

method.name: get_angular_damp
method.description: Return the angular damp rate.

method.name: get_collision_mask
method.description: Return the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

method.name: get_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Return an individual bit on the collision mask.

method.name: get_gravity
method.description: Return the gravity intensity.

method.name: get_gravity_distance_scale
method.description: Return the falloff factor for point gravity.

method.name: get_gravity_vector
method.description: Return the gravity vector. If gravity is a point (see [method is_gravity_a_point]), this will be the attraction center.

method.name: get_layer_mask
method.description: Return the physics layer this area is in.

method.name: get_layer_mask_bit
method.description: Return an individual bit on the layer mask.

method.name: get_linear_damp
method.description: Return the linear damp rate.

method.name: get_overlapping_areas
method.description: Return a list of the areas that are totally or partially inside this area.

method.name: get_overlapping_bodies
method.description: Return a list of the bodies ([PhysicsBody2D]) that are totally or partially inside this area.

method.name: get_priority
method.description: Return the processing order of this area.

method.name: get_space_override_mode
method.description: Return the space override mode.

method.name: is_gravity_a_point
method.description: Return whether gravity is a point. A point gravity will attract objects towards it, as opposed to a gravity vector, which moves them in a given direction.

method.name: is_monitorable
method.description: Return whether this area can be detected by other, monitoring, areas.

method.name: is_monitoring
method.description: Return whether this area detects bodies/areas entering/exiting it.

method.name: overlaps_area
method.description: Return whether the area passed is totally or partially inside this area.

method.name: overlaps_body
method.description: Return whether the body passed is totally or partially inside this area.

method.name: set_angular_damp
method.description: Set the rate at which objects stop spinning in this area, if there are not any other forces making it spin. The value is a fraction of its current speed, lost per second. Thus, a value of 1.0 should mean stopping immediately, and 0.0 means the object never stops. In practice, as the fraction of speed lost gets smaller with each frame, a value of 1.0 does not mean the object will stop in exactly one second. Only when the physics calculations are done at 1 frame per second, it does stop in a second.

method.name: set_collision_mask
method.description: Set the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

method.name: set_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Set/clear individual bits on the collision mask. This makes selecting the areas scanned easier.

method.name: set_gravity
method.description: Set the gravity intensity. This is useful to alter the force of gravity without altering its direction. This value multiplies the gravity vector, whether it is the given vector ([method set_gravity_vector]), or a calculated one (when using a center of gravity).

method.name: set_gravity_distance_scale
method.description: Set the falloff factor for point gravity. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.

method.name: set_gravity_is_point
method.description: When overriding space parameters, this method sets whether this area has a center of gravity. To set/get the location of the center of gravity, use [method set_gravity_vector]/[method get_gravity_vector].

method.name: set_gravity_vector
method.description: Set the gravity vector. This vector does not have to be normalized. If gravity is a point (see [method is_gravity_a_point]), this will be the attraction center.

method.name: set_layer_mask
method.description: Set the physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers are not visual, but more of a tagging system instead. A collidable can use these layers/tags to select with which objects it can collide, using [method set_collision_mask]. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

method.name: set_layer_mask_bit
method.description: Set/clear individual bits on the layer mask. This makes getting an area in/out of only one layer easier.

method.name: set_linear_damp
method.description: Set the rate at which objects stop moving in this area, if there are not any other forces moving it. The value is a fraction of its current speed, lost per second. Thus, a value of 1.0 should mean stopping immediately, and 0.0 means the object never stops. In practice, as the fraction of speed lost gets smaller with each frame, a value of 1.0 does not mean the object will stop in exactly one second. Only when the physics calculations are done at 1 frame per second, it does stop in a second.

method.name: set_monitorable
method.description: Set whether this area can be detected by other, monitoring, areas. Only areas need to be marked as monitorable. Bodies are always so.

method.name: set_monitoring
method.description: Set whether this area can detect bodies/areas entering/exiting it.

method.name: set_priority
method.description: Set the order in which the area is processed. Greater values mean the area gets processed first. This is useful for areas which have an space override different from AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED or AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE, as they replace values, and are thus order-dependent. Areas with the same priority value get evaluated in an unpredictable order, and should be differentiated if evaluation order is to be important.

method.name: set_space_override_mode
method.description: Set the space override mode. This mode controls how an area affects gravity and damp. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE_REPLACE: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas. AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE_COMBINE: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

signal.name: area_entered
signal.description: This signal is triggered only once when an area enters this area. The only parameter passed is the area that entered this area.

signal.name: area_exited
signal.description: This signal is triggered only once when an area exits this area. The only parameter passed is the area that exited this area.

signal.name: area_shape_entered
signal.description: This signal triggers only once when an area enters this area. The first parameter is the area's [RID]. The second one is the area as an object. The third one is the index of the shape entering this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the entering.

signal.name: area_shape_exited
signal.description: This signal triggers only once when an area exits this area. The first parameter is the area's [RID]. The second one is the area as an object. The third one is the index of the shape entering this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the entering.

signal.name: body_entered
signal.description: This signal is triggered only once when a body enters this area. The only parameter passed is the body that entered this area.

signal.name: body_exited
signal.description: This signal is triggered only once when a body exits this area. The only parameter passed is the body that exited this area.

signal.name: body_shape_entered
signal.description: This signal triggers only once when a body enters this area. The first parameter is the body's [RID]. The second one is the body as an object. The third one is the index of the shape of the body that entered this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the entering.

signal.name: body_shape_exited
signal.description: This signal triggers only once when a body exits this area. The first parameter is the body's [RID]. The second one is the body as an object. The third one is the index of the shape exiting this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the exit.

class.name: Array
class.description: Generic array, contains several elements of any type, accessible by numerical index starting at 0. Negative indices can be used to count from the right, like in Python. Arrays are always passed by reference.

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolByteArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolByteArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolByteArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolStringArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolRealArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolByteArray].

method.name: Array
method.description: Construct an array from a [PoolByteArray].

method.name: append
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array (alias of [method push_back]).

method.name: back
method.description: Returns the last element of the array if the array is not empty (size>0).

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the array (resize to 0).

method.name: count
method.description: Return the amount of times an element is in the array.

method.name: empty
method.description: Return true if the array is empty (size==0).

method.name: erase
method.description: Remove the first occurrence of a value from the array.

method.name: find
method.description: Searches the array for a value and returns its index or -1 if not found. Optionally, the initial search index can be passed.

method.name: find_last
method.description: Searches the array in reverse order for a value and returns its index or -1 if not found.

method.name: front
method.description: Returns the first element of the array if the array is not empty (size>0).

method.name: has
method.description: Return true if the array contains given value. [code][ "inside", 7 ].has("inside") == true, [ "inside", 7 ].has("outside") == false, [ "inside", 7 ].has(7) == true, [ "inside", 7 ].has("7") == false[/code]

method.name: hash
method.description: Return a hashed integer value representing the array contents.

method.name: insert
method.description: Insert a new element at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array (pos==size()).

method.name: invert
method.description: Reverse the order of the elements in the array (so first element will now be the last).

method.name: pop_back
method.description: Remove the last element of the array.

method.name: pop_front
method.description: Remove the first element of the array.

method.name: push_back
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array.

method.name: push_front
method.description: Add an element at the beginning of the array.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Resize the array to contain a different number of elements. If the array size is smaller, elements are cleared, if bigger, new elements are Null.

method.name: rfind
method.description: Searches the array in reverse order. Optionally, a start search index can be passed. If negative, the start index is considered relative to the end of the array.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the amount of elements in the array.

method.name: sort
method.description: Sort the array using natural order.

method.name: sort_custom
method.description: Sort the array using a custom method. The arguments are an object that holds the method and the name of such method. The custom method receives two arguments (a pair of elements from the array) and must return true if the first argument is less than the second, and return false otherwise.

class.name: AudioServer
class.brief_description: Server interface for low level audio access.
class.description: AudioServer is a low level server interface for audio access. It is in charge of creating sample data (playable audio) as well as its playback via a voice interface.

class.name: AudioStream
class.description: Base class for audio streams. Audio streams are used for music playback, or other types of streamed sounds that don't fit or require more flexibility than a [Sample].

class.name: AudioStreamOGGVorbis
class.description: OGG Vorbis audio stream driver.

class.name: BackBufferCopy
class.brief_description: Copies a region of the screen (or the whole screen) to a buffer so it can be accessed with the texscreen() shader instruction.
class.description: Node for back-buffering the currently displayed screen. The region defined in the BackBufferCopy node is bufferized with the content of the screen it covers, or the entire screen according to the copy mode set. Accessing this buffer is done with the texscreen() shader instruction.

method.name: get_copy_mode
method.description: Return the copy mode currently applied to the BackBufferCopy (refer to constants section).

method.name: get_rect
method.description: Return the area covered by the BackBufferCopy.

method.name: set_copy_mode
method.description: Set the copy mode of the BackBufferCopy (refer to constants section).

method.name: set_rect
method.description: Defines the area covered by the BackBufferCopy.

constants.constant: Disables the buffering mode. This means the BackBufferCopy node will directly use the portion of screen it covers.
Sets the copy mode to a region.
Sets the copy mode to the entire screen.

class.name: BaseButton
class.brief_description: Provides a base class for different kinds of buttons.
class.description: BaseButton is the abstract base class for buttons, so it shouldn't be used directly (It doesn't display anything). Other types of buttons inherit from it.

method.name: _pressed
method.description: Called when button is pressed.

method.name: _toggled
method.description: Called when button is toggled (only if toggle_mode is active).

method.name: get_action_mode
method.description: Return the current mode of action (see [method set_action_mode]) (one of the ACTION_MODE_* constants).

method.name: get_draw_mode
method.description: Return the visual state used to draw the button. This is useful mainly when implementing your own draw code by either overriding _draw() or connecting to "draw" signal. The visual state of the button is defined by the DRAW_* enum.

method.name: get_enabled_focus_mode
method.description: Returns focus access mode used when switching between enabled/disabled (see [method Control.set_focus_mode] and [method set_disabled]).

method.name: is_disabled
method.description: Return whether the button is in disabled state (see [method set_disabled]).

method.name: is_hovered
method.description: Return true if mouse entered the button before it exit.

method.name: is_pressed
method.description: If toggle_mode is active, return whether the button is toggled. If toggle_mode is not active, return whether the button is pressed down.

method.name: is_toggle_mode
method.description: Return the toggle_mode property (see [method set_toggle_mode]).

method.name: set_action_mode
method.description: Set the current mode of action, determining when the button is considered clicked (see the ACTION_MODE_* constants).

method.name: set_disabled
method.description: Set the button into disabled state. When a button is disabled, it can't be clicked or toggled.

method.name: set_enabled_focus_mode
method.description: Sets the focus access mode to use when switching between enabled/disabled (see [method Control.set_focus_mode] and [method set_disabled]).

method.name: set_pressed
method.description: Set the button to pressed state (only if toggle_mode is active).

method.name: set_toggle_mode
method.description: Set the button toggle_mode property. Toggle mode makes the button flip state between pressed and unpressed each time its area is clicked.

signal.name: button_down
signal.description: Emitted when the button starts being held down.

signal.name: button_up
signal.description: Emitted when the button stops being held down.

signal.name: pressed
signal.description: This signal is emitted every time the button is toggled or pressed (i.e. activated, so on [code]button_down[/code] if "Click on press" is active and on [code]button_up[/code] otherwise).

signal.name: toggled
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the button was just toggled between pressed and normal states (only if toggle_mode is active). The new state is contained in the [i]pressed[/i] argument.

constants.constant: The normal state (i.e. not pressed, not hovered, not toggled and enabled) of buttons.
The state of buttons are pressed.
The state of buttons are hovered.
The state of buttons are disabled.
Require just a press to consider the button clicked.
Require a press and a subsequent release before considering the button clicked.

class.name: Basis
class.description: 3x3 matrix used for 3D rotation and scale. Contains 3 vector fields x,y and z as its columns, which can be interpreted as the local basis vectors of a transformation. Can also be accessed as array of 3D vectors. These vectors are orthogonal to each other, but are not necessarily normalized. Almost always used as orthogonal basis for a [Transform]. For such use, it is composed of a scaling and a rotation matrix, in that order (M = R.S).

method.name: Basis
method.description: Create a rotation matrix from the given quaternion.

method.name: Basis
method.description: Create a rotation matrix which rotates around the given axis by the specified angle. The axis must be a normalized vector.

method.name: Basis
method.description: Create a matrix from 3 axis vectors.

method.name: determinant
method.description: Return the determinant of the matrix.

method.name: get_euler
method.description: Return Euler angles (in the XYZ convention: first Z, then Y, and X last) from the matrix. Returned vector contains the rotation angles in the format (third,second,first). This function only works if the matrix represents a proper rotation.

method.name: get_orthogonal_index
method.description: This function considers a discretization of rotations into 24 points on unit sphere, lying along the vectors (x,y,z) with each component being either -1,0 or 1, and returns the index of the point best representing the orientation of the object. It is mainly used by the grid map editor. For further details, refer to Godot source code.

method.name: get_scale
method.description: Assuming that the matrix is the combination of a rotation and scaling, return the absolute value of scaling factors along each axis.

method.name: inverse
method.description: Return the inverse of the matrix.

method.name: orthonormalized
method.description: Return the orthonormalized version of the matrix (useful to call from time to time to avoid rounding error for orthogonal matrices). This performs a Gram-Schmidt orthonormalization on the basis of the matrix.

method.name: rotated
method.description: Introduce an additional rotation around the given axis by phi. Only relevant when the matrix is being used as a part of [Transform]. The axis must be a normalized vector.

method.name: scaled
method.description: Introduce an additional scaling specified by the given 3D scaling factor. Only relevant when the matrix is being used as a part of [Transform].

method.name: tdotx
method.description: Transposed dot product with the x axis of the matrix.

method.name: tdoty
method.description: Transposed dot product with the y axis of the matrix.

method.name: tdotz
method.description: Transposed dot product with the z axis of the matrix.

method.name: transposed
method.description: Return the transposed version of the matrix.

method.name: xform
method.description: Return a vector transformed (multiplied) by the matrix and return it.

method.name: xform_inv
method.description: Return a vector transformed (multiplied) by the transposed matrix and return it. Note that this is a multiplication by inverse only when the matrix represents a rotation-reflection.

method.name: add_char
method.description: Add a character to the font, where [i]character[/i] is the unicode value, [i]texture[/i] is the texture index, [i]rect[/i] is the region in the texture (in pixels!), [i]align[/i] is the (optional) alignment for the character and [i]advance[/i] is the (optional) advance.

method.name: add_kerning_pair
method.description: Add a kerning pair to the [BitmapFont] as a difference. Kerning pairs are special cases where a typeface advance is determined by the next character.

method.name: add_texture
method.description: Add a texture to the [BitmapFont].

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear all the font data.

method.name: get_char_size
method.description: Return the size of a character, optionally taking kerning into account if the next character is provided.

method.name: get_kerning_pair
method.description: Return a kerning pair as a difference.

method.name: set_ascent
method.description: Set the font ascent (number of pixels above the baseline).

method.name: set_height
method.description: Set the total font height (ascent plus descent) in pixels.

class.name: BoneAttachment
class.brief_description: A node that will attach to a bone.
class.description: This node must be the child of a [Skeleton] node. You can then select a bone for this node to attach to. The BoneAttachment node will copy the transform of the selected bone.

class.name: BoxContainer
class.description: Base class for Box containers. It arranges children controls vertically or horizontally, and rearranges them automatically when their minimum size changes.

method.name: add_spacer
method.description: Add a control to the box as a spacer. If [i]begin[/i] is true the spacer control will be inserted in front of other children.

method.name: get_alignment
method.description: Return the alignment of children in the container.

method.name: set_alignment
method.description: Set the alignment of children in the container(Must be one of ALIGN_BEGIN, ALIGN_CENTER or ALIGN_END).

constants.constant: Align children with beginning of the container.
Align children with center of the container.
Align children with end of the container.

class.name: BoxShape
class.description: Box shape resource, which can be set into a [PhysicsBody] or area.

method.name: get_extents
method.description: Return the half extents of the shape.

method.name: set_extents
method.description: Set the half extents for the shape.

class.name: Button
class.description: Button is the standard themed button. It can contain text and an icon, and will display them according to the current [Theme].

method.name: get_button_icon
method.description: Return the button icon.

method.name: get_clip_text
method.description: Return the state of the [i]clip_text[/i] property (see [method set_clip_text])

method.name: get_text
method.description: Return the button text.

method.name: get_text_align
method.description: Return the text alignment policy.

method.name: is_flat
method.description: Return the state of the [i]flat[/i] property (see [method set_flat]).

method.name: set_button_icon
method.description: Set the icon that will be displayed next to the text inside the button area.

method.name: set_clip_text
method.description: Set the [i]clip_text[/i] property of a Button. When this property is enabled, text that is too large to fit the button is clipped, when disabled (default) the Button will always be wide enough to hold the text.

method.name: set_flat
method.description: Set the [i]flat[/i] property of a Button. Flat buttons don't display decoration unless hovered or pressed.

method.name: set_text
method.description: Set the button text, which will be displayed inside the button area.

method.name: set_text_align
method.description: Set the text alignment policy, using one of the ALIGN_* constants.

constants.constant: Align the text to the left.
Align the text to the right.

class.name: ButtonArray
class.description: Array of Buttons. A ButtonArray is useful to have an array of buttons laid out vertically or horizontally. Only one button can be selected, and is referenced by its index in the array (first button is 0, second button is 1, etc.). This is useful [i]e.g.[/i] for joypad-friendly interfaces and option menus.

method.name: add_button
method.description: Append a new button to the array, with the specified text and tooltip.

method.name: add_icon_button
method.description: Append a new button to the array, with the specified icon, text and tooltip.

method.name: clear
method.description: Remove all buttons from the array.

method.name: erase_button
method.description: Remove the specified button in the array.

method.name: get_button_count
method.description: Return the amount of buttons in the array.

method.name: get_button_icon
method.description: Return the icon of the specified button.

method.name: get_button_text
method.description: Return the text of the specified button.

method.name: get_button_tooltip
method.description: Return the tooltip of the specified button.

method.name: get_hovered
method.description: Return the index of the currently hovered button in the array.

method.name: get_selected
method.description: Return the index of the currently selected button in the array.

method.name: set_button_icon
method.description: Set the icon of the specified button.

method.name: set_button_text
method.description: Define the text of the specified button.

method.name: set_button_tooltip
method.description: Define the tooltip of the specified button.

method.name: set_selected
method.description: Select a button in the array based on the given index.

signal.name: button_selected
signal.description: A button has been selected, its index is given as the argument.

constants.constant: Spread the buttons, but keep them small.
Spread the buttons, but expand them.

class.name: ButtonGroup
class.description: Group of [Button]. All direct and indirect children buttons become radios. Only one allows being pressed.

method.name: get_pressed_button
method.description: Return the pressed button.

class.name: Camera
class.brief_description: Camera node, displays from a point of view.
class.description: Camera is a special node that displays what is visible from its current location. Cameras register themselves in the nearest [Viewport] node (when ascending the tree). Only one camera can be active per viewport. If no viewport is available ascending the tree, the Camera will register in the global viewport. In other words, a Camera just provides [i]3D[/i] display capabilities to a [Viewport], and, without one, a scene registered in that [Viewport] (or higher viewports) can't be displayed.

method.name: get_camera_transform
method.description: Get the camera transform. Subclassed cameras (such as CharacterCamera) may provide different transforms than the [Node] transform.

method.name: is_current
method.description: Return whether the Camera is the current one in the [Viewport], or plans to become current (if outside the scene tree).

method.name: make_current
method.description: Make this camera the current Camera for the [Viewport] (see class description). If the Camera Node is outside the scene tree, it will attempt to become current once it's added.

method.name: project_ray_normal
method.description: Return a normal vector in worldspace, that is the result of projecting a point on the [Viewport] rectangle by the camera projection. This is useful for casting rays in the form of (origin,normal) for object intersection or picking.

method.name: project_ray_origin
method.description: Return a 3D position in worldspace, that is the result of projecting a point on the [Viewport] rectangle by the camera projection. This is useful for casting rays in the form of (origin,normal) for object intersection or picking.

method.name: set_orthogonal
method.description: Set the camera projection to orthogonal mode, by specifying a width and the [i]near[/i] and [i]far[/i] clip planes in worldspace units. (As a hint, 2D games often use this projection, with values specified in pixels)

method.name: set_perspective
method.description: Set the camera projection to perspective mode, by specifying a [i]FOV[/i] Y angle in degrees (FOV means Field of View), and the [i]near[/i] and [i]far[/i] clip planes in worldspace units.

method.name: unproject_position
method.description: Return how a 3D point in worldspace maps to a 2D coordinate in the [Viewport] rectangle.

constants.constant: Perspective Projection (object's size on the screen becomes smaller when far away).
Orthogonal Projection (objects remain the same size on the screen no matter how far away they are).

class.name: Camera2D
class.description: Camera node for 2D scenes. It forces the screen (current layer) to scroll following this node. This makes it easier (and faster) to program scrollable scenes than manually changing the position of [CanvasItem] based nodes. This node is intended to be a simple helper get get things going quickly and it may happen often that more functionality is desired to change how the camera works. To make your own custom camera node, simply inherit from [Node2D] and change the transform of the canvas by calling get_viewport().set_canvas_transform(m) in [Viewport].

method.name: align
method.description: Align the camera to the tracked node

method.name: force_update_scroll
method.description: Force the camera to update scroll immediately.

method.name: get_camera_pos
method.description: Return the camera position.

method.name: get_drag_margin
method.description: Return the margins needed to drag the camera (see [method set_drag_margin]).

method.name: get_limit
method.description: Return the scrolling limit in pixels.

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Return the scroll offset.

method.name: is_current
method.description: Return true of this is the current camera (see [method make_current]).

method.name: make_current
method.description: Make this the current 2D camera for the scene (viewport and layer), in case there's many cameras in the scene.

method.name: reset_smoothing
method.description: Set the camera's position immediately to its current smoothing destination. This has no effect if smoothing is disabled.

method.name: set_drag_margin
method.description: Set the margins needed to drag the camera (relative to the screen size). Margin uses the MARGIN_* enum. Drag margins of 0,0,0,0 will keep the camera at the center of the screen, while drag margins of 1,1,1,1 will only move when the camera is at the edges.

method.name: set_limit
method.description: Set the scrolling limit in pixels.

method.name: set_limit_smoothing_enabled
method.description: Smooth camera when reaching camera limits. This requires camera smoothing being enabled to have a noticeable effect.

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Set the scroll offset. Useful for looking around or camera shake animations.

class.name: CanvasItem
class.description: Base class of anything 2D. Canvas items are laid out in a tree and children inherit and extend the transform of their parent. CanvasItem is extended by [Control], for anything GUI related, and by [Node2D] for anything 2D engine related. Any CanvasItem can draw. For this, the "update" function must be called, then NOTIFICATION_DRAW will be received on idle time to request redraw. Because of this, canvas items don't need to be redraw on every frame, improving the performance significantly. Several functions for drawing on the CanvasItem are provided (see draw_* functions). They can only be used inside the notification, signal or _draw() overrides function, though. Canvas items are draw in tree order. By default, children are on top of their parents so a root CanvasItem will be drawn behind everything (this can be changed per item though). Canvas items can also be hidden (hiding also their subtree). They provide many means for changing standard parameters such as opacity (for it and the subtree) and self opacity, blend mode. Ultimately, a transform notification can be requested, which will notify the node that its global position changed in case the parent tree changed.

method.name: _draw
method.description: Called (if exists) to draw the canvas item.

method.name: draw_char
method.description: Draw a string character using a custom font. Returns the advance, depending on the char width and kerning with an optional next char.

method.name: draw_circle
method.description: Draw a colored circle.

method.name: draw_colored_polygon
method.description: Draw a colored polygon of any amount of points, convex or concave.

method.name: draw_line
method.description: Draw a line from a 2D point to another, with a given color and width. It can be optionally antialiased.

method.name: draw_polygon
method.description: Draw a polygon of any amount of points, convex or concave.

method.name: draw_primitive
method.description: Draw a custom primitive, 1 point for a point, 2 points for a line, 3 points for a triangle and 4 points for a quad.

method.name: draw_rect
method.description: Draw a colored rectangle.

method.name: draw_set_transform
method.description: Set a custom transform for drawing. Anything drawn afterwards will be transformed by this.

method.name: draw_string
method.description: Draw a string using a custom font.

method.name: draw_style_box
method.description: Draw a styled rectangle.

method.name: draw_texture
method.description: Draw a texture at a given position.

method.name: draw_texture_rect
method.description: Draw a textured rectangle at a given position, optionally modulated by a color. Transpose swaps the x and y coordinates when reading the texture.

method.name: draw_texture_rect_region
method.description: Draw a textured rectangle region at a given position, optionally modulated by a color. Transpose swaps the x and y coordinates when reading the texture.

method.name: edit_get_state
method.description: Used for editing, returns an opaque value representing the transform state.

method.name: edit_rotate
method.description: Used for editing, handle rotation.

method.name: edit_set_state
method.description: Set the transform state of this CanvasItem. For [Node2D], this is an [Array] with (in order) a [Vector2] for position, a float for rotation and another [Vector2] for scale. For [Control] this is a [Rect2] with the position and size.

method.name: get_canvas
method.description: Return the [RID] of the [World2D] canvas where this item is in.

method.name: get_canvas_item
method.description: Return the canvas item RID used by [VisualServer] for this item.

method.name: get_canvas_transform
method.description: Get the transform matrix of this item's canvas.

method.name: get_global_mouse_pos
method.description: Get the global position of the mouse.

method.name: get_global_transform
method.description: Get the global transform matrix of this item.

method.name: get_global_transform_with_canvas
method.description: Get the global transform matrix of this item in relation to the canvas.

method.name: get_item_and_children_rect
method.description: Get a [Rect2] with the boundaries of this item and its children.

method.name: get_item_rect
method.description: Return a rect containing the editable boundaries of the item.

method.name: get_light_mask
method.description: Get this item's light mask number.

method.name: get_local_mouse_pos
method.description: Get the mouse position relative to this item's position.

method.name: get_material
method.description: Get the material of this item.

method.name: get_modulate
method.description: Get the modulate of the CanvasItem, which affects children items too.

method.name: get_self_modulate
method.description: Get the self-modulate of the CanvasItem.

method.name: get_transform
method.description: Get the transform matrix of this item.

method.name: get_use_parent_material
method.description: Get whether this item uses its parent's material.

method.name: get_viewport_rect
method.description: Get the viewport's boundaries as a [Rect2].

method.name: get_viewport_transform
method.description: Get this item's transform in relation to the viewport.

method.name: get_world_2d
method.description: Get the [World2D] where this item is in.

method.name: hide
method.description: Hide the CanvasItem currently visible.

method.name: is_draw_behind_parent_enabled
method.description: Return whether the item is drawn behind its parent.

method.name: is_set_as_toplevel
method.description: Return if set as toplevel. See [method set_as_toplevel].

method.name: is_visible
method.description: Return true if this CanvasItem is visible. It may be invisible because itself or a parent canvas item is hidden.

method.name: make_input_local
method.description: Takes a global input event and convert to this item's coordinate system.

method.name: set_as_toplevel
method.description: Set as top level. This means that it will not inherit transform from parent canvas items.

method.name: set_draw_behind_parent
method.description: Set whether the canvas item is drawn behind its parent.

method.name: set_light_mask
method.description: Set the ligtht mask number of this item.

method.name: set_material
method.description: Set the material of this item.

method.name: set_modulate
method.description: Set the modulate of the CanvasItem. This [i]affects[/i] the modulation of children items.

method.name: set_self_modulate
method.description: Set the self-modulate of the CanvasItem. This does not affect the modulation of children items.

method.name: set_use_parent_material
method.description: Set whether or not this item should use its parent's material.

method.name: set_visible
method.description: Set whether this item should be visible or not. Note that a hidden CanvasItem will make all children hidden too, so no matter what is set here this item won't be shown if its parent or grandparents nodes are hidden.

method.name: show
method.description: Show the CanvasItem currently hidden.

method.name: update
method.description: Queue the CanvasItem for update. [code]NOTIFICATION_DRAW[/code] will be called on idle time to request redraw.

signal.name: draw
signal.description: Emitted when the CanvasItem must redraw. This can only be connected realtime, as deferred will not allow drawing.

signal.name: hide
signal.description: Emitted when becoming hidden.

signal.name: item_rect_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the item rect has changed.

signal.name: visibility_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the visibility (hidden/visible) changes.

constants.constant: Mix blending mode. Colors are assumed to be independent of the alpha (opacity) value.
Mix blending mode. Colors are assumed to be premultiplied by the alpha (opacity) value.
Canvas item has entered the canvas.
Canvas item has exited the canvas.
Canvas item transform has changed. Only received if requested.

class.name: CanvasLayer
class.description: Canvas Item layer. [CanvasItem] nodes that are direct or indirect children of a [CanvasLayer] will be drawn in that layer. The layer is a numeric index that defines the draw order. The default 2D scene renders with index 0, so a [CanvasLayer] with index -1 will be drawn below, and one with index 1 will be drawn above. This is very useful for HUDs (in layer 1+ or above), or backgrounds (in layer -1 or below).

method.name: get_layer
method.description: Return the layer index, determines the draw order, a lower value will be below a higher one.

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Return the base offset for this layer (helper).

method.name: get_rotation
method.description: Return the base rotation for this layer (helper).

method.name: get_rotationd
method.description: Get rotation of the layer in degree.

method.name: get_scale
method.description: Return the base scale for this layer (helper).

method.name: get_transform
method.description: Return the base transform for this layer.

method.name: get_world_2d
method.description: Return the [World2D] used by this layer.

method.name: set_layer
method.description: Set the layer index, determines the draw order, a lower value will be below a higher one.

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Set the base offset for this layer (helper).

method.name: set_rotation
method.description: Set the base rotation for this layer (helper).

method.name: set_rotationd
method.description: Set rotation of the layer in degree.

method.name: set_scale
method.description: Set the base scale for this layer (helper).

method.name: set_transform
method.description: Set the base transform for this layer.

class.name: CanvasModulate
class.description: CanvasModulate tints the canvas elements using its assigned color

method.name: get_color
method.description: Gets the canvas tint color

method.name: set_color
method.description: Sets the canvas tint color

class.name: CapsuleShape
class.description: Capsule shape resource, which can be set into a [PhysicsBody] or area.

method.name: get_height
method.description: Return the capsule height.

method.name: get_radius
method.description: Return the capsule radius.

method.name: set_height
method.description: Set the capsule height.

method.name: set_radius
method.description: Set the capsule radius.

class.name: CapsuleShape2D
class.description: Capsule 2D shape resource for physics. A capsule (or sometimes called "pill") is like a line grown in all directions. It has a radius and a height, and is often useful for modeling biped characters.

method.name: get_height
method.description: Return the height of the [CapsuleShape2D].

method.name: get_radius
method.description: Return the radius of the [CapsuleShape2D].

method.name: set_height
method.description: Set the height of the [CapsuleShape2D].

method.name: set_radius
method.description: Set the radius of the [CapsuleShape2D].

class.name: CenterContainer
class.description: CenterContainer Keeps children controls centered. This container keeps all children to their minimum size, in the center.

method.name: is_using_top_left
method.description: Should put children to the top left corner instead of center of the container.

method.name: set_use_top_left
method.description: This function will anchor the container children to the top left corner of the the container boundaries, moving all its children to that position, (the children new center will be the top left corner of the container).

class.name: CheckBox
