class.description: A checkbox allows the user to make a binary choice (choosing only one of two posible options), for example Answer 'yes' or 'no'.

class.name: CheckButton
class.description: CheckButton is a toggle button displayed as a check field.

class.name: CircleShape2D
class.description: Circular Shape for 2D Physics. This shape is useful for modeling balls or small characters and its collision detection with everything else is very fast.

method.name: get_radius
method.description: Return the radius of the circle shape.

method.name: set_radius
method.description: Set the radius of the circle shape.

class.name: CollisionObject2D
class.description: CollisionObject2D is the base class for 2D physics collisionables. They can hold any number of 2D collision shapes. Usually, they are edited by placing [CollisionShape2D] and/or [CollisionPolygon2D] nodes as children. Such nodes are for reference and not present outside the editor, so code should use the regular shape API.

method.name: _input_event
method.description: This method can be used to override normal input processing. The first parameter is the viewport where the event took place. The second holds the input event received, and the third the shape of this object where it happened.

method.name: add_shape
method.description: Add a [Shape2D] to the collision body, with a given custom transform.

method.name: clear_shapes
method.description: Remove all shapes.

method.name: get_rid
method.description: Return the RID of this object.

method.name: get_shape
method.description: Return the shape in the given index.

method.name: get_shape_count
method.description: Return the amount of shapes in the collision body. Because a [CollisionPolygon2D] can generate more than one [Shape2D], the amount returned does not have to match the sum of [CollisionShape2D] and [CollisionPolygon2D].

method.name: get_shape_transform
method.description: Return the shape transform in the given index.

method.name: is_pickable
method.description: Return whether this object is pickable.

method.name: is_shape_set_as_trigger
method.description: Return whether a shape is a trigger. A trigger shape detects collisions, but is otherwise unaffected by physics (i.e. colliding objects will not get blocked).

method.name: remove_shape
method.description: Remove the shape in the given index.

method.name: set_pickable
method.description: Set whether this object is pickable. A pickable object can detect the mouse pointer enter/leave it and, if the mouse is inside it, report input events.

method.name: set_shape
method.description: Change a shape in the collision body.

method.name: set_shape_as_trigger
method.description: Set whether a shape is a trigger. A trigger shape detects collisions, but is otherwise unaffected by physics (i.e. colliding objects will not get blocked).

method.name: set_shape_transform
method.description: Change the shape transform in the collision body.

signal.name: input_event
signal.description: This signal triggers when an input event fires over a shape. The first parameter is the viewport where the event took place. The second holds the input event received, and the third the shape of this object where it happened.

signal.name: mouse_entered
signal.description: This event fires only once when the mouse pointer enters any shape of this object.

signal.name: mouse_exited
signal.description: This event fires only once when the mouse pointer exits all shapes of this object.

class.name: CollisionPolygon2D
class.brief_description: Editor-only class for easy editing of collision polygons.
class.description: Editor-only class. This is not present when running the game. It's used in the editor to properly edit and position collision shapes in [CollisionObject2D]. This is not accessible from regular code. This class is for editing custom shape polygons.

method.name: get_build_mode
method.description: Return whether the polygon is a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==0[/code]), or a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==1[/code]).

method.name: get_collision_object_first_shape
method.description: Return the index of the first shape generated by the editor. When [code]build_mode[/code] is set to generate convex polygons, the shape shown in the editor may be decomposed into many convex polygons. In that case, a range of indexes is needed to directly access the [Shape2D]. When [code]build_mode[/code] is set to generate concave polygons, there is only one [Shape2D] generated, so the start index and the end index are the same.

method.name: get_collision_object_last_shape
method.description: Return the index of the last shape generated by the editor.

method.name: get_polygon
method.description: Return the list of points that define the polygon.

method.name: is_trigger
method.description: Return whether this polygon is a trigger.

method.name: set_build_mode
method.description: Set whether the polygon is to be a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==0[/code]), or a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] ([code]build_mode==1[/code]).

method.name: set_polygon
method.description: Set the array of points forming the polygon. When editing the point list via the editor, depending on [method get_build_mode], it has to be a list of points (for [code]build_mode==0[/code]), or a list of lines (for [code]build_mode==1[/code]). In the second case, the even elements of the array define the start point of the line, and the odd elements the end point.

method.name: set_trigger
method.description: Set whether this polygon is a trigger. A trigger polygon detects collisions, but is otherwise unaffected by physics (i.e. colliding objects will not get blocked).

class.name: CollisionShape2D
class.brief_description: Editor-only class for easy editing of shapes.
class.description: Editor-only class. This is not present when running the game. It's used in the editor to properly edit and position collision shapes in [CollisionObject2D]. This is not accessible from regular code.

method.name: get_collision_object_shape_index
method.description: Return the index of this shape inside its container [CollisionObject2D]. This can be used to directly access the underlying [Shape2D].

method.name: get_shape
method.description: Return this shape's [Shape2D].

method.name: is_trigger
method.description: Return whether this shape is a trigger.

method.name: set_shape
method.description: Set this shape's [Shape2D]. This will not appear as a node, but can be directly edited as a property.

method.name: set_trigger
method.description: Set whether this shape is a trigger. A trigger shape detects collisions, but is otherwise unaffected by physics (i.e. will not block movement of colliding objects).

class.name: Color
class.description: A color is represented as red, green and blue (r,g,b) components. Additionally, "a" represents the alpha component, often used for transparency. Values are in floating point and usually range from 0 to 1. Some methods (such as set_modulate() ) may accept values > 1.

method.name: Color
method.description: Construct the color from an RGBA profile.

method.name: Color
method.description: Construct the color from an RGBA profile.

method.name: Color
method.description: Construct the color from an RGBA profile.

method.name: Color
method.description: Construct the color from an RGBA profile.

method.name: blend
method.description: Return a new color blended with anothor one.

method.name: contrasted
method.description: Return the most contrasting color with this one.

method.name: gray
method.description: Convert the color to gray.

method.name: inverted
method.description: Return the inverted color (1-r, 1-g, 1-b, 1-a).

method.name: linear_interpolate
method.description: Return the linear interpolation with another color.

method.name: to_32
method.description: Convert the color to a 32 its integer (each byte represents a RGBA).

method.name: to_ARGB32
method.description: Convert color to ARGB32, more compatible with DirectX.

method.name: to_html
method.description: Return the HTML hexadecimal color string.

members.member: Alpha (0 to 1)
Alpha (0 to 255)
Blue (0 to 1)
Blue (0 to 255)
Green (0 to 1)
Green (0 to 255)
Hue (0 to 1)
Red (0 to 1)
Red (0 to 255)
Saturation (0 to 1)
Value (0 to 1)

class.name: ColorPicker
class.description: This is a simple color picker [Control]. It's useful for selecting a color from an RGB/RGBA colorspace.

method.name: add_preset
method.description: Adds the current selected to color to a list of colors (presets), the presets will be displayed in the color picker and the user will be able to select them, notice that the presets list is only for this color picker.

method.name: get_pick_color
method.description: Gets the current color.

method.name: is_editing_alpha
method.description: Returns whether the color has transparency or not.

method.name: is_raw_mode
method.description: Returns whether this color picker is in raw mode or not, raw mode will allow the color R, G, B component values to go beyond 1, you have to consider that the max value for color components is 1, going beyond that value will not have effect in the color, but can be used for special operations that require it (like tinting without darkening or rendering sprites in HDR).

method.name: set_edit_alpha
method.description: Set true if you want the color to have an alpha channel (transparency), or false if you want a solid color.

method.name: set_pick_color
method.description: Select the current color.

method.name: set_raw_mode
method.description: Set whether this color picker is using raw mode or not, see [method is_raw_mode].

signal.name: color_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the color is changed.

class.name: ColorPickerButton
class.description: Encapsulates a [ColorPicker] making it accesible by pressing a button, pressing the button will toggle the [ColorPicker] visibility

method.name: is_editing_alpha
method.description: See [method ColorPicker.is_edit_alpha]

method.name: set_edit_alpha
method.description: See [method ColorPicker.set_edit_alpha]

signal.name: color_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the color is changed.

class.name: ColorRamp
class.description: Given a set of colors, this node will interpolate them in order, meaning, that if you have color 1, color 2 and color3, the ramp will interpolate (generate the colors between two colors) from color 1 to color 2 and from color 2 to color 3. Initially the ramp will have 2 colors (black and white), one (black) at ramp lower offset offset 0 and the other (white) at the ramp higher offset 1.

method.name: add_point
method.description: Adds the specified color to the end of the ramp, with the specified offset

method.name: get_color
method.description: Returns the color of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

method.name: get_colors
method.description: Returns the colors in the ramp

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Returns the offset of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

method.name: get_offsets
method.description: Returns the offsets for the colors in this ramp

method.name: get_point_count
method.description: Returns the number of colors in the ramp

method.name: interpolate
method.description: Returns the interpolated color specified by [i]offset[/i]

method.name: remove_point
method.description: Removes the color at the index [i]offset[/i]

method.name: set_color
method.description: Sets the color of the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

method.name: set_colors
method.description: Sets the colors for the specified amount of elements. Calling this function with a different number of elements than previously defined causes the ramp to resize its colors and offsets array to accommodate the new elements.

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Sets the offset for the ramp color at index [i]point[/i]

method.name: set_offsets
method.description: Sets the offset for the specified amount of elements. Calling this function with a different number of elements than previously defined causes the ramp to resize its colors and offsets array to accommodate the new elements, all new colors will be black by default.

class.name: ConcavePolygonShape
class.description: Concave polygon shape resource, which can be set into a [PhysicsBody] or area. This shape is created by feeding a list of triangles.

method.name: get_faces
method.description: Return the faces (an array of triangles).

method.name: set_faces
method.description: Set the faces (an array of triangles).

class.name: ConcavePolygonShape2D
class.brief_description: Concave polygon 2D shape resource for physics.
class.description: Concave polygon 2D shape resource for physics. It is made out of segments and is very optimal for complex polygonal concave collisions. It is really not advised to use for [RigidBody2D] nodes. A CollisionPolygon2D in convex decomposition mode (solids) or several convex objects are advised for that instead. Otherwise, a concave polygon 2D shape is better for static collisions. The main difference between a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] and a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] is that a concave polygon assumes it is concave and uses a more complex method of collision detection, and a convex one forces itself to be convex in order to speed up collision detection.

method.name: get_segments
method.description: Return the array of segments.

method.name: set_segments
method.description: Set the array of segments.

class.name: ConfigFile
class.brief_description: Helper class to handle INI-style files.
class.description: This helper class can be used to store [Variant] values on the filesystem using an INI-style formatting. The stored values as referenced by a section and a key. The stored data can be saved to or parsed from a file, though ConfigFile objects can also be used directly with accessing the filesystem. The following example shows how to parse a INI-style file from the system, read its contents and store new values in it: [codeblock] var config = ConfigFile.new() var err = config.load("user://settings.cfg") if err == OK: # if not, something went wrong with the file loading # Look for the display/width pair, and default to 1024 if missing var screen_width = get_value("display", "width", 1024) # Store a variable if and only it hasn't been defined yet if not config.has_section_key("audio", "mute"): config.set_value("audio", "mute", false) # Save the changes by overwriting the previous file config.save("user://settings.cfg") [/codeblock]

method.name: get_section_keys
method.description: Return an array of all defined key identifiers in the specified section.

method.name: get_sections
method.description: Return an array of all defined section identifiers.

method.name: get_value
method.description: Return the current value for the specified section and key. If the section and/or the key do not exist, the method returns the value of the optional [i]default[/i] argument (and thus [code]NULL[/code] if not specified).

method.name: has_section
method.description: Check if the specified section exists.

method.name: has_section_key
method.description: Check if the specified section-key pair exists.

method.name: load
method.description: Load the config file specified as a parameter. The file's contents are parsed and loaded in the ConfigFile object from which the method was called. The return value is one of the OK, FAILED or ERR_* constants listed in [@Global Scope] (if the load was successful, it returns OK).

method.name: save
method.description: Save the contents of the ConfigFile object to the file specified as a parameter. The output file uses an INI-style structure. The return value is one of the OK, FAILED or ERR_* constants listed in [@Global Scope] (if the save was successful, it returns OK).

method.name: set_value
method.description: Assign a value to the specified key of the the specified section. If the section and/or the key do not exist, they are created. Passing a [code]NULL[/code] value deletes the specified key if it exists (and deletes the section if it ends up empty once the key has been removed).

class.name: ConfirmationDialog
class.description: Dialog for confirmation of actions. This dialog inherits from [AcceptDialog], but has by default an OK and Cancel button (in host OS order).

method.name: get_cancel
method.description: Return the cancel button.

class.name: Container
class.description: Base node for containers. A [Container] contains other controls and automatically arranges them in a certain way. A Control can inherit this to create custom container classes.

method.name: fit_child_in_rect
method.description: Fit a child control in a given rect. This is mainly a helper for creating custom container classes.

method.name: queue_sort
method.description: Queue resort of the contained children. This is called automatically anyway, but can be called upon request.

signal.name: sort_children
signal.description: Emitted when sorting the children is needed.

constants.constant: Notification for when sorting the children, it must be obeyed immediately.

class.name: Control
class.brief_description: Control is the base node for all the GUI components.
class.description: Control is the base class Node for all the GUI components. Every GUI component inherits from it, directly or indirectly. In this way, sections of the scene tree made of contiguous control nodes, become user interfaces. Controls are relative to the parent position and size by using anchors and margins. This ensures that they can adapt easily in most situation to changing dialog and screen sizes. When more flexibility is desired, [Container] derived nodes can be used. Anchors work by defining which margin do they follow, and a value relative to it. Allowed anchoring modes are ANCHOR_BEGIN, where the margin is relative to the top or left margins of the parent (in pixels), ANCHOR_END for the right and bottom margins of the parent and ANCHOR_RATIO, which is a ratio from 0 to 1 in the parent range. Input device events ([InputEvent]) are first sent to the root controls via the [method Node._input], which distribute it through the tree, then delivers them to the adequate one (under cursor or keyboard focus based) by calling [method MainLoop._input_event]. There is no need to enable input processing on controls to receive such events. To ensure that no one else will receive the event (not even [method Node._unhandled_input]), the control can accept it by calling [method accept_event]. Only one control can hold the keyboard focus (receiving keyboard events), for that the control must define the focus mode with [method set_focus_mode]. Focus is lost when another control gains it, or the current focus owner is hidden. It is sometimes desired for a control to ignore mouse/pointer events. This is often the case when placing other controls on top of a button, in such cases. Calling [method set_ignore_mouse] enables this function. Finally, controls are skinned according to a [Theme]. Setting a [Theme] on a control will propagate all the skinning down the tree. Optionally, skinning can be overridden per each control by calling the add_*_override functions, or from the editor.

method.name: _get_minimum_size
method.description: Return the minimum size this Control can shrink to. A control will never be displayed or resized smaller than its minimum size.

method.name: _gui_input
method.description: Called when an input event reaches the control.

method.name: accept_event
method.description: Handles the event, no other control will receive it and it will not be sent to nodes waiting on [method Node._unhandled_input] or [method Node._unhandled_key_input].

method.name: add_constant_override
method.description: Override a single constant (integer) in the theme of this Control. If constant equals Theme.INVALID_CONSTANT, override is cleared.

method.name: add_font_override
method.description: Override a single font (font) in the theme of this Control. If font is empty, override is cleared.

method.name: add_icon_override
method.description: Override a single icon ([Texture]) in the theme of this Control. If texture is empty, override is cleared.

method.name: add_style_override
method.description: Override a single stylebox ([Stylebox]) in the theme of this Control. If stylebox is empty, override is cleared.

method.name: get_anchor
method.description: Return the anchor type (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) for a given margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM).

method.name: get_cursor_shape
method.description: Return the cursor shape at a certain position in the control.

method.name: get_default_cursor_shape
method.description: Return the default cursor shape for this control. See enum CURSOR_* for the list of shapes.

method.name: get_end
method.description: Returns MARGIN_LEFT and MARGIN_TOP at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: get_focus_mode
method.description: Returns the focus access mode for the control (FOCUS_NONE, FOCUS_CLICK, FOCUS_ALL) (see [method set_focus_mode]).

method.name: get_focus_neighbour
method.description: Return the forced neighbour for moving the input focus to. When pressing TAB or directional/joypad directions focus is moved to the next control in that direction. However, the neighbour to move to can be forced with this function.

method.name: get_focus_owner
method.description: Return which control is owning the keyboard focus, or null if no one.

method.name: get_global_pos
method.description: Returns the Control position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control and independent of the anchor mode.

method.name: get_global_rect
method.description: Return position and size of the Control, relative to the top-left corner of the [i]window[/i] Control. This is a helper (see [method get_global_pos], [method get_size]).

method.name: get_h_size_flags
method.description: Hint for containers, return horizontal positioning flags.

method.name: get_margin
method.description: Return a margin offset. Margin can be one of (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Offset value being returned depends on the anchor mode.

method.name: get_minimum_size
method.description: Return the minimum size this Control can shrink to. A control will never be displayed or resized smaller than its minimum size.

method.name: get_mouse_filter
method.description: Return when the control is ignoring mouse events (even touchpad events send mouse events).

method.name: get_pos
method.description: Returns the Control position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control and independent of the anchor mode.

method.name: get_rect
method.description: Return position and size of the Control, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control. This is a helper (see [method get_pos], [method get_size]).

method.name: get_size
method.description: Returns the size of the Control, computed from all margins, however the size returned will [b]never be smaller than the minimum size reported by [method get_minimum_size][/b]. This means that even if end position of the Control rectangle is smaller than the begin position, the Control will still display and interact correctly. (see description, [method get_minimum_size], [method set_margin], [method set_anchor]).

method.name: get_stretch_ratio
method.description: Hint for containers, return the stretch ratio. This value is relative to other stretch ratio, so if this control has 2 and another has 1, this one will be twice as big.

method.name: get_theme
method.description: Return a [Theme] override, if one exists (see [method set_theme]).

method.name: get_tooltip
method.description: Return the tooltip, which will appear when the cursor is resting over this control.

method.name: get_v_size_flags
method.description: Hint for containers, return vertical positioning flags.

method.name: grab_focus
method.description: Steal the focus from another control and become the focused control (see [method set_focus_mode]).

method.name: has_focus
method.description: Return whether the Control is the current focused control (see [method set_focus_mode]).

method.name: release_focus
method.description: Give up the focus, no other control will be able to receive keyboard input.

method.name: set_anchor
method.description: Change the anchor (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) type for a margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Changing the anchor mode converts the current margin offset from the previous anchor mode to the new one, so margin offsets ([method set_margin]) must be done after setting anchors, or at the same time ([method set_anchor_and_margin]) Additionally, [code]keep_margin[/code] controls whether margins should be left the same, or changed to keep the same position and size on-screen.

method.name: set_anchor_and_margin
method.description: Change the anchor (ANCHOR_BEGIN, ANCHOR_END, ANCHOR_RATIO) type for a margin (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM), and also set its offset. This is a helper (see [method set_anchor] and [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_area_as_parent_rect
method.description: Change all margins and anchors, so this Control always takes up the same area as the parent Control. This is a helper (see [method set_anchor], [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_begin
method.description: Sets MARGIN_LEFT and MARGIN_TOP at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_default_cursor_shape
method.description: Set the default cursor shape for this control. See enum CURSOR_* for the list of shapes.

method.name: set_end
method.description: Sets MARGIN_RIGHT and MARGIN_BOTTOM at the same time. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_focus_mode
method.description: Set the focus access mode for the control (FOCUS_NONE, FOCUS_CLICK, FOCUS_ALL). Only one Control can be focused at the same time, and it will receive keyboard signals.

method.name: set_focus_neighbour
method.description: Force a neighbour for moving the input focus to. When pressing TAB or directional/joypad directions focus is moved to the next control in that direction. However, the neighbour to move to can be forced with this function.

method.name: set_global_pos
method.description: Move the Control to a new position, relative to the top-left corner of the [i]window[/i] Control, and without changing current anchor mode. (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_h_size_flags
method.description: Hint for containers, set horizontal positioning flags.

method.name: set_margin
method.description: Set a margin offset. Margin can be one of (MARGIN_LEFT, MARGIN_TOP, MARGIN_RIGHT, MARGIN_BOTTOM). Offset value being set depends on the anchor mode.

method.name: set_mouse_filter
method.description: Set when the control is ignoring mouse events (even touchpad events send mouse events). (see the MOUSE_FILTER_* constants)

method.name: set_pos
method.description: Move the Control to a new position, relative to the top-left corner of the parent Control, changing all margins if needed and without changing current anchor mode. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_size
method.description: Changes MARGIN_RIGHT and MARGIN_BOTTOM to fit a given size. This is a helper (see [method set_margin]).

method.name: set_stretch_ratio
method.description: Hint for containers, set the stretch ratio. This value is relative to other stretch ratio, so if this control has 2 and another has 1, this one will be twice as big.

method.name: set_theme
method.description: Override whole the [Theme] for this Control and all its children controls.

method.name: set_tooltip
method.description: Set a tooltip, which will appear when the cursor is resting over this control.

method.name: set_v_size_flags
method.description: Hint for containers, set vertical positioning flags.

method.name: show_modal
method.description: Display a Control as modal. Control must be a subwindow. Modal controls capture the input signals until closed or the area outside them is accessed. When a modal control loses focus, or the ESC key is pressed, they automatically hide. Modal controls are used extensively for popup dialogs and menus.

signal.name: focus_entered
signal.description: Emitted when keyboard focus is gained.

signal.name: focus_exited
signal.description: Emitted when the keyboard focus is lost.

signal.name: gui_input
signal.description: Emitted when an input event is received. Connecting in realtime is recommended for accepting the events.

signal.name: minimum_size_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the minimum size of the control changed.

signal.name: mouse_entered
signal.description: Emitted when the mouse enters the control area.

signal.name: mouse_exited
signal.description: Emitted when the mouse left the control area.

signal.name: resized
signal.description: Emitted when the control changed size.

signal.name: size_flags_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the size flags changed.

constants.constant: X is relative to MARGIN_LEFT, Y is relative to MARGIN_TOP.
X is relative to -MARGIN_RIGHT, Y is relative to -MARGIN_BOTTOM.
Control can acquire focus only if clicked.
Control can acquire focus if clicked, or by pressing TAB/Directionals in the keyboard from another Control.
Control changed size (get_size() reports the new size).
Mouse pointer entered the area of the Control.
Mouse pointer exited the area of the Control.

class.name: ConvexPolygonShape
class.description: Convex polygon shape resource, which can be set into a [PhysicsBody] or area.

class.name: ConvexPolygonShape2D
class.description: Convex Polygon Shape for 2D physics. A convex polygon, whatever its shape, is internally decomposed into as many convex polygons as needed to ensure all collision checks against it are always done on convex polygons (which are faster to check). The main difference between a [ConvexPolygonShape2D] and a [ConcavePolygonShape2D] is that a concave polygon assumes it is concave and uses a more complex method of collision detection, and a convex one forces itself to be convex in order to speed up collision detection.

method.name: get_points
method.description: Return a list of points in either clockwise or counter clockwise order, forming a convex polygon.

method.name: set_point_cloud
method.description: Currently, this method does nothing.

method.name: set_points
method.description: Set a list of points in either clockwise or counter clockwise order, forming a convex polygon.

class.name: Curve2D
class.brief_description: Describes a Bezier curve in 2D space.
class.description: This class describes a Bezier curve in 2D space. It is mainly used to give a shape to a [Path2D], but can be manually sampled for other purposes. It keeps a cache of precalculated points along the curve, to speed further calculations up.

method.name: add_point
method.description: Adds a point to a curve, at position "pos", with control points "in" and "out". If "atpos" is given, the point is inserted before the point number "atpos", moving that point (and every point after) after the inserted point. If "atpos" is not given, or is an illegal value (atpos <0 or atpos >= [method get_point_count]), the point will be appended at the end of the point list.

method.name: get_bake_interval
method.description: Returns the distance between two adjacent cached points.

method.name: get_baked_length
method.description: Returns the total length of the curve, based on the cached points. Given enough density (see [method set_bake_interval]), it should be approximate enough.

method.name: get_baked_points
method.description: Returns the cache of points as a [PoolVector2Array].

method.name: get_point_count
method.description: Returns the number of points describing the curve.

method.name: get_point_in
method.description: Returns the position of the control point leading to the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

method.name: get_point_out
method.description: Returns the position of the control point leading out of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

method.name: get_point_pos
method.description: Returns the position of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

method.name: interpolate
method.description: Returns the position between the vertex "idx" and the vertex "idx"+1, where "t" controls if the point is the first vertex (t = 0.0), the last vertex (t = 1.0), or in between. Values of "t" outside the range (0.0 >= t <=1) give strange, but predictable results. If "idx" is out of bounds it is truncated to the first or last vertex, and "t" is ignored. If the curve has no points, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0).

method.name: interpolate_baked
method.description: Returns a point within the curve at position "offset", where "offset" is measured as a pixel distance along the curve. To do that, it finds the two cached points where the "offset" lies between, then interpolates the values. This interpolation is cubic if "cubic" is set to true, or linear if set to false. Cubic interpolation tends to follow the curves better, but linear is faster (and often, precise enough).

method.name: interpolatef
method.description: Returns the position at the vertex "fofs". It calls [method interpolate] using the integer part of fofs as "idx", and its fractional part as "t".

method.name: remove_point
method.description: Deletes the point "idx" from the curve. Sends an error to the console if "idx" is out of bounds.

method.name: set_bake_interval
method.description: Sets the distance in pixels between two adjacent cached points. Changing it forces the cache to be recomputed the next time a xxx_baked_xxx function is called. The less distance, the more points the cache will have, and the more memory it will consume, so use with care.

method.name: set_point_in
method.description: Sets the position of the control point leading to the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

method.name: set_point_out
method.description: Sets the position of the control point leading out of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

method.name: set_point_pos
method.description: Sets the position for the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

method.name: tesselate
method.description: Returns a list of points along the curve, with a curvature controlled point density. That is, the curvier parts will have more points than the straighter parts. This approximation makes straight segments between each point, then subdivides those segments until the resulting shape is similar enough. "max_stages" controls how many subdivisions a curve segment may face before it is considered approximate enough. Each subdivision splits the segment in half, so the default 5 stages may mean up to 32 subdivisions per curve segment. Increase with care! "tolerance_degrees" controls how many degrees the midpoint of a segment may deviate from the real curve, before the segment has to be subdivided.

class.name: Curve3D
class.brief_description: Describes a Bezier curve in 3D space.
class.description: This class describes a Bezier curve in 3D space. It is mainly used to give a shape to a [Path], but can be manually sampled for other purposes. It keeps a cache of precalculated points along the curve, to speed further calculations up.

method.name: add_point
method.description: Adds a point to a curve, at position "pos", with control points "in" and "out". If "atpos" is given, the point is inserted before the point number "atpos", moving that point (and every point after) after the inserted point. If "atpos" is not given, or is an illegal value (atpos <0 or atpos >= [method get_point_count]), the point will be appended at the end of the point list.

method.name: get_bake_interval
method.description: Returns the distance between two adjacent cached points.

method.name: get_baked_length
method.description: Returns the total length of the curve, based on the cached points. Given enough density (see [method set_bake_interval]), it should be approximate enough.

method.name: get_baked_points
method.description: Returns the cache of points as a [PoolVector3Array].

method.name: get_baked_tilts
method.description: Returns the cache of tilts as a [RealArray].

method.name: get_point_count
method.description: Returns the number of points describing the curve.

method.name: get_point_in
method.description: Returns the position of the control point leading to the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0, 0).

method.name: get_point_out
method.description: Returns the position of the control point leading out of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0, 0).

method.name: get_point_pos
method.description: Returns the position of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0, 0).

method.name: get_point_tilt
method.description: Returns the tilt angle in radians for the point "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console, and returns 0.

method.name: interpolate
method.description: Returns the position between the vertex "idx" and the vertex "idx"+1, where "t" controls if the point is the first vertex (t = 0.0), the last vertex (t = 1.0), or in between. Values of "t" outside the range (0.0 >= t <=1) give strange, but predictable results. If "idx" is out of bounds it is truncated to the first or last vertex, and "t" is ignored. If the curve has no points, the function sends an error to the console, and returns (0, 0, 0).

method.name: interpolate_baked
method.description: Returns a point within the curve at position "offset", where "offset" is measured as a distance in 3D units along the curve. To do that, it finds the two cached points where the "offset" lies between, then interpolates the values. This interpolation is cubic if "cubic" is set to true, or linear if set to false. Cubic interpolation tends to follow the curves better, but linear is faster (and often, precise enough).

method.name: interpolatef
method.description: Returns the position at the vertex "fofs". It calls [method interpolate] using the integer part of fofs as "idx", and its fractional part as "t".

method.name: remove_point
method.description: Deletes the point "idx" from the curve. Sends an error to the console if "idx" is out of bounds.

method.name: set_bake_interval
method.description: Sets the distance in 3D units between two adjacent cached points. Changing it forces the cache to be recomputed the next time a xxx_baked_xxx function is called. The less distance, the more points the cache will have, and the more memory it will consume, so use with care.

method.name: set_point_in
method.description: Sets the position of the control point leading to the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

method.name: set_point_out
method.description: Sets the position of the control point leading out of the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

method.name: set_point_pos
method.description: Sets the position for the vertex "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console.

method.name: set_point_tilt
method.description: Sets the tilt angle in radians for the point "idx". If the index is out of bounds, the function sends an error to the console. The tilt controls the rotation along the look-at axis an object traveling the path would have. In the case of a curve controlling a [PathFollow], this tilt is an offset over the natural tilt the PathFollow calculates.

method.name: tesselate
method.description: Returns a list of points along the curve, with a curvature controlled point density. That is, the curvier parts will have more points than the straighter parts. This approximation makes straight segments between each point, then subdivides those segments until the resulting shape is similar enough. "max_stages" controls how many subdivisions a curve segment may face before it is considered approximate enough. Each subdivision splits the segment in half, so the default 5 stages may mean up to 32 subdivisions per curve segment. Increase with care! "tolerance_degrees" controls how many degrees the midpoint of a segment may deviate from the real curve, before the segment has to be subdivided.

class.name: DampedSpringJoint2D
class.description: Damped spring constraint for 2D physics. This resembles a spring joint that always wants to go back to a given length.

method.name: get_damping
method.description: Return the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).

method.name: get_length
method.description: Return the maximum length of the spring joint.

method.name: get_rest_length
method.description: Return the resting length of the spring joint. The joint will always try to go to back this length when pulled apart.

method.name: get_stiffness
method.description: Return the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.

method.name: set_damping
method.description: Set the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).

method.name: set_length
method.description: Set the maximum length of the spring joint.

method.name: set_rest_length
method.description: Set the resting length of the spring joint. The joint will always try to go to back this length when pulled apart.

method.name: set_stiffness
method.description: Set the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.

class.name: Dictionary
class.description: Dictionary type. Associative container which contains values referenced by unique keys. Dictionaries are always passed by reference.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the dictionary, removing all key/value pairs.

method.name: empty
method.description: Return true if the dictionary is empty.

method.name: erase
method.description: Erase a dictionary key/value pair by key.

method.name: has
method.description: Return true if the dictionary has a given key.

method.name: has_all
method.description: Return true if the dictionary has all of the keys in the given array.

method.name: hash
method.description: Return a hashed integer value representing the dictionary contents.

method.name: keys
method.description: Return the list of keys in the [Dictionary].

method.name: size
method.description: Return the size of the dictionary (in pairs).

method.name: values
method.description: Return the list of values in the [Dictionary].

class.name: DirectionalLight
class.brief_description: Directional Light, such as the Sun or the Moon.
class.description: A DirectionalLight is a type of [Light] node that emits light constantly in one direction (the negative z axis of the node). It is used lights with strong intensity that are located far away from the scene to model sunlight or moonlight. The worldspace location of the DirectionalLight transform (origin) is ignored, only the basis is used do determine light direction.

class.name: Directory
class.brief_description: Type used to handle the filesystem.

method.name: change_dir
method.description: Change the currently opened directory to the one passed as an argument. The argument can be relative to the current directory (e.g. [code]newdir[/code] or [code]../newdir[/code]), or an absolute path (e.g. [code]/tmp/newdir[/code] or [code]res://somedir/newdir[/code]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or ERR_*).

method.name: copy
method.description: Copy the [i]from[/i] file to the [i]to[/i] destination. Both arguments should be paths to files, either relative or absolute. If the destination file exists and is not access-protected, it will be overwritten. Returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

method.name: current_is_dir
method.description: Return whether the current item processed with the last [method get_next] call is a directory ([code].[/code] and [code]..[/code] are considered directories).

method.name: dir_exists
method.description: Return whether the target directory exists. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path.

method.name: file_exists
method.description: Return whether the target file exists. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path.

method.name: get_current_dir
method.description: Return the absolute path to the currently opened directory (e.g. [code]res://folder[/code] or [code]C:\tmp\folder[/code]).

method.name: get_drive
method.description: On Windows, return the name of the drive (partition) passed as an argument (e.g. [code]C:[/code]). On other platforms, or if the requested drive does not existed, the method returns an empty String.

method.name: get_drive_count
method.description: On Windows, return the number of drives (partitions) mounted on the current filesystem. On other platforms, the method returns 0.

method.name: get_next
method.description: Return the next element (file or directory) in the current directory (including [code].[/code] and [code]..[/code], unless [code]skip_navigational[/code] was given to [method list_dir_begin]). The name of the file or directory is returned (and not its full path). Once the stream has been fully processed, the method returns an empty String and closes the stream automatically (i.e. [method list_dir_end] would not be mandatory in such a case).

method.name: get_space_left
method.description: On Unix desktop systems, return the available space on the current directory's disk. On other platforms, this information is not available and the method returns 0 or -1.

method.name: list_dir_begin
method.description: Initialise the stream used to list all files and directories using the [method get_next] function, closing the current opened stream if needed. Once the stream has been processed, it should typically be closed with [method list_dir_end]. If you pass [code]skip_navigational[/code], then [code].[/code] and [code]..[/code] would be filtered out. If you pass [code]skip_hidden[/code], then hidden files would be filtered out.

method.name: list_dir_end
method.description: Close the current stream opened with [method list_dir_begin] (whether it has been fully processed with [method get_next] or not does not matter).

method.name: make_dir
method.description: Create a directory. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. The target directory should be placed in an already existing directory (to create the full path recursively, see [method make_dir_recursive]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

method.name: make_dir_recursive
method.description: Create a target directory and all necessary intermediate directories in its path, by calling [method make_dir] recursively. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK, FAILED or ERR_*).

method.name: open
method.description: Open an existing directory of the filesystem. The [i]path[/i] argument can be within the project tree ([code]res://folder[/code]), the user directory ([code]user://folder[/code]) or an absolute path of the user filesystem (e.g. [code]/tmp/folder[/code] or [code]C:\tmp\folder[/code]). The method returns one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or ERR_*).

method.name: remove
method.description: Delete the target file or an empty directory. The argument can be relative to the current directory, or an absolute path. If the target directory is not empty, the operation will fail. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or FAILED).

method.name: rename
method.description: Rename (move) the [i]from[/i] file to the [i]to[/i] destination. Both arguments should be paths to files, either relative or absolute. If the destination file exists and is not access-protected, it will be overwritten. Return one of the error code constants defined in [@Global Scope] (OK or FAILED).

class.name: EditorFileSystem
class.brief_description: Resource filesystem, as the editor sees it.
class.description: This object holds information of all resources in the filesystem, their types, etc.

method.name: get_file_type
method.description: Get the type of the file, given the full path.

method.name: get_filesystem
method.description: Get the root directory object.

method.name: get_scanning_progress
method.description: Return the scan progress for 0 to 1 if the FS is being scanned.

method.name: is_scanning
method.description: Return true of the filesystem is being scanned.

method.name: scan
method.description: Scan the filesystem for changes.

method.name: scan_sources
method.description: Check if the source of any imported resource changed.

method.name: update_file
method.description: Update a file information. Call this if an external program (not Godot) modified the file.

signal.name: filesystem_changed
signal.description: Emitted if the filesystem changed.

signal.name: sources_changed
signal.description: Emitted if the source of any imported file changed.

class.name: EditorFileSystemDirectory
class.brief_description: A diretory for the resource filesystem.

class.name: EditorPlugin
class.brief_description: Used by the editor to extend its functionality.
class.description: Plugins are used by the editor to extend functionality. The most common types of plugins are those which edit a given node or resource type, import plugins and export plugins.

method.name: add_control_to_bottom_panel
method.description: Add a control to the bottom panel (together with Output, Debug, Animation, etc). Returns a reference to the button added. It's up to you to hide/show the button when needed. If your plugin is being removed, also make sure to remove your control by calling [method remove_control_from_bottom_panel].

method.name: add_control_to_container
method.description: Add a custom control to a container (see CONTAINER_* enum). There are many locations where custom controls can be added in the editor UI. Please remember that you have to manage the visibility of your custom controls yourself (and likely hide it after adding it). If your plugin is being removed, also make sure to remove your custom controls too.

method.name: add_control_to_dock
method.description: Add the control to a specific dock slot (see DOCK_* enum for options). If the dock is repositioned and as long as the plugin is active, the editor will save the dock position on further sessions. If your plugin is being removed, also make sure to remove your control by calling [method remove_control_from_docks].

method.name: add_custom_type
method.description: Add a custom type, which will appear in the list of nodes or resources. An icon can be optionally passed. When given node or resource is selected, the base type will be instanced (ie, "Spatial", "Control", "Resource"), then the script will be loaded and set to this object. You can use the [method EditorPlugin.handles] to check if your custom object is being edited by checking the script or using 'extends' keyword. During run-time, this will be a simple object with a script so this function does not need to be called then.

method.name: apply_changes
method.description: This method is called when the editor is about to save the project, switch to another tab, etc. It asks the plugin to apply any pending state changes to ensure consistency. This is used, for example, in shader editors to let the plugin know that it must apply the shader code being written by the user to the object.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear all the state and reset the object being edited to zero. This ensures your plugin does not keep editing a currently existing node, or a node from the wrong scene.

method.name: create_spatial_gizmo
method.description: This is used for plugins that create gizmos used by the spatial editor. Just check that the node passed in the "for_spatial" argument matches your plugin.

method.name: edit
method.description: This function is used for plugins that edit specific object types (nodes or resources). It requests the editor to edit the given object.

method.name: forward_canvas_gui_input
method.description: If your plugin is active (because handles() returned true to the object), any input interaction with the 2D canvas editor will be first forwarded here. The canvas transform (containing zoom and offset to transform to edited world coordinates) is provided, but the input supplied is in untransformed coordinates to the canvas editor. Return true if you want to eat this event and not pass it to the canvas editor.

method.name: forward_draw_over_canvas
method.description: This function is called every time the 2D canvas editor draws (which overlays over the edited scene). Drawing over the supplied control will draw over the edited scene. To convert from control coordinates to edited scene coordinates (including zoom and offset), a transform is also provided. If you require this control to be redraw, call [method update_canvas].

method.name: forward_spatial_gui_input
method.description: This is a low level function for plugins that edit a given objet type derived from Spatial to capture the input of the viewport. The function is only being called if your object is being edited. By using the [InputEvent] and the [Camera] arguments it's pretty easy to do raycasts into space using Camera functions. Return true if you want to capture the input, otherwise false.

method.name: get_base_control
method.description: Get a base control where it's safe to place dialogs. Many plugins open dialogs and they need a control as a base to make sure they use the editor icons and theme.

method.name: get_breakpoints
method.description: This is for editors that edit script based objects. You can return a list of breakpoints in the format (script:line), for example: res://path_to_script.gd:25

method.name: get_editor_settings
method.description: Get the general settings for the editor (the same window that appears in the Settings menu).

method.name: get_editor_viewport
method.description: Get the main editor control. Use this as a parent for main screens.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Get the name of the editor plugin. For main scren plugins this is what will appear in the selector (which by default is 2D, 3D, Script).

method.name: get_resource_filesystem
method.description: Get the filesystem cache for all resources in the project.

method.name: get_resource_previewer
method.description: Get tool for generating resource previews.

method.name: get_selection
method.description: Get the object that handles the selection of nodes in the Scene Tree editor.

method.name: get_state
method.description: Get the state of your plugin editor. This is used when saving the scene (so state is kept when opening it again) and for switching tabs (so state can be restored when the tab returns).

method.name: get_undo_redo
method.description: Get the undo/redo object. Most actions in the editor can be undoable, so use this object to make sure this happens when it's worth it.

method.name: get_window_layout
method.description: Get the GUI layout of the plugin. This is used to save the project's editor layout when the [method EditorPlugin.queue_save_layout] is called or the editor layout was changed(For example changing the position of a dock).

method.name: handles
method.description: Implement this function if your plugin edits a specific type of object (Resource or Node). If you return true, then you will get the functions [method EditorPlugin.edit] and [method EditorPlugin.make_visible] called when the editor requests them.

method.name: has_main_screen
method.description: Return true if this is a main screen editor plugin (it goes in the main screen selector together with 2D, 3D, Script).

method.name: inspect_object
method.description: Inspect an object in the inspector.

method.name: make_visible
method.description: This function will be called when the editor is requested to become visible. It is used for plugins that edit a specific object type. Remember that you have to manage the visibility of all your editor controls manually.

method.name: queue_save_layout
method.description: Queue save the project's editor layout.

method.name: remove_control_from_bottom_panel
method.description: Remove the control from the bottom panel. Don't forget to call this if you added one, so the editor can remove it cleanly.

method.name: remove_control_from_docks
method.description: Remove the control from the dock. Don't forget to call this if you added one, so the editor can save the layout and remove it cleanly.

method.name: remove_custom_type
method.description: Remove a custom type added by [method EditorPlugin.add_custom_type]

method.name: save_external_data
method.description: This method is called after the editor saves the project or when it's closed. It asks the plugin to save edited external scenes/resources.

method.name: set_state
method.description: Restore the state saved by [method EditorPlugin.get_state].

method.name: set_window_layout
method.description: Restore the plugin GUI layout saved by [method EditorPlugin.get_window_layout].

method.name: update_canvas
method.description: Updates the control used to draw the edited scene over the 2D canvas. This is used together with [method forward_canvas_input_event].

class.name: EditorResourcePreview
class.brief_description: Helper to generate previews of reources or files.
class.description: This object is used to generate previews for resources of files.

method.name: add_preview_generator
method.description: Create an own, custom preview generator.

method.name: check_for_invalidation
method.description: Check if the resource changed, if so it will be invalidated and the corresponding signal emitted.

method.name: queue_edited_resource_preview
method.description: Queue a resource being edited for preview (using an instance). Once the preview is ready, your receiver.receiver_func will be called either containing the preview texture or an empty texure (if no preview was possible). Callback must have the format: (path,texture,userdata). Userdata can be anything.

method.name: queue_resource_preview
method.description: Queue a resource file for preview (using a path). Once the preview is ready, your receiver.receiver_func will be called either containing the preview texture or an empty texure (if no preview was possible). Callback must have the format: (path,texture,userdata). Userdata can be anything.

method.name: remove_preview_generator
method.description: Remove a custom preview generator.

signal.name: preview_invalidated
signal.description: If a preview was invalidated (changed) this signal will emit (using the path of the preview)

class.name: EditorResourcePreviewGenerator
class.description: Custom code to generate previews. Please check "file_dialog/thumbnail_size" in EditorSettings to find out the right size to do previews at.

method.name: generate
method.description: Generate a preview from a given resource. This must be always implemented. Returning an empty texture is an OK way to fail and let another generator take care. Care must be taken because this function is always called from a thread (not the main thread).

method.name: generate_from_path
method.description: Generate a preview directly from a path, implementing this is optional, as default code will load and call generate() Returning an empty texture is an OK way to fail and let another generator take care. Care must be taken because this function is always called from a thread (not the main thread).

method.name: handles
method.description: Return if your generator supports this resource type.

class.name: EditorScript
class.brief_description: Simple script to perform changes in the currently edited scene.
class.description: This script can be run from the Scene -> Run Script menu option.

class.name: EditorSelection
class.brief_description: Manages the SceneTree selection in the editor.
class.description: This object manages the SceneTree selection in the editor.

method.name: add_node
method.description: Add a node to the selection.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the selection.

method.name: get_selected_nodes
method.description: Get the list of selectes nodes.

method.name: get_transformable_selected_nodes
method.description: Get the list of selected nodes, optimized for transform operations (ie, moving them, rotating, etc). This list avoids situations where a node is selected and also chid/grandchild.

method.name: remove_node
method.description: Remove a node from the selection.

signal.name: selection_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the selection changes.

class.name: EditorSettings
class.brief_description: Object that holds the project-independent editor settings.
class.description: Object that holds the project-independent editor settings. These settings are generally visible in the Editor Settings menu. Accessing the settings is done by using the regular [Object] API, such as: [codeblock] settings.set(prop,value) settings.get(prop) list_of_settings = settings.get_property_list() [/codeblock]

method.name: add_property_info
erase
method.description: Erase a given setting (pass full property path).

method.name: get_favorite_dirs
method.description: Get the list of favorite directories for this project.

method.name: get_project_settings_path
method.description: Get the specific project settings path. Projects all have an unique sub-directory inside the settings path where project specific settings are saved.

method.name: get_recent_dirs
method.description: Get the list of recently visited folders in the file dialog for this project.

method.name: get_settings_path
method.description: Get the global settings path for the engine. Inside this path you can find some standard paths such as: settings/tmp - used for temporary storage of files settings/templates - where export templates are located

method.name: set_favorite_dirs
method.description: Set the list of favorite directories for this project.

method.name: set_recent_dirs
method.description: Set the list of recently visited folders in the file dialog for this project.

class.name: EditorSpatialGizmo
class.brief_description: Custom gizmo for editing Spatial objects.
class.description: Custom gizmo that is used for providing custom visualization and editing (handles) for 3D Spatial objects. These are created by [method EditorPlugin.create_spatial_gizmo].

method.name: add_collision_triangles
method.description: Add collision triangles to the gizmo for picking. A [TriangleMesh] can be generated from a regular [Mesh] too. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: add_handles
method.description: Add a list of handles (points) which can be used to deform the object being edited. There are virtual functions which will be called upon editing of these handles. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: add_lines
method.description: Add lines to the gizmo (as sets of 2 points), with a given material. The lines are used for visualizing the gizmo. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: add_mesh
method.description: Add a mesh to the gizmo, this is used for visualization. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: add_unscaled_billboard
method.description: Add an unscaled billboard for visualization. Call this function during [method redraw].

method.name: commit_handle
method.description: Commit a handle being edited (handles must have been prevously added by [method add_handles]). If the cancel parameter is true, an option to restore the edited value to the original is provided.

method.name: get_handle_name
method.description: Get the name of an edited handle (handles must have been previously added by [method add_handles]). Handles can be named for reference to the user when editing.

method.name: get_handle_value
method.description: Get actual value of a handle. This value can be anything and used for eventually undoing the motion when calling [method commit_handle]

method.name: redraw
method.description: This function is called when the Spatial this gizmo refers to changes (the [method Spatial.update_gizmo] is called).

method.name: set_handle
method.description: This function is used when the user drags a gizmo handle (previously added with [method add_handles]) in screen coordinates. The [Camera] is also provided so screen coordinates can be converted to raycasts.

method.name: set_spatial_node
method.description: Call this function once and upon creation of the gizmo, otherwise no other function will work. The argument is the node being edited by the gizmo.

method.name: get_custom_level
method.description: Returns the value of the commandline argument "-level".

method.name: get_frames_drawn
method.description: Return the total amount of frames drawn.

method.name: get_frames_per_second
method.description: Returns the frames per second of the running game.

method.name: get_iterations_per_second
method.description: Return the amount of fixed iterations per second (for fixed process and physics).

method.name: get_main_loop
method.description: Return the main loop object (see [MainLoop] and [SceneTree]).

method.name: get_version_info
method.description:
Returns the current engine version information in a Dictionary.
"major" - Holds the major version number as a String "minor" - Holds the minor version number as a String "patch" - Holds the patch version number as a String "status" - Holds the status (e.g. "beta", "rc1", "rc2", ... "stable") as a String "revision" - Holds the revision (e.g. "custom-build") as a String "string" - major + minor + patch + status + revision in a single String

method.name: set_iterations_per_second
method.description: Set the amount of fixed iterations per second (for fixed process and physics).

class.name: File
class.brief_description: Type to handle file reading and writing operations.

method.name: close
method.description: Close the currently opened file.

method.name: eof_reached
method.description: Return whether the file cursor reached the end of the file.

method.name: file_exists
method.description: Get whether or not the file in the specified path exists.

method.name: get_16
method.description: Get the next 16 bits from the file as an integer.

method.name: get_32
method.description: Get the next 32 bits from the file as an integer.

method.name: get_64
method.description: Get the next 64 bits from the file as an integer.

method.name: get_8
method.description: Get the next 8 bits from the file as an integer.

method.name: get_as_text
method.description: Get the whole file as a [String].

method.name: get_buffer
method.description: Get next len bytes of the file as a [PoolByteArray].

method.name: get_csv_line
method.description: Get the next value of the file in CSV (Comma Separated Values) format. You can pass a different delimiter to use other than the default "," (comma).

method.name: get_double
method.description: Get the next 64 bits from the file as a floating point number.

method.name: get_endian_swap
method.description: Get whether endian swap is enabled for this file.

method.name: get_error
method.description: Get the last error that happened when trying to perform operations. Compare with the [code]ERR_FILE_*[/code] constants from [@Global Scope].

method.name: get_float
method.description: Get the next 32 bits from the file as a floating point number.

method.name: get_len
method.description: Return the size of the file in bytes.

method.name: get_line
method.description: Get the next line of the file as a [String].

method.name: get_md5
method.description: Return a md5 String representing the file at the given path or an empty [String] on failure.

method.name: get_pascal_string
method.description: Get a [String] saved in Pascal format from the file.

method.name: get_pos
method.description: Return the file cursor position.

method.name: get_real
method.description: Get the next bits from the file as a floating point number.

method.name: get_sha256
method.description: Return a sha256 String representing the file at the given path or an empty [String] on failure.

method.name: get_var
method.description: Get the next Variant value from the file.

method.name: is_open
method.description: Return whether the file is currently opened.

method.name: open
method.description: Open the file for writing or reading, depending on the flags.

method.name: open_encrypted
method.description: Open an encrypted file in write or read mode. You need to pass a binary key to encrypt/decrypt it.

method.name: open_encrypted_with_pass
method.description: Open an encrypted file in write or read mode. You need to pass a password to encrypt/decrypt it.

method.name: seek
method.description: Change the file reading/writing cursor to the specified position (in bytes from the beginning of the file).

method.name: seek_end
method.description: Change the file reading/writing cursor to the specified position (in bytes from the end of the file). Note that this is an offset, so you should use negative numbers or the cursor will be at the end of the file.

method.name: set_endian_swap
method.description: Set whether to swap the endianness of the file. Enable this if you're dealing with files written in big endian machines. Note that this is about the file format, not CPU type. This is always reseted to [code]false[/code] whenever you open the file.

method.name: store_16
method.description: Store an integer as 16 bits in the file.

method.name: store_32
method.description: Store an integer as 32 bits in the file.

method.name: store_64
method.description: Store an integer as 64 bits in the file.

method.name: store_8
method.description: Store an integer as 8 bits in the file.

method.name: store_buffer
method.description: Store the given array of bytes in the file.

method.name: store_double
method.description: Store a floating point number as 64 bits in the file.

method.name: store_float
method.description: Store a floating point number as 32 bits in the file.

method.name: store_line
method.description: Store the given [String] as a line in the file.

method.name: store_pascal_string
method.description: Store the given [String] as a line in the file in Pascal format (i.e. also store the length of the string).

method.name: store_real
method.description: Store a floating point number in the file.

method.name: store_string
method.description: Store the given [String] in the file.

method.name: store_var
method.description: Store any Variant value in the file.

constants.constant: Open the file for writing. Create it if the file not exists and truncate if it exists.
Open the file for reading and writing, without truncating the file.
Open the file for reading and writing. Create it if the file not exists and truncate if it exists.

class.name: FileDialog
class.brief_description: Dialog for selecting files or directories in the filesystem.
class.description: FileDialog is a preset dialog used to choose files and directories in the filesystem. It supports filter masks.

method.name: add_filter
method.description: Add a custom filter. Filter format is: "mask ; description", example (C++): dialog->add_filter("*.png ; PNG Images");

method.name: clear_filters
method.description: Clear all the added filters in the dialog.

method.name: get_access
method.description: Return the file access permission of the dialog.

method.name: get_current_dir
method.description: Get the current working directory of the file dialog.

method.name: get_current_file
method.description: Get the current selected file of the file dialog (empty if none).

method.name: get_current_path
method.description: Get the current selected path (directory and file) of the file dialog (empty if none).

method.name: get_mode
method.description: Get the file dialog mode from the MODE_* enum.

method.name: get_vbox
method.description: Return the vertical box container of the dialog, custom controls can be added to it.

method.name: invalidate
method.description: Invalidate and update the current dialog content list.

method.name: is_showing_hidden_files
method.description: Return true if the diaog allows show hidden files.

method.name: set_access
method.description: Set the file access permission of the dialog(Must be one of [ACCESS_RESOURCES], [ACCESS_USERDATA] or [ACCESS_FILESYSTEM]).

method.name: set_current_dir
method.description: Set the current working directory of the file dialog.

method.name: set_current_file
method.description: Set the current selected file name of the file dialog.

method.name: set_current_path
method.description: Set the current selected file path of the file dialog.

method.name: set_mode
method.description: Set the file dialog mode from the MODE_* enum.

method.name: set_show_hidden_files
method.description: Set the dialog should show hidden files.

signal.name: dir_selected
signal.description: Event emitted when the user selects a directory.

signal.name: file_selected
signal.description: Event emitted when the user selects a file (double clicks it or presses the OK button).

signal.name: files_selected
signal.description: Event emitted when the user selects multiple files.

constants.constant: The dialog allows the selection of one, and only one file.
The dialog allows the selection of multiple files.
The dialog functions as a folder selector, disallowing the selection of any file.
The dialog allows the selection of a file or a directory.
The dialog will warn when a file exists.
The dialog allows the selection of file and directory.
The dialog allows ascess files under [Resource] path(res://) .
The dialog allows ascess files in whole file system.

class.name: Font
class.brief_description: Internationalized font and text drawing support.
class.description: Font contains an unicode compatible character set, as well as the ability to draw it with variable width, ascent, descent and kerning. For creating fonts from TTF files (or other font formats), see the editor support for fonts. TODO check wikipedia for graph of ascent/baseline/descent/height/etc.

method.name: draw
method.description: Draw "string" into a canvas item using the font at a given "pos" position, with "modulate" color, and optionally clipping the width. "pos" specifies the baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [i]ascent[/i] must be added to the Y axis.

method.name: draw_char
method.description: Draw character "char" into a canvas item using the font at a given "pos" position, with "modulate" color, and optionally kerning if "next" is passed. clipping the width. "pos" specifies the baseline, not the top. To draw from the top, [i]ascent[/i] must be added to the Y axis. The width used by the character is returned, making this function useful for drawing strings character by character.

method.name: get_ascent
method.description: Return the font ascent (number of pixels above the baseline).

method.name: get_descent
method.description: Return the font descent (number of pixels below the baseline).

method.name: get_height
method.description: Return the total font height (ascent plus descent) in pixels.

method.name: get_string_size
method.description: Return the size of a string, taking kerning and advance into account.

method.name: update_changes
method.description: After editing a font (changing size, ascent, char rects, etc.). Call this function to propagate changes to controls that might use it.

class.name: FuncRef
class.brief_description: Reference to a function in an object.
class.description: In GDScript, functions are not [i]first-class objects[/i]. This means it is impossible to store them directly as variables, return them from another function, or pass them as arguments. However, by creating a [FuncRef] using the [method @GDScript.funcref] function, a reference to a function in a given object can be created, passed around and called.

method.name: set_function
method.description: Set the name of the function to call on the object, without parentheses or any parameters.

method.name: set_instance
method.description: Set the object on which to call the referenced function. This object must be of a type actually inheriting from [Object], not a built-in type such as [int], [Vector2] or [Dictionary].

class.name: GDFunctionState
class.brief_description: State of a function call after yielding.
class.description: Calling [method @GDScript.yield] within a function will cause that function to yield and return its current state as an object of this type. The yielded function call can then be resumed later by calling [method resume] on this state object.

method.name: is_valid
method.description: Check whether the function call may be resumed. This is not the case if the function state was already resumed.

method.name: resume
method.description: Resume execution of the yielded function call. If handed an argument, return the argument from the [method @GDScript.yield] call in the yielded function call. You can pass e.g. an [Array] to hand multiple arguments. This function returns what the resumed function call returns, possibly another function state if yielded again.

class.name: GeometryInstance
class.brief_description: Base node for geometry based visual instances.
class.description: Base node for geometry based visual instances. Shares some common functionality like visibility and custom materials.

method.name: get_material_override
method.description: Return the material override for the whole geometry.

method.name: set_material_override
method.description: Set the material override for the whole geometry.

class.name: GlobalConfig
class.brief_description: Contains global variables accessible from everywhere.
class.description: Contains global variables accessible from everywhere. Use the normal [Object] API, such as "Globals.get(variable)", "Globals.set(variable,value)" or "Globals.has(variable)" to access them. Variables stored in godot.cfg are also loaded into globals, making this object very useful for reading custom game configuration options.

method.name: add_property_info
clear
method.description: Clear the whole configuration (not recommended, may break things).

method.name: get_order
method.description: Return the order of a configuration value (influences when saved to the config file).

method.name: globalize_path
method.description: Convert a localized path (res://) to a full native OS path.

method.name: has
method.description: Return true if a configuration value is present.

method.name: localize_path
method.description: Convert a path to a localized path (res:// path).

method.name: set_order
method.description: Set the order of a configuration value (influences when saved to the config file).

class.name: GraphEdit
