class.brief_description: GraphEdit is an area capable of showing various GraphNodes. It manages connection events between them.
class.description: GraphEdit manages the showing of GraphNodes it contains, as well as connections an disconnections between them. Signals are sent for each of these two events. Disconnection between GraphNodes slots is disabled by default. It is greatly advised to enable low processor usage mode (see [method OS.set_low_processor_usage_mode]) when using GraphEdits.

method.name: connect_node
method.description: Create a connection between 'from_port' slot of 'from' GraphNode and 'to_port' slot of 'to' GraphNode. If the connection already exists, no connection is created.

method.name: disconnect_node
method.description: Remove the connection between 'from_port' slot of 'from' GraphNode and 'to_port' slot of 'to' GraphNode, if connection exists.

method.name: get_connection_list
method.description: Return an Array containing the list of connections. A connection consists in a structure of the form {from_slot: 0, from: "GraphNode name 0", to_slot: 1, to: "GraphNode name 1" }

method.name: get_scroll_ofs
method.description: Return the scroll offset.

method.name: get_zoom
method.description: Return the current zoom value.

method.name: is_node_connected
method.description: Return true if the 'from_port' slot of 'from' GraphNode is connected to the 'to_port' slot of 'to' GraphNode.

method.name: is_right_disconnects_enabled
method.description: Return true is the disconnection of connections is enable in the visual GraphEdit. False otherwise.

method.name: set_right_disconnects
method.description: Enable the disconnection of existing connections in the visual GraphEdit by left-clicking a connection and releasing into the void.

method.name: set_zoom
method.description: Set the zoom value of the GraphEdit. Zoom value is between [0.01; 1.728].

signal.name: _begin_node_move
signal.description: Signal sent at the beginning of a GraphNode movement.

signal.name: _end_node_move
signal.description: Signal sent at the end of a GraphNode movement.

signal.name: connection_request
signal.description: Signal sent to the GraphEdit when the connection between 'from_slot' slot of 'from' GraphNode and 'to_slot' slot of 'to' GraphNode is attempted to be created.

signal.name: delete_nodes_request
signal.description: Signal sent when a GraphNode is attempted to be removed from the GraphEdit.

signal.name: disconnection_request
signal.description: Signal sent to the GraphEdit when the connection between 'from_slot' slot of 'from' GraphNode and 'to_slot' slot of 'to' GraphNode is attempted to be removed.

signal.name: duplicate_nodes_request
signal.description: Signal sent when a GraphNode is attempted to be duplicated in the GraphEdit.

signal.name: popup_request
signal.description: Signal sent when a popup is requested. Happens on right-clicking in the GraphEdit. 'p_position' is the position of the mouse pointer when the signal is sent.

class.name: GraphNode
class.brief_description: A GraphNode is a container with several input and output slots allowing connections between GraphNodes. Slots can have different, incompatible types.
class.description: A GraphNode is a container defined by a title. It can have 1 or more input and output slots, which can be enabled (shown) or disabled (not shown) and have different (incompatible) types. Colors can also be assigned to slots. A tuple of input and output slots is defined for each GUI element included in the GraphNode. Input and output connections are left and right slots, but only enabled slots are counted as connections.

method.name: clear_all_slots
method.description: Disable all input and output slots of the GraphNode.

method.name: clear_slot
method.description: Disable input and output slot whose index is 'idx'.

method.name: get_connection_input_color
method.description: Return the color of the input connection 'idx'.

method.name: get_connection_input_count
method.description: Return the number of enabled input slots (connections) to the GraphNode.

method.name: get_connection_input_pos
method.description: Return the position of the input connection 'idx'.

method.name: get_connection_input_type
method.description: Return the type of the input connection 'idx'.

method.name: get_connection_output_color
method.description: Return the color of the output connection 'idx'.

method.name: get_connection_output_count
method.description: Return the number of enabled output slots (connections) of the GraphNode.

method.name: get_connection_output_pos
method.description: Return the position of the output connection 'idx'.

method.name: get_connection_output_type
method.description: Return the type of the output connection 'idx'.

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Return the offset of the GraphNode.

method.name: get_slot_color_left
method.description: Return the color set to 'idx' left (input) slot.

method.name: get_slot_color_right
method.description: Return the color set to 'idx' right (output) slot.

method.name: get_slot_type_left
method.description: Return the (integer) type of left (input) 'idx' slot.

method.name: get_slot_type_right
method.description: Return the (integer) type of right (output) 'idx' slot.

method.name: get_title
method.description: Return the title of the GraphNode.

method.name: is_close_button_visible
method.description: Returns true if the close button is shown. False otherwise.

method.name: is_slot_enabled_left
method.description: Return true if left (input) slot 'idx' is enabled. False otherwise.

method.name: is_slot_enabled_right
method.description: Return true if right (output) slot 'idx' is enabled. False otherwise.

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Set the offset of the GraphNode.

method.name: set_show_close_button
method.description: Show the close button on the GraphNode if 'show' is true (disabled by default). If enabled, a connection on the signal close_request is needed for the close button to work.

method.name: set_title
method.description: Set the title of the GraphNode.

signal.name: close_request
signal.description: Signal sent on closing the GraphNode.

signal.name: dragged
signal.description: Signal sent when the GraphNode is dragged.

signal.name: offset_changed
signal.description: Signal sent when the GraphNode is moved.

signal.name: raise_request
signal.description: Signal sent when the GraphNode is requested to be displayed over other ones. Happens on focusing (clicking into) the GraphNode.

class.name: GridContainer
class.brief_description: Grid container used to arrange elements in a grid like layout
class.description: Grid container will arrange its children in a grid like structure, the grid columns are specified using the [method set_columns] method and the number of rows will be equal to the number of children in the container divided by the number of columns, for example: if the container has 5 children, and 2 columns, there will be 3 rows in the container. Notice that grid layout will preserve the columns and rows for every size of the container.

method.name: get_columns
method.description: Returns the number of columns in this container

method.name: set_columns
method.description: Sets the numbers of columns in the container, then reorder its children to accommodate the new layout

class.name: GrooveJoint2D
class.description: Groove constraint for 2D physics. This is useful for making a body "slide" through a segment placed in another.

method.name: get_initial_offset
method.description: Set the final offset of the groove on body A.

method.name: get_length
method.description: Return the length of the groove.

method.name: set_initial_offset
method.description: Set the initial offset of the groove on body A.

method.name: set_length
method.description: Set the length of the groove.

class.name: HBoxContainer
class.description: Horizontal box container. See [BoxContainer].

class.name: HButtonArray
class.description: Horizontal button array. See [ButtonArray].

class.name: HScrollBar
class.description: Horizontal scroll bar. See [ScrollBar]. This one goes from left (min) to right (max).

class.name: HSeparator
class.description: Horizontal separator. See [Separator]. It is used to separate objects vertically, though (but it looks horizontal!).

class.name: HSlider
class.description: Horizontal slider. See [Slider]. This one goes from left (min) to right (max).

class.name: HSplitContainer
class.description: Horizontal split container. See [SplitContainer]. This goes from left to right.

class.name: HTTPClient
class.description: Hyper-text transfer protocol client. Supports SSL and SSL server certificate verification. Can be reused to connect to different hosts and make many requests.

method.name: close
method.description: Cloces the current connection, allows for reusal of [HTTPClient].

method.name: connect_to_host
method.description: Connect to a host. This needs to be done before any requests are sent. The host should not have http:// prepended but will strip the protocol identifier if provided. verify_host will check the SSL identity of the host if set to true.

method.name: get_connection
method.description: Return current connection.

method.name: get_response_body_length
method.description: Return the response's body length.

method.name: get_response_code
method.description: Return the HTTP status code of the response.

method.name: get_response_headers
method.description: Return the response headers.

method.name: get_response_headers_as_dictionary
method.description: Returns all response headers as dictionary where the case-sensitivity of the keys and values is kept like the server delivers it. A value is a simple String, this string can have more than one value where "; " is used as separator. Structure: ("key":"value1; value2") Example: (content-length:12), (Content-Type:application/json; charset=UTF-8)

method.name: get_status
method.description: Returns a STATUS_* enum constant. Need to call [method poll] in order to get status updates.

method.name: has_response
method.description: Return whether this [HTTPClient] has a response available.

method.name: is_blocking_mode_enabled
method.description: Return whether blocking mode is enabled.

method.name: is_response_chunked
method.description: Return whether this [HTTPClient] has a response that is chunked.

method.name: poll
method.description: This needs to be called in order to have any request processed. Check results with [method get_status]

method.name: query_string_from_dict
method.description: Generates a GET/POST application/x-www-form-urlencoded style query string from a provided dictionary, e.g.: [codeblock] var fields = {"username": "user", "password": "pass"} String queryString = httpClient.query_string_from_dict(fields) returns:= "username=user&password=pass" [/codeblock]

method.name: read_response_body_chunk
method.description: Reads one chunk from the response.

method.name: request
request_raw
method.description: Sends a raw request to the connected host. The url is what is normally behind the hostname, i.e. in [code]http://somehost.com/index.php[/code], url would be "index.php". Headers are HTTP request headers. Sends body raw, as a byte array, does not encode it in any way.

method.name: send_body_data
method.description: Stub function

method.name: send_body_text
method.description: Stub function

method.name: set_blocking_mode
method.description: If set to true, execution will block until all data is read from the response.

method.name: set_connection
method.description: Set connection to use, for this client.

method.name: set_read_chunk_size
method.description: Sets the size of the buffer used and maximum bytes to read per iteration. see [method read_response_body_chunk]

class.name: HTTPRequest
class.brief_description: A Node with the ability to send HTTP requests.
class.description: A Node with the ability to send HTTP requests. Uses a [HTTPClient] internally, supports HTTPS. Can be used to make HTTP requests or download files via HTTP.

method.name: cancel_request
method.description: Cancel the current request.

method.name: get_body_size
method.description: Return the response body length.

method.name: get_body_size_limit
method.description: Return current body size limit.

method.name: get_download_file
method.description: Return the file this request will download into.

method.name: get_downloaded_bytes
method.description: Return the amount of bytes this HTTPRequest downloaded.

method.name: get_http_client_status
method.description: Return the current status of the underlying [HTTPClient].

method.name: get_max_redirects
method.description: Return the maximum amount of redirects that will be followed.

method.name: is_using_threads
method.description: Whether this request is using threads.

method.name: set_body_size_limit
method.description: Set the response body size limit.

method.name: set_download_file
method.description: Set the file to download into. Outputs the response body into the file.

method.name: set_max_redirects
method.description: Set the maximum amount of redirects the request will follow.

method.name: set_use_threads
method.description: Make this HTTPRequest use threads.

signal.name: request_completed
signal.description: This signal is emitted upon request completion.

constants.constant: Request failed due to connection(read/write) error.
Request does not have a response(yet).
Request exceded its maximum size limit, see [method set_body_size_limit].
HTTPRequest couldn't open the download file.
HTTPRequest couldn't write to the download file.
Request reached its maximum redirect limit, see [method set_max_redirects].

class.name: IP
class.description: IP contains some support functions for the IPv4 protocol. TCP/IP support is in different classes (see [StreamPeerTCP] and [TCP_Server]). IP provides hostname resolution support, both blocking and threaded.

method.name: erase_resolve_item
method.description: Erase a queue ID, removing it from the queue if needed. This should be used after a queue is completed to free it and enable more queries to happen.

method.name: get_resolve_item_address
method.description: Return a resolved item address, or an empty string if an error happened or resolution didn't happen yet (see [method get_resolve_item_status]).

method.name: get_resolve_item_status
method.description: Return the status of hostname queued for resolving, given its queue ID. Returned status can be any of the RESOLVER_STATUS_* enumeration.

method.name: resolve_hostname
method.description: Resolve a given hostname, blocking. Resolved hostname is returned as an IPv4 or IPv6 depending on "ip_type".

method.name: resolve_hostname_queue_item
method.description: Create a queue item for resolving a given hostname to an IPv4 or IPv6 depending on "ip_type". The queue ID is returned, or RESOLVER_INVALID_ID on error.

class.name: Image
class.description: Built in native image datatype. Contains image data, which can be converted to a texture, and several functions to interact with it.

method.name: Image
method.description: Create an empty image of a specific size and format.

method.name: blit_rect
method.description: Copy a "src_rect" [Rect2] from "src" [Image] to this [Image] on coordinates "dest".

method.name: compressed
method.description: Return a new compressed [Image] from this [Image] using one of [Image].COMPRESS_*.

method.name: converted
method.description: Return a new [Image] from this [Image] with a different format.

method.name: decompressed
method.description: Return a new decompressed [Image].

method.name: empty
method.description: Return whether this [Image] is empty(no data).

method.name: get_data
method.description: Return the raw data of the [Image].

method.name: get_format
method.description: Return the format of the [Image], one of [Image].FORMAT_*.

method.name: get_height
method.description: Return the height of the [Image].

method.name: get_rect
method.description: Return a new [Image] that is a copy of "area" in this [Image].

method.name: get_used_rect
method.description: Return the area of this [Image] that is used/visibly colored/opaque.

method.name: get_width
method.description: Return the width of the [Image].

method.name: load
method.description: Load an [Image].

method.name: resized
method.description: Return a new [Image] from this [Image] that is resized to size "x,y" using [Image].INTERPOLATE_*.

method.name: save_png
method.description: Save this [Image] as a png.

class.name: ImageTexture
class.description: A [Texture] based on an [Image]. Can be created from an [Image].

method.name: create
method.description: Create a new [ImageTexture] with "width" and "height". "format" one of [Image].FORMAT_*. "flags" one or more of [Texture].FLAG_*.

method.name: create_from_image
method.description: Create a new [ImageTexture] from an [Image] with "flags" from [Texture].FLAG_*.

method.name: get_data
method.description: Return the [Image] of this [ImageTexture].

method.name: get_format
method.description: Return the format of the [ImageTexture], one of [Image].FORMAT_*.

method.name: get_lossy_storage_quality
method.description: Return the storage quality for [ImageTexture].STORAGE_COMPRESS_LOSSY.

method.name: get_storage
method.description: Return the storage type. One of [ImageTexture].STORAGE_*.

method.name: load
method.description: Load an [ImageTexure].

method.name: set_data
method.description: Set the [Image] of this [ImageTexture].

method.name: set_lossy_storage_quality
method.description: Set the storage quality in case of [ImageTexture].STORAGE_COMPRESS_LOSSY.

method.name: set_storage
method.description: Set the storage type. One of [ImageTexture].STORAGE_*.

constants.constant: [Image] data is stored raw and unaltered.
[Image] data is compressed with a lossy algorithm. You can set the storage quality with [method set_lossy_storage_quality].
[Image] data is compressed with a lossless algorithm.

class.name: ImmediateGeometry
class.brief_description: Node to draw simple geometry from code, ala OpenGL 1.x

method.name: add_sphere
method.description: Simple helper to draw an uvsphere, with given latitudes, longitude and radius.

method.name: add_vertex
method.description: Add a vertex with the currently set color/uv/etc.

method.name: begin
method.description: Begin drawing (And optionally pass a texture override). When done call end(). For more information on how this works, search for glBegin() glEnd() references. For the type of primitive, use the [Mesh].PRIMITIVE_* enumerations.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear everything that was drawn using begin/end.

method.name: end
method.description: Call this when done adding a batch of geometry, otherwise it can't be displayed.

method.name: set_color
method.description: Set the color that the next vertex will use to be drawn.

method.name: set_normal
method.description: Set the normal that the next vertex will use to be drawn.

method.name: set_tangent
method.description: Set the tangent (and binormal facing) that the next vertex will use to be drawn.

method.name: set_uv
method.description: Set the UV that the next vertex will use to be drawn.

method.name: set_uv2
method.description: Set the second layer of UV that the next vertex will use to be drawn.

class.name: Input
class.brief_description: A Singleton that deals with inputs.
class.description: A Singleton that deals with inputs. This includes key presses, mouse buttons and movement, joypads, and input actions.

method.name: action_press
method.description: This will simulate pressing the specificed action.

method.name: action_release
method.description: If the specified action is already pressed, this will release it.

method.name: add_joy_mapping
method.description: Add a new mapping entry (in SDL2 format) to the mapping database. Optionally update already connected devices.

method.name: get_accelerometer
method.description: If the device has an accelerometer, this will return the movement.

method.name: get_connected_joypads
method.description: Returns an [Array] containing the device IDs of all currently connected joypads.

method.name: get_gyroscope
method.description: If the device has a gyroscope, this will return the rate of rotation in rad/s around a device's x, y, and z axis.

method.name: get_joy_axis
method.description: Returns the current value of the joypad axis at given index (see JOY_* constants in [@Global Scope])

method.name: get_joy_guid
method.description: Returns a SDL2 compatible device guid on platforms that use gamepad remapping. Returns "Default Gamepad" otherwise.

method.name: get_joy_name
method.description: Returns the name of the joypad at the specified device index

method.name: get_joy_vibration_duration
method.description: Returns the duration of the current vibration effect in seconds.

method.name: get_joy_vibration_strength
method.description: Returns the strength of the joypad vibration: x is the strength of the weak motor, and y is the strength of the strong motor.

method.name: get_last_mouse_speed
method.description: Returns the mouse speed for the last time the cursor was moved, and this until the next frame where the mouse moves. This means that even if the mouse is not moving, this function will still return the value of the last motion.

method.name: get_magnetometer
method.description: If the device has a magnetometer, this will return the magnetic field strength in micro-Tesla for all axes.

method.name: get_mouse_button_mask
method.description: Returns mouse buttons as a bitmask. If multiple mouse buttons are pressed at the same time the bits are added together.

method.name: get_mouse_mode
method.description: Return the mouse mode. See the constants for more information.

method.name: is_action_pressed
method.description: Returns true or false depending on whether the action event is pressed. Actions and their events can be set in the Project Settings / Input Map tab. Or be set with [InputMap].

method.name: is_joy_button_pressed
method.description: Returns if the joypad button at the given index is currently pressed. (see JOY_* constants in [@Global Scope])

method.name: is_joy_known
method.description: Returns if the specified device is known by the system. This means that it sets all button and axis indices exactly as defined in the JOY_* constants (see [@Global Scope]). Unknown joypads are not expected to match these constants, but you can still retrieve events from them.

method.name: is_key_pressed
method.description: Returns true or false depending on whether the key is pressed or not. You can pass KEY_*, which are pre-defined constants listed in [@Global Scope].

method.name: is_mouse_button_pressed
method.description: Returns true or false depending on whether mouse button is pressed or not. You can pass BUTTON_*, which are pre-defined constants listed in [@Global Scope].

method.name: remove_joy_mapping
method.description: Removes all mappings from the internal db that match the given uid.

method.name: set_custom_mouse_cursor
method.description: Set a custom mouse cursor image, which is only visible inside the game window. The hotspot can also be specified.

method.name: set_mouse_mode
method.description: Set the mouse mode. See the constants for more information.

method.name: start_joy_vibration
method.description: Starts to vibrate the joypad. Joypads usually come with two rumble motors, a strong and a weak one. weak_magnitude is the strength of the weak motor (between 0 and 1) and strong_magnitude is the strength of the strong motor (between 0 and 1). duration is the duration of the effect in seconds (a duration of 0 will try to play the vibration indefinitely). Note that not every hardware is compatible with long effect durations, it is recommended to restart an effect if in need to play it for more than a few seconds.

method.name: stop_joy_vibration
method.description: Stops the vibration of the joypad.

method.name: warp_mouse_pos
method.description: Sets the mouse position to the specified vector.

signal.name: joy_connection_changed
signal.description: Emitted when a joypad device has been connected or disconnected

constants.constant: Makes the mouse cursor visible if it is hidden.
Makes the mouse cursor hidden if it is visible.
Captures the mouse. The mouse will be hidden and unable to leave the game window. But it will still register movement and mouse button presses.

class.name: InputDefault
class.description: Default implementation of the [Input] class, used internally by the editor and games for default input management.

class.name: InputEvent
class.description: Built-in input event data. InputEvent is a built-in engine datatype, given that it's passed around and used so much. Depending on its type, the members contained can be different, so read the documentation well! Input events can also represent actions (editable from the project settings).

method.name: is_action
method.description: Return if this input event matches a pre-defined action, no matter the type.

method.name: is_action_pressed
method.description: Return whether the given action is being pressed (and is not an echo event for KEY events). Not relevant for the event types MOUSE_MOTION, SCREEN_DRAG and NONE.

method.name: is_action_released
method.description: Return whether the given action is released (i.e. not pressed). Not relevant for the event types MOUSE_MOTION, SCREEN_DRAG and NONE.

method.name: is_echo
method.description: Return if this input event is an echo event (only for events of type KEY, it will return false for other types).

method.name: is_pressed
method.description: Return if this input event is pressed. Not relevant for the event types MOUSE_MOTION, SCREEN_DRAG and NONE.

method.name: set_as_action
method.description: Change the input event to an action event of the given name, regardless of its initial type, with the pressed status passed as argument.

members.member: Event identifier, positive integer increased at each new event.
Device identifier.
Type of event (one of the [InputEvent] constants).

class.name: InputEventAction
class.brief_description: Built-in input event type for actions.
class.description: Input event type for actions that extends the global [InputEvent] type.

method.name: is_action
method.description: Return if this input event matches a pre-defined action, i.e. always true for InputEventAction.

method.name: is_action_pressed
method.description: Return whether the given action is being pressed.

method.name: is_action_released
method.description: Return whether the given action is released (i.e. not pressed).

method.name: is_echo
method.description: Return if this input event is an echo event (only for events of type KEY, i.e. always false for this type).

method.name: is_pressed
method.description: Return if this input event is pressed.

method.name: set_as_action
method.description: Change the input event to an action event of the given name with the pressed status passed as argument.

members.member: Event identifier, positive integer increased at each new event.
Device identifier.
Type of event (one of the [InputEvent] constants).

class.name: InputEventJoypadButton
class.brief_description: Built-in input event type for joypad button events.
class.description: Input event type for joypad button events that extends the global [InputEvent] type.

method.name: is_action
method.description: Return if this input event matches a pre-defined action.

method.name: is_action_pressed
method.description: Return whether the given action is being pressed.

method.name: is_action_released
method.description: Return whether the given action is released (i.e. not pressed).

method.name: is_echo
method.description: Return if this input event is an echo event (only for events of type KEY, i.e. always false for this type).

method.name: is_pressed
method.description: Return if this input event is pressed.

method.name: set_as_action
method.description: Change the input event to an action event of the given name with the pressed status passed as argument.

members.member: Event identifier, positive integer increased at each new event.
Joypad button identifier, one of the JOY_BUTTON_* constants in [@Global Scope].
Device identifier.
Pressed state of the joypad button.
Intensity of the button pressure, ranges from 0 to 1.0.
Type of event (one of the [InputEvent] constants).

Position of the axis, ranging from -1.0 to 1.0. A value of 0 means that the axis is in its neutral position.

class.name: InputMap
class.description: Singleton that manages actions. InputMap has a list of the actions used in InputEvent, which can be modified.

method.name: action_add_event
method.description: Add an [InputEvent] to an action. This [InputEvent] will trigger the action.

method.name: action_erase_event
method.description: Remove an [InputEvent] from an action.

method.name: action_has_event
method.description: Whether an action has an [InputEvent] associated with it.

method.name: add_action
method.description: Add an (empty) action to the [InputMap]. An [InputEvent] can then be added to this action with [method action_add_event].

method.name: erase_action
method.description: Remove an action from the [InputMap].

method.name: event_is_action
method.description: Return whether the given event is part of an existing action. This method ignores keyboard modifiers if the given [InputEvent] is not pressed (for proper release detection). See [method action_has_event] if you don't want this behavior.

method.name: get_action_from_id
method.description: Return the action corresponding to the identifier.

method.name: get_action_id
method.description: Return the identifier of the given action.

method.name: get_action_list
method.description: Return an array of InputEvents associated with a given action.

method.name: get_actions
method.description: Return an array of all actions in the [InputMap].

method.name: has_action
method.description: Whether this InputMap has a registered action with the given name.

method.name: load_from_globals
method.description: Clear the [InputMap] and load it anew from [Globals].

class.name: InstancePlaceholder
class.brief_description: Placeholder for the root [Node] of a [PackedScene].
class.description: Turning on the option [b]Load As Placeholder[/b] for an instanced scene in the editor causes it to be replaced by an InstacePlaceholder when running the game. This makes it possible to delay actually loading the scene until calling [method replace_by_instance]. This is useful to avoid loading large scenes all at once by loading parts of it selectively. The InstancePlaceholder does not have a transform. This causes any child nodes to be positioned relatively to the Viewport from point (0,0), rather than their parent as displayed in the editor. Replacing the placeholder with a scene with a transform will transform children relatively to their parent again.

method.name: get_instance_path
method.description: Retrieve the path to the [PackedScene] resource file that is loaded by default when calling [method replace_by_instance].

method.name: replace_by_instance
method.description: Replace this placeholder by the scene handed as an argument, or the original scene if no argument is given. As for all resources, the scene is loaded only if it's not loaded already. By manually loading the scene beforehand, delays caused by this function can be avoided.

class.name: ItemList
class.brief_description: Control that provides a list of selectable items (and/or icons) in a single column, or optionally in multiple columns.
class.description: This control provides a selectable list of items that may be in a single (or multiple columns) with option of text, icons, or both text and icon. Tooltips are supported and may be different for every item in the list. Selectable items in the list may be selected or deselected and multiple selection may be enabled. Selection with right mouse button may also be enabled to allow use of popup context menus. Items may also be 'activated' with a double click (or Enter key).

method.name: add_icon_item
method.description: Adds an item to the item list with no text, only an icon.

method.name: add_item
method.description: Adds an item to the item list with specified text. Specify an icon of null for a list item with no icon. If selectable is true the list item will be selectable.

method.name: clear
method.description: Remove all items from the list.

method.name: ensure_current_is_visible
method.description: Ensure selection is visible, adjusting the scroll position as necessary.

method.name: get_allow_rmb_select
method.description: Return whether or not items may be selected via right mouse clicking.

method.name: get_fixed_column_width
method.description: If column size has been fixed to a value, return that value.

method.name: get_item_at_pos
method.description: Given a position within the control return the item (if any) at that point.

method.name: get_item_count
method.description: Return count of items currently in the item list.

method.name: get_item_text
method.description: Return the text for specified item index.

method.name: get_item_tooltip
method.description: Return tooltip hint for specified item index.

method.name: get_max_columns
method.description: Return total number of columns in use by the list.

method.name: get_max_text_lines
method.description: Return total number of lines currently in use by the list.

method.name: get_selected_items
method.description: Returns the list of selected indexes.

method.name: get_v_scroll
method.description: Returns the current vertical scroll bar for the List.

method.name: is_item_disabled
method.description: Returns whether or not the item at the specified index is disabled

method.name: is_item_selectable
method.description: Returns whether or not the item at the specified index is selectable.

method.name: is_item_tooltip_enabled
method.description: Returns whether the tooptip is enabled for specified item index.

method.name: is_same_column_width
method.description: Returns whether or not all columns of the list are of the same size.

method.name: is_selected
method.description: Returns whether or not item at the specified index is currently selected.

method.name: remove_item
method.description: Remove item at specified index from the list.

method.name: select
method.description: Select the item at the specified index. Note: This method does not trigger the item selection signal.

method.name: set_allow_rmb_select
method.description: Allow (or disallow) selection of (selectable) items in the list using right mouse button.

method.name: set_fixed_column_width
method.description: Set the size (width) all columns in the list are to use.

method.name: set_item_disabled
method.description: Disable (or enable) item at specified index. Disabled items are not be selectable and do not fire activation (Enter or double-click) signals.

method.name: set_item_icon
method.description: Set (or replace) icon of the item at the specified index.

method.name: set_item_metadata
method.description: Sets a value (of any type) to be stored with the item at the specified index.

method.name: set_item_selectable
method.description: Allow or disallow selection of the item at the specified index.

method.name: set_item_text
method.description: Sets text of item at specified index.

method.name: set_item_tooltip
method.description: Sets tooltip hint for item at specified index.

method.name: set_item_tooltip_enabled
method.description: Sets whether the tooltip is enabled for specified item index.

method.name: set_max_columns
method.description: Set maximum number of columns to use for the list.

method.name: set_max_text_lines
method.description: Set maximum number of lines to use for the list.

method.name: set_same_column_width
method.description: Sets a fixed size (width) to use for all columns of the list.

method.name: sort_items_by_text
method.description: Sorts items in the list by their text.

method.name: unselect
method.description: Ensure item at specified index is not selected.

signal.name: item_activated
signal.description: Fired when specified list item is activated via double click or Enter.

signal.name: item_rmb_selected
signal.description: Fired when specified list item has been selected via right mouse clicking. The click position is also provided to allow appropriate popup of context menus at the correct location.

signal.name: item_selected
signal.description: Fired when specified item has been selected.

signal.name: multi_selected
signal.description: Fired when a multiple selection is altered on a list allowing mutliple selection.

class.name: Joint2D
class.brief_description: Base node for all joint constraints in 2D physics.
class.description: Base node for all joint constraints in 2D physics. Joints take 2 bodies and apply a custom constraint.

method.name: get_node_a
method.description: Return the path to the A node for the joint.

method.name: get_node_b
method.description: Return the path to the B node for the joint.

method.name: set_node_a
method.description: Set the path to the A node for the joint. Must be of type [PhysicsBody2D].

method.name: set_node_b
method.description: Set the path to the B node for the joint. Must be of type [PhysicsBody2D].

class.name: KinematicBody
class.description: Kinematic bodies are special types of bodies that are meant to be user-controlled. They are not affected by physics at all (to other types of bodies, such a character or a rigid body, these are the same as a static body). They have however, two main uses: Simulated Motion: When these bodies are moved manually, either from code or from an AnimationPlayer (with process mode set to fixed), the physics will automatically compute an estimate of their linear and angular velocity. This makes them very useful for moving platforms or other AnimationPlayer-controlled objects (like a door, a bridge that opens, etc). Kinematic Characters: KinematicBody also has an api for moving objects (the [method move] method) while performing collision tests. This makes them really useful to implement characters that collide against a world, but that don't require advanced physics.

method.name: can_collide_with_character_bodies
method.description: Return if this body can collide with character bodies.

method.name: can_collide_with_kinematic_bodies
method.description: Return if this body can collide with kinematic bodies.

method.name: can_collide_with_rigid_bodies
method.description: Return if this body can collide with rigid bodies.

method.name: can_collide_with_static_bodies
method.description: Return if this body can collide with static bodies.

method.name: can_teleport_to
method.description: Returns whether the KinematicBody can be teleported to the destination given as an argument, checking all collision shapes of the body against potential colliders at the destination.

method.name: get_collider
method.description: Return the body that collided with this one.

method.name: get_collider_shape
method.description: Return the shape index from the body that collided with this one. If there is no collision, this method will return 0, so collisions must be checked first with [method is_colliding].

method.name: get_collider_velocity
method.description: Return the velocity of the body that collided with this one.

method.name: get_collision_margin
method.description: Return the collision margin for this object.

method.name: get_collision_normal
method.description: Return the normal of the surface the body collided with. This is useful to implement sliding along a surface.

method.name: get_collision_pos
method.description: Return the point in space where the body is touching another. If there is no collision, this method will return (0,0,0), so collisions must be checked first with [method is_colliding].

method.name: is_colliding
method.description: Return whether the body is colliding with another.

method.name: move
method.description: Move the body in the given direction, stopping if there is an obstacle. The returned vector is how much movement was remaining before being stopped.

method.name: move_to
method.description: Move the body to the given position. This is not a teleport, and the body will stop if there is an obstacle. The returned vector is how much movement was remaining before being stopped.

method.name: set_collide_with_character_bodies
method.description: Set if this body should collide with character bodies.

method.name: set_collide_with_kinematic_bodies
method.description: Set if this body should collide with kinematic bodies.

method.name: set_collide_with_rigid_bodies
method.description: Set if this body should collide with rigid bodies.

method.name: set_collide_with_static_bodies
method.description: Set if this body should collide with static bodies.

method.name: set_collision_margin
method.description: Set the collision margin for this object. A collision margin is an amount that all shapes will grow when computing collisions, to account for numerical imprecision.

class.name: KinematicBody2D
class.description: Kinematic bodies are special types of bodies that are meant to be user-controlled. They are not affected by physics at all (to other types of bodies, such a character or a rigid body, these are the same as a static body). They have however, two main uses: Simulated Motion: When these bodies are moved manually, either from code or from an AnimationPlayer (with process mode set to fixed), the physics will automatically compute an estimate of their linear and angular velocity. This makes them very useful for moving platforms or other AnimationPlayer-controlled objects (like a door, a bridge that opens, etc). Kinematic Characters: KinematicBody2D also has an api for moving objects (the [method move] method) while performing collision tests. This makes them really useful to implement characters that collide against a world, but that don't require advanced physics.

method.name: get_collider
method.description: Return the body that collided with this one.

method.name: get_collider_metadata
method.description: Return the metadata of the shape that collided with this body. If there is no collision, it will return 0, so collisions must be checked first with [method is_colliding]. Additionally, this metadata can not be set with [method Object.set_meta], it must be set with [method Physics2DServer.body_set_shape_metadata].

method.name: get_collider_shape
method.description: Return the shape index from the body that collided with this one. If there is no collision, this method will return 0, so collisions must be checked first with [method is_colliding].

method.name: get_collider_velocity
method.description: Return the velocity of the body that collided with this one.

method.name: get_collision_margin
method.description: Return the collision margin for this object.

method.name: get_collision_normal
method.description: Return the normal of the surface the body collided with. This is useful to implement sliding along a surface.

method.name: get_collision_pos
method.description: Return the point in space where the body is touching another. If there is no collision, this method will return (0,0), so collisions must be checked first with [method is_colliding].

method.name: get_travel
method.description: Return the last movement done by the body.

method.name: is_colliding
method.description: Return whether the body is colliding with another.

method.name: move
method.description: Move the body in the given direction, stopping if there is an obstacle. The returned vector is how much movement was remaining before being stopped.

method.name: move_to
method.description: Move the body to the given position. This is not a teleport, and the body will stop if there is an obstacle. The returned vector is how much movement was remaining before being stopped. [code]floor_max_angle[/code] is in radians (default is pi/4), and filters which obstacles should be considered as floors/cellings instead of walls.

method.name: revert_motion
method.description: Undo the last movement done by the body.

method.name: set_collision_margin
method.description: Set the collision margin for this object. A collision margin is an amount (in pixels) that all shapes will grow when computing collisions, to account for numerical imprecision.

method.name: test_move
method.description: Return true if there would be a collision if the body moved from the given point in the given direction.

class.name: Label
class.description: Label is a control that displays formatted text, optionally autowrapping it to the [Control] area. It inherits from range to be able to scroll wrapped text vertically.

method.name: get_align
method.description: Return the alignment mode (any of the ALIGN_* enumeration values).

method.name: get_line_count
method.description: Return the amount of lines.

method.name: get_line_height
method.description: Return the height of a line.

method.name: get_lines_skipped
method.description: Return the the number of lines to skipped before displaying.

method.name: get_max_lines_visible
method.description: Return the restricted number of lines to display. Returns -1 if unrestricted.

method.name: get_percent_visible
method.description: Return the restricted number of characters to display (as a percentage of the total text).

method.name: get_text
method.description: Return the label text. Text can contain newlines.

method.name: get_total_character_count
method.description: Return the total length of the text.

method.name: get_valign
method.description: Return the vertical alignment mode (any of the VALIGN_* enumeration values).

method.name: get_visible_characters
method.description: Return the restricted number of characters to display. Returns -1 if unrestricted.

method.name: has_autowrap
method.description: Return the state of the [i]autowrap[/i] mode (see [method set_autowrap]).

method.name: is_clipping_text
method.description: Return true if text would be cut off if it is too wide.

method.name: is_uppercase
method.description: Return true if text is displayed in all capitals.

method.name: set_align
method.description: Sets the alignment mode to any of the ALIGN_* enumeration values.

method.name: set_autowrap
method.description: Set [i]autowrap[/i] mode. When enabled, autowrap will fit text to the control width, breaking sentences when they exceed the available horizontal space. When disabled, the label minimum width becomes the width of the longest row, and the minimum height large enough to fit all rows.

method.name: set_clip_text
method.description: Cuts off the rest of the text if it is too wide.

method.name: set_lines_skipped
method.description: Sets the number of lines to skip before displaying. Useful for scrolling text.

method.name: set_max_lines_visible
method.description: Restricts the number of lines to display. Set to -1 to disable.

method.name: set_percent_visible
method.description: Restricts the number of characters to display (as a percentage of the total text).

method.name: set_text
method.description: Set the label text. Text can contain newlines.

method.name: set_uppercase
method.description: Display text in all capitals.

method.name: set_valign
method.description: Sets the vertical alignment mode to any of the VALIGN_* enumeration values.

method.name: set_visible_characters
method.description: Restricts the number of characters to display. Set to -1 to disable.

constants.constant: Expand row whitespaces to fit the width.
Align the whole text to the top.
Align the whole text to the center.
Align the whole text to the bottom.
Align the whole text by spreading the rows.

class.name: LargeTexture
class.brief_description: A Texture capable of storing many smaller Textures with offsets.
class.description: A Texture capable of storing many smaller Textures with offsets. You can dynamically add pieces(Textures) to this fLargeTexture] using different offsets.

method.name: add_piece
method.description: Add another [Texture] to this [LargeTexture], starting on offset "ofs".

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the [LargeTexture].

method.name: get_piece_count
method.description: Return the number of pieces currently in this [LargeTexture].

method.name: get_piece_offset
method.description: Return the offset of the piece with index "idx".

method.name: get_piece_texture
method.description: Return the [Texture] of the piece with index "idx".

method.name: set_piece_offset
method.description: Set the offset of the piece with index "idx" to "ofs".

method.name: set_piece_texture
method.description: Set the [Texture] of the piece with index "idx" to "ofs".

method.name: set_size
method.description: Set the size of this [LargeTexture].

class.name: Light
class.brief_description: Provides a base class for different kinds of light nodes.
class.description: Light is the abstract base class for light nodes, so it shouldn't be used directly (It can't be instanced). Other types of light nodes inherit from it. Light contains the common variables and parameters used for lighting.

class.name: Light2D
class.brief_description: Node that casts light in a 2D environment.
class.description: Node that casts light in a 2D environment. Light is defined by a (usually grayscale) texture, a color, an energy value, a mode (see constants), and various other parameters (range and shadows-related). Note that Light2D can be used as a mask.

method.name: get_color
method.description: Return the color of the Light2D.

method.name: get_energy
method.description: Return the energy value of the Light2D.

method.name: get_height
method.description: Return the height of the Light2D. Used with 2D normalmapping.

method.name: get_layer_range_max
method.description: Set the maximum layer value of objects of the scene that are affected by the Light2D.

method.name: get_layer_range_min
method.description: Get the minimum layer value of objects of the scene that are affected by the Light2D.

method.name: get_mode
method.description: Return the current mode set to the Light2D.

method.name: get_shadow_buffer_size
method.description: Return the shadow buffer size.

method.name: get_shadow_color
method.description: Return the color of casted shadows for this Light2D.

method.name: get_texture
method.description: Return the texture of the Light2D.

method.name: get_texture_offset
method.description: Return the offset of the light texture.

method.name: get_texture_scale
method.description: Return the scale value of the light texture.

method.name: get_z_range_max
method.description: Get the maximum Z value that objects of the scene can be in order to be affected by the Light2D.

method.name: get_z_range_min
method.description: Get the minimum Z value that objects of the scene have to be in order to be affected by the Light2D.

method.name: is_enabled
method.description: Return true if the Light2D is enabled, false if it is not.

method.name: is_shadow_enabled
method.description: Return true if shadow casting is enabled for this Light2D, else return false.

method.name: set_color
method.description: Set the color of the Light2D.

method.name: set_enabled
method.description: Switches the Light2D on or off, depending on the 'enabled' parameter.

method.name: set_energy
method.description: Set the energy value of the Light2D. The bigger the value, the stronger the light.

method.name: set_height
method.description: Set the height of the Light2D. Used with 2D normalmapping.

method.name: set_item_cull_mask
method.description: Set the item mask of the Light2D to 'item_mask' value.

method.name: set_item_shadow_cull_mask
method.description: Set the item shadow mask to 'item_shadow_mask' value.

method.name: set_layer_range_max
method.description: Set the maximum layer value of objects of the scene that are affected by the Light2D.

method.name: set_layer_range_min
method.description: Set the minimum layer value of objects of the scene that are affected by the Light2D.

method.name: set_mode
method.description: Set the behaviour mode of the Light2D. Use constants defined in the constants section.

method.name: set_shadow_buffer_size
method.description: Set the shadow buffer size.

method.name: set_shadow_color
method.description: Set the color of casted shadows for this Light2D.

method.name: set_shadow_enabled
method.description: Enable or disable shadows casting from this Light2D according to the 'enabled' parameter.

method.name: set_texture
method.description: Set the texture of the Light2D.

method.name: set_texture_offset
method.description: Set the offset of the light texture.

method.name: set_texture_scale
method.description: Set the scale value of the light texture.

method.name: set_z_range_max
method.description: Set the maximum Z value that objects of the scene can be in order to be affected by the Light2D.

method.name: set_z_range_min
method.description: Set the minimum Z value that objects of the scene have to be in order to be affected by the Light2D.

constants.constant: Adds the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it. This is the common behaviour of a light.
Subtract the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it, resulting in inversed light effect.
Mix the value of pixels corresponding to the Light2D to the values of pixels under it by linear interpolation.
The light texture of the Light2D is used as a mask, hiding or revealing parts of the screen underneath depending on the value of each pixel of the light (mask) texture.

class.name: LightOccluder2D
class.brief_description: Occludes light cast by a Light2D, thus casting shadows.
class.description: Occludes light cast by a Light2D, thus casting shadows. The LightOccluder2D must be provided with a shape (see OccluderPolygon2D) that allows the shadow to be computed. This shape affects the resulting shadow, while the shape of the representating asset shadowed does not actually affect shadows.

method.name: get_occluder_light_mask
method.description: Return the light mask of the LightOccluder2D.

method.name: get_occluder_polygon
method.description: Return the OccluderPolygon2D that defines the LightOccluder2D.

method.name: set_occluder_light_mask
method.description: Set the LightOccluder2D light mask. The LightOccluder2D will cast shadows only from Light2Ds that belong to the same light mask(s).

method.name: set_occluder_polygon
method.description: Set the OccluderPolygon2D that defines the LightOccluder2D.

class.name: LineEdit
class.brief_description: Control that provides single line string editing.
class.description: LineEdit provides a single line string editor, used for text fields.

method.name: append_at_cursor
method.description: Append text at cursor, scrolling the [LineEdit] when needed.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the [LineEdit] text.

method.name: cursor_get_blink_enabled
method.description: Gets whether the line edit caret is blinking.

method.name: cursor_get_blink_speed
method.description: Gets the line edit caret blink speed.

method.name: cursor_set_blink_enabled
method.description: Set the line edit caret to blink.

method.name: cursor_set_blink_speed
method.description: Set the line edit caret blink speed. Cannot be less then or equal to 0.

method.name: get_cursor_pos
method.description: Return the cursor position inside the [LineEdit].

method.name: get_max_length
method.description: Return the maximum amount of characters the [LineEdit] can edit. If 0 is returned, no limit exists.

method.name: get_text
method.description: Return the text in the [LineEdit].

method.name: is_editable
method.description: Return the [i]editable[/i] status of the [LineEdit] (see [method set_editable]).

method.name: is_secret
method.description: Return the [i]secret[/i] status of the [LineEdit] (see [method set_secret]).

method.name: select_all
method.description: Select the whole string.

method.name: set_cursor_pos
method.description: Set the cursor position inside the [LineEdit], causing it to scroll if needed.

method.name: set_editable
method.description: Set the [i]editable[/i] status of the [LineEdit]. When disabled, existing text can't be modified and new text can't be added.

method.name: set_max_length
method.description: Set the maximum amount of characters the [LineEdit] can edit, and cropping existing text in case it exceeds that limit. Setting 0 removes the limit.

method.name: set_secret
method.description: Set the [i]secret[/i] status of the [LineEdit]. When enabled, every character is displayed as "*".

method.name: set_text
method.description: Set the text in the [LineEdit], clearing the existing one and the selection.

signal.name: text_changed
signal.description: When the text changes, this signal is emitted.

signal.name: text_entered
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the user presses KEY_ENTER on the [LineEdit]. This signal is often used as an alternate confirmation mechanism in dialogs.

class.name: LineShape2D
class.description: Line shape for 2D collision objects. It works like a 2D plane and will not allow any body to go to the negative side. Not recommended for rigid bodies, and usually not recommended for static bodies either because it forces checks against it on every frame.

method.name: get_d
method.description: Return the line distance from the origin.

method.name: get_normal
method.description: Return the line normal.

method.name: set_d
method.description: Set the line distance from the origin.

method.name: set_normal
method.description: Set the line normal.

class.name: LinkButton
class.brief_description: Simple button used to represent a link to some resource
class.description: This kind of buttons are primarily used when the interaction with the button causes a context change (like linking to a web page).

method.name: get_text
method.description: Returns the text of the button.

method.name: get_underline_mode
method.description: Returns the underline mode for this button.

method.name: set_text
method.description: Sets the text of the button.

method.name: set_underline_mode
method.description: Sets the underline mode for this button, the argument must be one of the [LinkButton] constants (see constants section).

constants.constant: The LinkButton will always show an underline at the bottom of its text
The LinkButton will show an underline at the bottom of its text when the mouse cursor is over it.
The LinkButton will never show an underline at the bottom of its text.

class.name: MainLoop
class.brief_description: Main loop is the abstract main loop base class.
class.description: Main loop is the abstract main loop base class. All other main loop classes are derived from it. Upon application start, a [MainLoop] has to be provided to OS, else the application will exit. This happens automatically (and a [SceneTree] is created), unless a main [Script] is supplied, which may or not create and return a [MainLoop].

class.name: MarginContainer
class.description: Simple margin container. Adds a left margin to anything contained.

class.name: Material
class.brief_description: Abstract base [Resource] for coloring and shading geometry.
class.description: Material is a base [Resource] used for coloring and shading geometry. All materials inherit from it and almost all [VisualInstance] derived nodes carry a Material. A few flags and parameters are shared between all material types and are configured here.

class.name: MenuButton
class.brief_description: Special button that brings up a [PopupMenu] when clicked.
class.description: Special button that brings up a [PopupMenu] when clicked. That's pretty much all it does, as it's just a helper class when building GUIs.

method.name: get_popup
method.description: Return the [PopupMenu] contained in this button.

class.name: Mesh
class.brief_description: A [Resource] that contains vertex-array based geometry.
class.description: Mesh is a type of [Resource] that contains vertex-array based geometry, divided in [i]surfaces[/i]. Each surface contains a completely separate array and a material used to draw it. Design wise, a mesh with multiple surfaces is preferred to a single surface, because objects created in 3D editing software commonly contain multiple materials.

method.name: add_surface_from_arrays
method.description: Create a new surface ([method get_surface_count] that will become surf_idx for this. Surfaces are created to be rendered using a "primitive", which may be PRIMITIVE_POINTS, PRIMITIVE_LINES, PRIMITIVE_LINE_STRIP, PRIMITIVE_LINE_LOOP, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_STRIP, PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_FAN. (As a note, when using indices, it is recommended to only use just points, lines or triangles). (might be obsolete) The format of a surface determines which arrays it will allocate and hold, so "format" is a combination of ARRAY_FORMAT_* mask constants ORed together. ARRAY_FORMAT_VERTEX must be always present. "array_len" determines the amount of vertices in the array (not primitives!). if ARRAY_FORMAT_INDEX is in the format mask, then it means that an index array will be allocated and "index_array_len" must be passed

method.name: get_surface_count
method.description: Return the amount of surfaces that the [Mesh] holds.

method.name: surface_get_array_index_len
method.description: Return the length in indices of the index array in the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_get_array_len
method.description: Return the length in vertices of the vertex array in the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_get_format
method.description: Return the format mask of the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_get_material
method.description: Return a [Material] in a given surface. Surface is rendered using this material.

method.name: surface_get_primitive_type
method.description: Return the primitive type of the requested surface (see [method add_surface]).

method.name: surface_remove
method.description: Remove a surface at position surf_idx, shifting greater surfaces one surf_idx slot down.

method.name: surface_set_material
method.description: Set a [Material] for a given surface. Surface will be rendered using this material.

constants.constant: Default value used for index_array_len when no indices are present.
Amount of weights/bone indices per vertex (always 4).
Tangent array, array of groups of 4 floats. first 3 floats determine the tangent, and the last the binormal direction as -1 or 1.
UV array (array of [Vector3] UVs or float array of groups of 2 floats (u,v)).
Second UV array (array of [Vector3] UVs or float array of groups of 2 floats (u,v)).
Array of bone indices, as a float array. Each element in groups of 4 floats.
Array of bone weights, as a float array. Each element in groups of 4 floats.
Array of integers, used as indices referencing vertices. No index can be beyond the vertex array size.
Array format will include a color array.
Array format will include another set of UVs.
Array format will include bone indices.
Array format will include bone weights.
Render array as points (one vertex equals one point).
Render array as lines (every two vertices a line is created).
Render array as line loop (like line strip, but closed).
Render array as triangles (every three vertices a triangle is created).

class.name: MeshInstance
class.brief_description: Node that instances meshes into a scenario.
class.description: MeshInstance is a [Node] that takes a [Mesh] resource and adds it to the current scenario by creating an instance of it. This is the class most often used to get 3D geometry rendered and can be used to instance a single [Mesh] in many places. This allows to reuse geometry and save on resources. When a [Mesh] has to be instanced more than thousands of times at close proximity, consider using a [MultiMesh] in a [MultiMeshInstance] instead.

method.name: create_trimesh_collision
method.description: This helper creates a [StaticBody] child [Node] using the mesh geometry as collision. It's mainly used for testing.

method.name: get_mesh
method.description: Return the current [Mesh] resource for the instance.

method.name: set_mesh
method.description: Set the [Mesh] resource for the instance.

class.name: MeshLibrary
class.description: Library of meshes. Contains a list of [Mesh] resources, each with name and ID. Useful for GridMap or painting Terrain.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the library.

method.name: create_item
method.description: Create a new item in the library, supplied an id.

method.name: get_item_list
method.description: Return the list of items.

method.name: get_item_mesh
method.description: Return the mesh of the item.

method.name: get_item_name
method.description: Return the name of the item.

method.name: get_last_unused_item_id
method.description: Get an unused id for a new item.

method.name: remove_item
method.description: Remove the item.

method.name: set_item_mesh
method.description: Set the mesh of the item.

method.name: set_item_name
method.description: Set the name of the item.

class.name: MultiMesh
class.description: MultiMesh provides low level mesh instancing. If the amount of [Mesh] instances needed goes from hundreds to thousands (and most need to be visible at close proximity) creating such a large amount of [MeshInstance] nodes may affect performance by using too much CPU or video memory. For this case a MultiMesh becomes very useful, as it can draw thousands of instances with little API overhead. As a drawback, if the instances are too far away of each other, performance may be reduced as every single instance will always rendered (they are spatially indexed as one, for the whole object). Since instances may have any behavior, the Rect3 used for visibility must be provided by the user, or generated with [method generate_aabb].

method.name: get_aabb
method.description: Return the visibility Rect3.

method.name: get_instance_color
method.description: Get the color of a specific instance.

method.name: get_instance_count
method.description: Return the amount of instances that is going to be drawn.

method.name: get_instance_transform
method.description: Return the transform of a specific instance.

method.name: get_mesh
method.description: Return the [Mesh] resource drawn as multiple instances.

method.name: set_instance_color
method.description: Set the color of a specific instance.

method.name: set_instance_count
method.description: Set the amount of instances that is going to be drawn. Changing this number will erase all the existing instance transform and color data.

method.name: set_instance_transform
method.description: Set the transform for a specific instance.

method.name: set_mesh
method.description: Set the [Mesh] resource to be drawn in multiple instances.

class.name: MultiMeshInstance
class.description: MultiMeshInstance is a [Node] that takes a [MultiMesh] resource and adds it to the current scenario by creating an instance of it (yes, this is an instance of instances).

method.name: get_multimesh
method.description: Return the [MultiMesh] that is used for instancing.

method.name: set_multimesh
method.description: Set the [MultiMesh] to be instance.

class.name: Mutex
class.description: A synchronization Mutex. Element used in multi-threadding. Basically a binary [Semaphore]. Guarantees that only one thread has this lock, can be used to protect a critical section.

method.name: lock
method.description: Lock this [Mutex], blocks until it is unlocked by the current owner.

method.name: try_lock
method.description: Try locking this [Mutex], does not block. Returns [OK] on success else [ERR_BUSY].

method.name: unlock
method.description: Unlock this [Mutex], leaving it to others threads.

class.name: NetworkedMultiplayerENet
class.brief_description: PacketPeer implementation using the ENet library.
class.description: A connection (or a listening server) that should be passed to [method SceneTree.set_network_peer]. Socket events can be handled by connecting to [SceneTree] signals.

class.name: Node
class.brief_description: Base class for all the [i]scene[/i] elements.
class.description: Nodes are the base bricks with which Godot games are developed. They can be set as children of other nodes, resulting in a tree arrangement. A given node can contain any number of nodes as children (but there is only one scene tree root node) with the requirement that all siblings (direct children of a node) should have unique names. Any tree of nodes is called a [i]scene[/i]. Scenes can be saved to the disk and then instanced into other scenes. This allows for very high flexibility in the architecture and data model of the projects. Nodes can optionally be added to groups. This makes it easy to reach a number of nodes from the code (for example an "enemies" group) to perform grouped actions. [b]Scene tree:[/b] The [SceneTree] contains the active tree of nodes. When a node is added to the scene tree, it receives the NOTIFICATION_ENTER_TREE notification and its [method _enter_tree] callback is triggered. Children nodes are always added [i]after[/i] their parent node, i.e. the [method _enter_tree] callback of a parent node will be triggered before its child's. Once all nodes have been added in the scene tree, they receive the NOTIFICATION_READY notification and their respective [method _ready] callbacks are triggered. For groups of nodes, the [method _ready] callback is called in reverse order, from the children up to the parent nodes. It means that when adding a scene to the scene tree, the following order will be used for the callbacks: [method _enter_tree] of the parent, [method _enter_tree] of the children, [method _ready] of the children and finally [method _ready] of the parent (and that recursively for the whole scene). [b]Processing:[/b] Nodes can be set to the "process" state, so that they receive a callback on each frame requesting them to process (do something). Normal processing (callback [method _process], toggled with [method set_process]) happens as fast as possible and is dependent on the frame rate, so the processing time [i]delta[/i] is variable. Fixed processing (callback [method _fixed_process], toggled with [method set_fixed_process]) happens a fixed amount of times per second (by default 60) and is useful to link itself to the physics. Nodes can also process input events. When set, the [method _input] function will be called for each input that the program receives. In many cases, this can be overkill (unless used for simple projects), and the [method _unhandled_input] function might be preferred; it is called when the input event was not handled by anyone else (typically, GUI [Control] nodes), ensuring that the node only receives the events that were meant for it. To keep track of the scene hierarchy (especially when instancing scenes into other scenes), an "owner" can be set for the node with [method set_owner]. This keeps track of who instanced what. This is mostly useful when writing editors and tools, though. Finally, when a node is freed with [method free] or [method queue_free], it will also free all its children. [b]Networking with nodes:[/b] After connecting to a server (or making one, see [NetworkedMultiplayerENet]) it is possible to use the built-in RPC (remote procedure call) system to easily communicate over the network. By calling [method rpc] with a method name, it will be called locally, and in all connected peers (peers = clients and the server that accepts connections), with behaviour varying depending on the network mode ([method set_network_mode]) on the receiving peer. To identify which [Node] receives the RPC call Godot will use its [NodePath] (make sure node names are the same on all peers).

method.name: _enter_tree
method.description: Called when the node enters the [SceneTree] (e.g. upon instancing, scene changing or after calling [method add_child] in a script). If the node has children, its [method _enter_tree] callback will be called first, and then that of the children. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_ENTER_TREE notification in [method Object._notification].

method.name: _exit_tree
method.description: Called when the node leaves the [SceneTree] (e.g. upon freeing, scene changing or after calling [method remove_child] in a script). If the node has children, its [method _exit_tree] callback will be called last, after all its children have left the tree. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_EXIT_TREE notification in [method Object._notification].

method.name: _fixed_process
method.description: Called during the fixed processing step of the main loop. Fixed processing means that the frame rate is synced to the physics, i.e. the [code]delta[/code] variable should be constant. It is only called if fixed processing has been enabled with [method set_fixed_process]. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_FIXED_PROCESS notification in [method Object._notification].

method.name: _input
method.description: Called for every input event. It has to be enabled with [method set_process_input] or the corresponding property in the inspector.

method.name: _process
method.description: Called during the processing step of the main loop. Processing happens at every frame and as fast as possible, so the [code]delta[/code] time since the previous frame is not constant. It is only called if processing has been enabled with [method set_process]. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_PROCESS notification in [method Object._notification].

method.name: _ready
method.description: Called when the node is "ready", i.e. when both the node and its children have entered the scene tree. If the node has children, their [method _ready] callback gets triggered first, and the node will receive the ready notification only afterwards. Corresponds to the NOTIFICATION_READY notification in [method Object._notification].

method.name: _unhandled_input
method.description: Called for every input event that has not already been handled by another node. It has to be enabled with [method set_process_unhandled_input] or the corresponding property in the inspector.

method.name: _unhandled_key_input
method.description: Called for every [i]key[/i] input event that has not already been handled by another node. It has to be enabled with [method set_process_unhandled_key_input] or the corresponding property in the inspector.

method.name: add_child
method.description: Add a child [Node]. Nodes can have as many children as they want, but every child must have a unique name. Children nodes are automatically deleted when the parent node is deleted, so deleting a whole scene is performed by deleting its topmost node. The optional boolean argument enforces creating child nodes with human-readable names, based on the name of the node being instanced instead of its type only.

method.name: add_to_group
method.description: Add a node to a group. Groups are helpers to name and organize a subset of nodes, like for example "enemies" or "collectables". A [Node] can be in any number of groups. Nodes can be assigned a group at any time, but will not be added to it until they are inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]).

method.name: can_process
method.description: Return true if the node can process, i.e. whether its pause mode allows processing while the scene tree is paused (see [method set_pause_mode]). Always returns true if the scene tree is not paused, and false if the node is not in the tree. FIXME: Why FAIL_COND?

method.name: duplicate
method.description: Duplicate the node, returning a new [Node]. You can fine-tune the behavior using the [code]flags[/code], which are based on the DUPLICATE_* constants.

method.name: find_node
method.description: Find a descendant of this node whose name matches [code]mask[/code] as in [method String.match] (i.e. case sensitive, but '*' matches zero or more characters and '?' matches any single character except '.'). Note that it does not match against the full path, just against individual node names.

method.name: get_child
method.description: Return a child node by its index (see [method get_child_count]). This method is often used for iterating all children of a node.

method.name: get_child_count
method.description: Return the amount of child nodes.

method.name: get_children
method.description: Return an array of references ([Node]) to the child nodes.

method.name: get_filename
method.description: Return a filename that may be contained by the node. When a scene is instanced from a file, it topmost node contains the filename from where it was loaded (see [method set_filename]).

method.name: get_fixed_process_delta_time
method.description: Return the time elapsed since the last fixed frame (see [method _fixed_process]). This is always the same in fixed processing unless the frames per second is changed in [OS].

method.name: get_groups
method.description: Return an array listing the groups that the node is part of.

method.name: get_index
method.description: Get the node index, i.e. its position among the siblings of its parent.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Return the name of the node. This name is unique among the siblings (other child nodes from the same parent).

method.name: get_node
method.description: Fetch a node. The [NodePath] must be valid (or else an error will be raised) and can be either the path to child node, a relative path (from the current node to another node), or an absolute path to a node. Note: fetching absolute paths only works when the node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]). [i]Example:[/i] Assume your current node is Character and the following tree: [codeblock] /root /root/Character /root/Character/Sword /root/Character/Backpack/Dagger /root/MyGame /root/Swamp/Alligator /root/Swamp/Mosquito /root/Swamp/Goblin [/codeblock] Possible paths are: [codeblock] get_node("Sword") get_node("Backpack/Dagger") get_node("../Swamp/Alligator") get_node("/root/MyGame") [/codeblock]

method.name: get_owner
method.description: Get the node owner (see [method set_owner]).

method.name: get_parent
method.description: Return the parent node of the current node, or an empty [Node] if the node lacks a parent.

method.name: get_path
method.description: Return the absolute path of the current node. This only works if the current node is inside the scene tree (see [method is_inside_tree]).

method.name: get_path_to
method.description: Return the relative path from the current node to the specified node in "node" argument. Both nodes must be in the same scene, or else the function will fail.

method.name: get_process_delta_time
method.description: Return the time elapsed (in seconds) since the last process callback. This is almost always different each time.

method.name: is_a_parent_of
method.description: Return [i]true[/i] if the "node" argument is a direct or indirect child of the current node, otherwise return [i]false[/i].

method.name: is_fixed_processing
method.description: Return true if fixed processing is enabled (see [method set_fixed_process]).

method.name: is_greater_than
method.description: Return [i]true[/i] if "node" occurs later in the scene hierarchy than the current node, otherwise return [i]false[/i].

method.name: is_processing
method.description: Return whether processing is enabled in the current node (see [method set_process]).

method.name: is_processing_input
method.description: Return true if the node is processing input (see [method set_process_input]).

method.name: is_processing_unhandled_input
