method.description: Return true if the node is processing unhandled input (see [method set_process_unhandled_input]).

method.name: move_child
method.description: Move a child node to a different position (order) amongst the other children. Since calls, signals, etc are performed by tree order, changing the order of children nodes may be useful.

method.name: print_tree
method.description: Print the scene to stdout. Used mainly for debugging purposes.

method.name: propagate_notification
method.description: Notify the current node and all its children recursively by calling notification() in all of them.

method.name: raise
method.description: Move this node to the top of the array of nodes of the parent node. This is often useful on GUIs ([Control]), because their order of drawing fully depends on their order in the tree.

method.name: remove_and_skip
method.description: Remove a node and set all its children as children of the parent node (if exists). All even subscriptions that pass by the removed node will be unsubscribed.

method.name: remove_child
method.description: Remove a child [Node]. Node is NOT deleted and will have to be deleted manually.

method.name: remove_from_group
method.description: Remove a node from a group.

method.name: replace_by
method.description: Replace a node in a scene by a given one. Subscriptions that pass through this node will be lost.

method.name: rpc
method.description: Send a remote procedure call request to all peers on the network (and locally), optionally sending additional data as arguments. Call request will be received by nodes with the same [NodePath].

method.name: rpc_config
method.description: Change the method's RPC mode (one of RPC_MODE_* constants).

method.name: rpc_id
method.description: Send a [method rpc] to a specific peer identified by [i]peer_id[/i].

method.name: rpc_unreliable
method.description: Send a [method rpc] using an unreliable protocol.

method.name: rpc_unreliable_id
method.description: Send a [method rpc] to a specific peer identified by [i]peer_id[/i] using an unreliable protocol.

method.name: rset
method.description: Remotely change property's value on other peers (and locally).

method.name: rset_config
method.description: Change the property's RPC mode (one of RPC_MODE_* constants).

method.name: rset_id
method.description: Remotely change property's value on a specific peer identified by [i]peer_id[/i].

method.name: rset_unreliable
method.description: Remotely change property's value on other peers (and locally) using an unreliable protocol.

method.name: rset_unreliable_id
method.description: Remotely change property's value on a specific peer identified by [i]peer_id[/i] using an unreliable protocol.

method.name: set_filename
method.description: A node can contain a filename. This filename should not be changed by the user, unless writing editors and tools. When a scene is instanced from a file, it topmost node contains the filename from where it was loaded.

method.name: set_fixed_process
method.description: Enables or disables node fixed framerate processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PROCESS at a fixed (usually 60 fps, check [OS] to change that) interval (and the [method _fixed_process] callback will be called if exists). It is common to check how much time was elapsed since the previous frame by calling [method get_fixed_process_delta_time].

method.name: set_name
method.description: Set the name of the [Node]. Name must be unique within parent, and setting an already existing name will cause for the node to be automatically renamed.

method.name: set_network_mode
method.description: Change the networking mode of the [Node], where [i]mode[/i] is one of the constants NETWORK_MODE_*. Master nodes will only call gdscript methods defined as [i]master func[/i] if a RPC call is received (slave nodes will only call [i]slave func[/i]; both will call [i]remote func[/i] if the call is not local, and [i]sync func[/i] in any case). Inherit mode looks at the parent node to determine the value (root node depends on the [SceneTree] having a networking peer set with [method SceneTree.set_network_peer])

method.name: set_owner
method.description: Set the node owner. A node can have any other node as owner (as long as a valid parent, grandparent, etc ascending in the tree). When saving a node (using SceneSaver) all the nodes it owns will be saved with it. This allows to create complex SceneTrees, with instancing and subinstancing.

method.name: set_process
method.description: Enables or disables node processing. When a node is being processed, it will receive a NOTIFICATION_PROCESS on every drawn frame (and the [method _process] callback will be called if exists). It is common to check how much time was elapsed since the previous frame by calling [method get_process_delta_time].

method.name: set_process_input
method.description: Enable input processing for node. This is not required for GUI controls! It hooks up the node to receive all input (see [method _input]).

method.name: set_process_unhandled_input
method.description: Enable unhandled input processing for node. This is not required for GUI controls! It hooks up the node to receive all input that was not previously handled before (usually by a [Control]). (see [method _unhandled_input]).

signal.name: renamed
signal.description: Emitted when the node is renamed.

constants.constant: Notification received every frame when the process flag is set (see [method set_process]).
Notification received when a node is set as a child of another node. Note that this doesn't mean that a node entered the Scene Tree.
Notification received when a node is unparented (parent removed it from the list of children).

class.name: Node2D
class.description: Base node for 2D system. Node2D contains a position, rotation and scale, which is used to position and animate. It can alternatively be used with a custom 2D transform ([Transform2D]). A tree of Node2Ds allows complex hierarchies for animation and positioning.

method.name: edit_set_pivot
method.description: Set the pivot position of the 2D node to 'pivot' value. This method is implemented only in some nodes that inherit Node2D.

method.name: get_angle_to
method.description: Return the rotation angle in radians needed for the 2d node to point at 'point' position.

method.name: get_global_position
method.description: Return the global position of the 2D node.

method.name: get_global_rotation
method.description: Return the global rotation in radians of the 2D node.

method.name: get_global_rotation_in_degrees
method.description: Return the global rotation in degrees of the 2D node.

method.name: get_global_scale
method.description: Return the global scale of the 2D node.

method.name: get_position
method.description: Return the position of the 2D node.

method.name: get_relative_transform_to_parent
method.description: Return the transform [Transform2D] calculated relatively to the parent of this 2D node.

method.name: get_rotation
method.description: Return the rotation in radians of the 2D node.

method.name: get_rotation_in_degrees
method.description: Return the rotation in degrees of the 2D node.

method.name: get_scale
method.description: Return the scale of the 2D node.

method.name: get_z
method.description: Return the Z-index of the 2D node.

method.name: global_translate
method.description: Apply a global translation of 'offset' to the 2D node, starting from its current global position.

method.name: is_z_relative
method.description: Return true if the Z-index value of this 2D node is relative to its parent's. Else, return false.

method.name: look_at
method.description: Rotate the 2d node so it points at 'point' position.

method.name: move_local_x
method.description: Apply a local translation on X axis to the 2D node according to the 'delta' of the process. If 'scaled' is false, the movement is normalized.

method.name: move_local_y
method.description: Apply a local translation on Y axis to the 2D node according to the 'delta' of the process. If 'scaled' is false, the movement is normalized.

method.name: rotate
method.description: Apply a 'radians' rotation to the 2D node, starting from its current rotation.

method.name: scale
method.description: Apply the 'ratio' scale to the 2D node, according to its current scale value.

method.name: set_global_position
method.description: Set the global position of the 2D node.

method.name: set_global_rotation
method.description: Set the global rotation in radians of the 2D node

method.name: set_global_rotation_in_degrees
method.description: Set the global rotation in degrees of the 2D node

method.name: set_global_scale
method.description: Set the global scale of the 2D node.

method.name: set_global_transform
method.description: Set the global transform [Transform2D] of the 2D node.

method.name: set_position
method.description: Set the position of the 2D node.

method.name: set_rotation
method.description: Set the rotation in radians of the 2D node.

method.name: set_rotation_in_degrees
method.description: Set the rotation in degrees of the 2D node.

method.name: set_scale
method.description: Set the scale of the 2D node.

method.name: set_transform
method.description: Set the local transform [Transform2D] of the 2D node.

method.name: set_z
method.description: Set the Z-index value of the 2D node.

method.name: set_z_as_relative
method.description: Set the Z-index value as relative to the parent node of this 2D node. Thus, if this 2D node's Z-index value is 2 and its parent's effective Z-index is 3, then the effective Z-index value of this 2D node would be 3 + 2 = 5.

method.name: translate
method.description: Apply a local translation of 'offset' to the 2D node, starting from its current local position.

class.name: NodePath
class.description: A pre-parsed relative or absolute path in a scene tree, for use with [method Node.get_node] and similar functions. It can reference a node, a resource within a node, or a property of a node or resource. For instance, [code]"Path2D/PathFollow2D/Sprite:texture:size"[/code] would refer to the size property of the texture resource on the node named "Sprite" which is a child of the other named nodes in the path. Note that if you want to get a resource, you must end the path with a colon, otherwise the last element will be used as a property name. You will usually just pass a string to [method Node.get_node] and it will be automatically converted, but you may occasionally want to parse a path ahead of time with [NodePath] or the literal syntax [code]@"path"[/code]. Exporting a [NodePath] variable will give you a node selection widget in the properties panel of the editor, which can often be useful. A [NodePath] is made up of a list of node names, a list of "subnode" (resource) names, and the name of a property in the final node or resource.

method.name: NodePath
method.description: Create a NodePath from a string, e.g. "Path2D/PathFollow2D/Sprite:texture:size". A path is absolute if it starts with a slash. Absolute paths are only valid in the global scene tree, not within individual scenes. In a relative path, [code]"."[/code] and [code]".."[/code] indicate the current node and its parent.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Get the node name indicated by [code]idx[/code] (0 to [method get_name_count])

method.name: get_name_count
method.description: Get the number of node names which make up the path.

method.name: get_property
method.description: Get the path's property name, or an empty string if the path doesn't have a property.

method.name: get_subname
method.description: Get the resource name indicated by [code]idx[/code] (0 to [method get_subname_count])

method.name: get_subname_count
method.description: Get the number of resource names in the path.

method.name: is_absolute
method.description: Return true if the node path is absolute (not relative).

method.name: is_empty
method.description: Return true if the node path is empty.

class.name: OS
class.description: Operating System functions. OS Wraps the most common functionality to communicate with the host Operating System, such as: mouse grabbing, mouse cursors, clipboard, video mode, date and time, timers, environment variables, execution of binaries, command line, etc.

method.name: alert
method.description: Displays a modal dialog box utilizing the host OS.

method.name: can_draw
method.description: Return true if the host OS allows drawing.

method.name: can_use_threads
method.description: Returns if the current host platform is using multiple threads.

method.name: delay_msec
method.description: Delay executing of the current thread by given milliseconds.

method.name: delay_usec
method.description: Delay executing of the current thread by given microseconds.

method.name: dump_memory_to_file
method.description: Dumps the memory allocation ringlist to a file (only works in debug). Entry format per line: "Address - Size - Description"

method.name: dump_resources_to_file
method.description: Dumps all used resources to file (only works in debug). Entry format per line: "Resource Type : Resource Location" At the end of the file is a statistic of all used Resource Types.

method.name: execute
method.description: Execute the binary file in given path, optionally blocking until it returns. A process ID is returned.

method.name: find_scancode_from_string
method.description: Returns the scancode of the given string (e.g. "Escape")

method.name: get_borderless_window
method.description: Returns true if the current window is borderless.

method.name: get_clipboard
method.description: Get clipboard from the host OS.

method.name: get_cmdline_args
method.description: Return the commandline passed to the engine.

method.name: get_current_screen
method.description: Returns the current screen index (0 padded).

method.name: get_data_dir
method.description: Return the absolute directory path of user data path([user://]).

method.name: get_date
method.description: Returns current date as a dictionary of keys: year, month, day, weekday, dst (daylight savings time).

method.name: get_datetime
method.description: Returns current datetime as a dictionary of keys: year, month, day, weekday, dst (daylight savings time), hour, minute, second.

method.name: get_datetime_from_unix_time
method.description: Get a dictionary of time values when given epoch time. Dictionary Time values will be a union of values from [method get_time] and [method get_date] dictionaries (with the exception of dst = day light standard time, as it cannot be determined from epoch).

method.name: get_dynamic_memory_usage
method.description: Return the total amount of dynamic memory used (only works in debug).

method.name: get_environment
method.description: Return an environment variable.

method.name: get_executable_path
method.description: Return the path to the current engine executable.

method.name: get_latin_keyboard_variant
method.description: Returns the current latin keyboard variant as a String. Possible return values are: "QWERTY", "AZERTY", "QZERTY", "DVORAK", "NEO" or "ERROR"

method.name: get_locale
method.description: Return the host OS locale.

method.name: get_model_name
method.description: Returns the model name of the current device.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Return the name of the host OS. Possible values are: "Android", "BlackBerry 10", "Flash", "Haiku", "iOS", "HTML5", "OSX", "Server", "Windows", "UWP", "X11"

method.name: get_process_ID
method.description: Returns the game process ID

method.name: get_processor_count
method.description: Returns the number of cores available in the host machine.

method.name: get_scancode_string
method.description: Returns the given scancode as a string (e.g. Return values: "Escape", "Shift+Escape").

method.name: get_screen_count
method.description: Returns the number of displays attached to the host machine

method.name: get_screen_dpi
method.description:
Returns the dots per inch density of the specified screen.
On Android Devices, the actual screen densities are grouped into six generalized densities: ldpi - 120 dpi mdpi - 160 dpi hdpi - 240 dpi xhdpi - 320 dpi xxhdpi - 480 dpi xxxhdpi - 640 dpi

method.name: get_screen_orientation
method.description: Returns the current screen orientation, the return value will be one of the SCREEN_ORIENTATION constants in this class.

method.name: get_screen_size
method.description: Returns the dimensions in pixels of the specified screen.

method.name: get_static_memory_peak_usage
method.description: Return the max amount of static memory used (only works in debug).

method.name: get_ticks_msec
method.description: Return the amount of time passed in milliseconds since the engine started.

method.name: get_time
method.description: Returns current time as a dictionary of keys: hour, minute, second

method.name: get_unix_time
method.description: Return the current unix timestamp.

method.name: get_unix_time_from_datetime
method.description: Get an epoch time value from a dictionary of time values. [code]datetime[/code] must be populated with the following keys: year, month, day, hour, minute, second. You can pass the output from [method get_datetime_from_unix_time] directly into this function. Daylight savings time (dst), if present, is ignored.

method.name: get_window_position
method.description: Returns the window position relative to the screen, the origin is the top left corner, +Y axis goes to the bottom and +X axis goes to the right.

method.name: get_window_size
method.description: Returns the size of the window (without counting window manager decorations).

method.name: has_environment
method.description: Return true if an environment variable exists.

method.name: has_virtual_keyboard
method.description: Returns true if the platform has a virtual keyboard, false otherwise.

method.name: hide_virtual_keyboard
method.description: Hides the virtual keyboard if it is shown, does nothing otherwise.

method.name: is_in_low_processor_usage_mode
method.description: Return true if low cpu usage mode is enabled.

method.name: is_keep_screen_on
method.description: Returns whether the screen is being kept on or not.

method.name: is_stdout_verbose
method.description: Return true if the engine was executed with -v (verbose stdout).

method.name: is_window_fullscreen
method.description: Returns whether the window is in fullscreen mode or not.

method.name: is_window_maximized
method.description: Return true if the window is maximized.

method.name: is_window_minimized
method.description: Return true if the window is minimized.

method.name: is_window_resizable
method.description: Returns whether the window is resizable or not.

method.name: kill
method.description: Kill a process ID (this method can be used to kill processes that were not spawned by the game).

method.name: request_attention
method.description: Request the user attention to the window. It'll flash the taskbar button on Windows or bounce the dock icon on OSX.

method.name: set_clipboard
method.description: Set clipboard to the OS.

method.name: set_keep_screen_on
method.description: Set keep screen on if true, or goes to sleep by device setting if false. (for Android/iOS)

method.name: set_low_processor_usage_mode
method.description: Set to true to enable the low cpu usage mode. In this mode, the screen only redraws when there are changes, and a considerable sleep time is inserted between frames. This way, editors using the engine UI only use very little cpu.

method.name: set_screen_orientation
method.description: Sets the current screen orientation, the argument value must be one of the SCREEN_ORIENTATION constants in this class.

method.name: set_window_fullscreen
method.description: Sets window fullscreen mode to the [i]enabled[/i] argument, [i]enabled[/i] is a toggle for the fullscreen mode, calling the function with [i]enabled[/i] true when the screen is not on fullscreen mode will cause the screen to go to fullscreen mode, calling the function with [i]enabled[/i] false when the screen is in fullscreen mode will cause the window to exit the fullscreen mode.

method.name: set_window_maximized
method.description: Set the window size to maximized.

method.name: set_window_minimized
method.description: Set whether the window is minimized.

method.name: set_window_position
method.description: Sets the position of the window to the specified position (this function could be restricted by the window manager, meaning that there could be some unreachable areas of the screen).

method.name: set_window_resizable
method.description: Set the window resizable state, if the window is not resizable it will preserve the dimensions specified in the project settings.

method.name: set_window_size
method.description: Sets the window size to the specified size.

method.name: set_window_title
method.description: Sets the window title to the specified string.

method.name: show_virtual_keyboard
method.description: Shows the virtual keyboard if the platform has one. The [i]existing_text[/i] parameter is useful for implementing your own LineEdit, as it tells the virtual keyboard what text has already been typed (the virtual keyboard uses it for auto-correct and predictions).

class.name: Object
class.brief_description: Base class for all non built-in types.
class.description: Base class for all non built-in types. Everything not a built-in type starts the inheritance chain from this class. Objects do not manage memory, if inheriting from one the object will most likely have to be deleted manually (call the [method free] function from the script or delete from C++). Some derivates add memory management, such as [Reference] (which keeps a reference count and deletes itself automatically when no longer referenced) and [Node], which deletes the children tree when deleted. Objects export properties, which are mainly useful for storage and editing, but not really so much in programming. Properties are exported in [method _get_property_list] and handled in [method _get] and [method _set]. However, scripting languages and C++ have simpler means to export them. Objects also receive notifications ([method _notification]). Notifications are a simple way to notify the object about simple events, so they can all be handled together.

method.name: XL_MESSAGE
method.description: Deprecated, will go away.

method.name: _get
method.description: Return a property, return null if the property does not exist.

method.name: _get_property_list
method.description: Return the property list, array of dictionaries, dictionaries must contain: name:String, type:int (see TYPE_* enum in globals) and optionally: hint:int (see PROPERTY_HINT_* in globals), hint_string:String, usage:int (see PROPERTY_USAGE_* in globals).

method.name: _notification
method.description: Notification request, the notification id is received.

method.name: _set
method.description: Set a property. Return true if the property was found.

method.name: add_user_signal
method.description: Add a user signal (can be added anytime). Arguments are optional, but can be added as an array of dictionaries, each containing "name" and "type" (from [@Global Scope] TYPE_*).

method.name: can_translate_messages
method.description: Return true if this object can translate strings.

method.name: connect
method.description: Connect a signal to a method at a target (member function). Binds are optional and are passed as extra arguments to the call. Flags specify optional deferred or one shot connections, see enum CONNECT_*. A signal can only be connected once to a method, and it will throw an error if already connected. If you want to avoid this, use [method is_connected] to check.

method.name: disconnect
method.description: Disconnect a signal from a method.

method.name: get
method.description: Get a property from the object.

method.name: get_class
method.description: Return the class of the object as a string.

method.name: get_instance_ID
method.description: Return the instance ID. All objects have a unique instance ID.

method.name: get_meta
method.description: Return a metadata from the object.

method.name: get_meta_list
method.description: Return the list of metadata in the object.

method.name: get_property_list
method.description: Return the list of properties as an array of dictionaries, dictionaries contain: name:String, type:int (see TYPE_* enum in globals) and optionally: hint:int (see PROPERTY_HINT_* in globals), hint_string:String, usage:int (see PROPERTY_USAGE_* in globals).

method.name: get_script
method.description: Return the object script (or null if it doesn't have one).

method.name: get_signal_list
method.description: Return the list of signals as an array of dictionaries.

method.name: has_meta
method.description: Return true if a metadata is found with the requested name.

method.name: is_blocking_signals
method.description: Return true if signal emission blocking is enabled.

method.name: is_class
method.description: Check the class of the object against a string (including inheritance).

method.name: is_connected
method.description: Return true if a connection exists for a given signal and target/method.

method.name: notification
method.description: Notify the object of something.

method.name: set
method.description: Set property into the object.

method.name: set_block_signals
method.description: If set to true, signal emission is blocked.

method.name: set_message_translation
method.description: Set true if this object can translate strings (in calls to tr() ). Default is true.

method.name: set_meta
method.description: Set a metadata into the object. Metadata is serialized. Metadata can be [i]anything[/i].

method.name: set_script
method.description: Set a script into the object, scripts extend the object functionality.

method.name: tr
method.description: Translate a message. Only works in message translation is enabled (which is by default). See [method set_message_translation].

constants.constant: Called right when the object is initialized. Not available in script.
Called before the object is about to be deleted.
Connect a signal in deferred mode. This way, signal emissions are stored in a queue, then set on idle time.
Persisting connections are saved when the object is serialized to file.
One short connections disconnect themselves after emission.

class.name: OmniLight
class.brief_description: OmniDirectional Light, such as a light bulb or a candle.
class.description: An OmniDirectional light is a type of [Light] node that emits lights in all directions. The light is attenuated through the distance and this attenuation can be configured by changing the energy, radius and attenuation parameters of [Light]. TODO: Image of an omnilight.

class.name: OptionButton
class.brief_description: Button control that provides selectable options when pressed.
class.description: OptionButton is a type button that provides a selectable list of items when pressed. The item selected becomes the "current" item and is displayed as the button text.

method.name: add_icon_item
method.description: Add an item, with a "texture" icon, text "label" and (optionally) id. If no "id" is passed, "id" becomes the item index. New items are appended at the end.

method.name: add_item
method.description: Add an item, with text "label" and (optionally) id. If no "id" is passed, "id" becomes the item index. New items are appended at the end.

method.name: add_separator
method.description: Add a separator to the list of items. Separators help to group items. Separator also takes up an index and is appended at the end.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear all the items in the [OptionButton].

method.name: get_item_ID
method.description: Return the ID of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_count
method.description: Return the amount of items in the OptionButton.

method.name: get_item_icon
method.description: Return the icon of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_text
method.description: Return the text of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_selected
method.description: Return the current item index

method.name: select
method.description: Select an item by index and make it the current item.

method.name: set_item_ID
method.description: Set the ID of an item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_icon
method.description: Set the icon of an item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_text
method.description: Set the text of an item at index "idx".

signal.name: item_selected
signal.description: This signal is emitted when the current item was changed by the user. ID of the item selected is passed as argument (if no IDs were added, ID will be just the item index).

class.name: PHashTranslation
class.description: Optimized translation. Uses real-time compressed translations, which results in very small dictionaries.

class.name: PackedScene
class.description: TODO: explain ownership, and that node does not need to own itself

method.name: pack
method.description: Pack will ignore any sub-nodes not owned by given node. See [method Node.set_owner].

class.name: PacketPeer
class.brief_description: Abstraction and base class for packet-based protocols.
class.description: PacketPeer is an abstraction and base class for packet-based protocols (such as UDP). It provides an API for sending and receiving packets both as raw data or variables. This makes it easy to transfer data over a protocol, without having to encode data as low level bytes or having to worry about network ordering.

method.name: get_available_packet_count
method.description: Return the number of packets currently available in the ring-buffer.

method.name: get_packet
method.description: Get a raw packet.

method.name: get_packet_error
method.description: Return the error state of the last packet received (via [method get_packet] and [method get_var]).

method.name: get_var
method.description: Get a Variant.

method.name: put_packet
method.description: Send a raw packet.

method.name: put_var
method.description: Send a Variant as a packet.

class.name: PacketPeerStream
class.brief_description: Wrapper to use a PacketPeer over a StreamPeer.
class.description: PacketStreamPeer provides a wrapper for working using packets over a stream. This allows for using packet based code with StreamPeers. PacketPeerStream implements a custom protocol over the StreamPeer, so the user should not read or write to the wrapped StreamPeer directly.

method.name: set_stream_peer
method.description: Set the StreamPeer object to be wrapped

class.name: PacketPeerUDP
class.description: UDP packet peer. Can be used to send raw UDP packets as well as [Variant]s.

method.name: close
method.description: Close the UDP socket the [PacketPeerUDP] is currently listening on.

method.name: get_packet_ip
method.description: Return the IP of the remote peer that sent the last packet(that was received with [method get_packet] or [method get_var]).

method.name: get_packet_port
method.description: Return the port of the remote peer that sent the last packet(that was received with [method get_packet] or [method get_var]).

method.name: is_listening
method.description: Return whether this [PacketPeerUDP] is listening.

method.name: listen
method.description: Make this [PacketPeerUDP] listen on the "port" binding to "bind_address" with a buffer size "recv_buf_size". If "bind_address" is set as "*" (default), the peer will listen on all available addresses (both IPv4 and IPv6). If "bind_address" is set as "0.0.0.0" (for IPv4) or "::" (for IPv6), the peer will listen on all available addresses matching that IP type. If "bind_address" is set to any valid address (e.g. "192.168.1.101", "::1", etc), the peer will only listen on the interface with that addresses (or fail if no interface with the given address exists).

method.name: set_dest_address
method.description: Set the destination address and port for sending packets and variables, a hostname will be resolved using if valid.

method.name: wait
method.description: Wait for a packet to arrive on the listening port, see [method listen].

class.name: Panel
class.brief_description: Provides an opaque background for [Control] children.
class.description: Panel is a [Control] that displays an opaque background. It's commonly used as a parent and container for other types of [Control] nodes.

class.name: PanelContainer
class.description: Panel container type. This container fits controls inside of the delimited area of a stylebox. It's useful for giving controls an outline.

class.name: ParallaxBackground
class.brief_description: A node used to create a parallax scrolling background.
class.description: A ParallaxBackground will use one or more [ParallaxLayer] nodes to create a parallax scrolling background. Each [ParallaxLayer] can be set to move at different speeds relative to the camera movement, this can be used to create an illusion of depth in a 2D game.

method.name: get_limit_begin
method.description: Return the beginning limit.

method.name: get_limit_end
method.description: Return the ending limit.

method.name: get_scroll_base_offset
method.description: Return the base offset.

method.name: get_scroll_base_scale
method.description: Return the base motion scale.

method.name: is_ignore_camera_zoom
method.description: Return ignoring camera zoom.

method.name: set_ignore_camera_zoom
method.description: Set to true for all child [ParallaxLayer] nodes to not be affected by the zoom level of the camera.

method.name: set_limit_begin
method.description: Set the left and top limits in pixels for scrolling to begin. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will not continue to scroll. If an axis is greater than or equal to the corresponding axis of limit_end, then it will not limit scrolling for that axis.

method.name: set_limit_end
method.description: Set the right and bottom limits in pixels for scrolling to end. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will not continue to scroll. If an axis is less than or equal to the corresponding axis of limit_begin, then it will not limit scrolling for that axis.

method.name: set_scroll_base_offset
method.description: Set the base offset in pixels of all children [ParallaxLayer] nodes.

method.name: set_scroll_base_scale
method.description: Set the base motion scale of all children [ParallaxLayer] nodes.

class.name: ParallaxLayer
class.brief_description: A parallax scrolling layer to be used with [ParallaxBackground].
class.description: A ParallaxLayer must be the child of a [ParallaxBackground] node. All child nodes will be affected by the parallax scrolling of this layer.

method.name: get_mirroring
method.description: Return the mirroring of the ParallaxLayer.

method.name: get_motion_scale
method.description: Return the motion scale of the ParallaxLayer.

method.name: set_mirroring
method.description: Set the mirroring of the ParallaxLayer. If an axis is set to 0 then that axis will have no mirroring.

method.name: set_motion_scale
method.description: Set the motion scale of the ParallaxLayer. If an axis is set to 0 then it will not move at all, it will stick with the camera.

class.name: Particles2D
class.description: Particles2D is a particle system 2D [Node] that is used to simulate several types of particle effects, such as explosions, rain, snow, fireflies, or other magical-like shinny sparkles. Particles are drawn using impostors, and given their dynamic behavior, the user must provide a visibility bounding box (although helpers to create one automatically exist).

method.name: get_amount
method.description: Returns the amount of particles spawned at each emission

method.name: get_color
method.description: Returns the tint color for each particle.

method.name: get_color_ramp
method.description: Returns the [ColorRamp] used to tint each particle

method.name: get_emission_half_extents
method.description: Returns the half extents of the emission box.

method.name: get_emissor_offset
method.description: Returns the particle spawn origin position relative to the emitter.

method.name: get_emit_timeout
method.description: Returns the amount of seconds during which the emitter will spawn particles

method.name: get_lifetime
method.description: Gets the amount of seconds that each particle will be visible.

method.name: get_param
method.description: Returns the value of the specified emitter parameter

method.name: get_randomness
method.description: Returns the randomness value of the specified emitter parameter

method.name: get_texture
method.description: Returns the texture for emitted particles

method.name: get_time_scale
method.description: Returns the emitter time scale

method.name: is_emitting
method.description: Returns whether this emitter is currently emitting or not

method.name: set_amount
method.description: Sets the amount of particles spawned at each emission

method.name: set_color
method.description: Set the tint color for each particle.

method.name: set_color_ramp
method.description: Sets the [ColorRamp] used to tint each particle. Particle will be tinted according to their lifetimes.

method.name: set_emission_half_extents
method.description: Sets the half extents of the emission box, particles will be spawned at random inside this box.

method.name: set_emissor_offset
method.description: Sets the particle spawn origin position relative to the emitter center. for example if this value is set to (50, 50), the particle will spawn 50 units to the right and 50 units to the bottom of the emitter center.

method.name: set_emit_timeout
method.description: Sets the amount of seconds during which the emitter will spawn particles, after the specified seconds the emitter state will be set to non emitting, so calling [method is_emitting] will return false. If the timeout is 0 the emitter will spawn forever.

method.name: set_emitting
method.description: If this is set to true then the particle emitter will emit particles, if its false it will not.

method.name: set_lifetime
method.description: Sets the amount of seconds that each particle will be visible.

method.name: set_param
method.description: Sets the value of the specified emitter parameter (see the constants secction for the list of parameters)

method.name: set_randomness
method.description: Sets the randomness value of the specified emitter parameter (see the constants secction for the list of parameters), 0 means no randomness, so every particle will have the parameters specified, 1 means that the parameter will be chosen at random, the closer the randomness value gets to 0 the more conservative the variation of the parameter will be.

method.name: set_texture
method.description: Sets the texture for each particle

method.name: set_time_scale
method.description: Sets the increment or decrement for the particle lifetime. for example: if the time scale is set to 2, the particles will die and move twice as fast.

constants.constant: Direction in degrees at which the particles will be launched, Notice that when the direction is set to 0 the particles will be launched to the negative
Velocity at which the particles will be launched.
The speed at which particles will spin around its own center.
Velocity at which the particles will orbit around the emitter center
Direction in degrees at which the particles will be attracted
Strength of the gravitation attraction for each particle
Amount of damping for each particle
Initial angle in radians at which each particle will be spawned
Final size of each particle, the particle size will interpolate to this value during its lifetime.

class.name: Path
class.description: This class is a container/Node-ification of a [Curve3D], so it can have [Spatial] properties and [Node] info.

method.name: get_curve
method.description: Returns the [Curve3D] contained.

method.name: set_curve
method.description: Sets the [Curve3D].

class.name: Path2D
class.description: This class is a container/Node-ification of a [Curve2D], so it can have [Node2D] properties and [Node] info.

method.name: get_curve
method.description: Returns the [Curve2D] contained.

method.name: set_curve
method.description: Sets the [Curve2D].

class.name: PathFollow
class.description: This node takes its parent [Path], and returns the coordinates of a point within it, given a distance from the first vertex. It is useful for making other nodes follow a path, without coding the movement pattern. For that, the nodes must be descendants of this node. Then, when setting an offset in this node, the descendant nodes will move accordingly.

method.name: get_cubic_interpolation
method.description: This method returns whether the position between two cached points (see [method set_cubic_interpolation]) is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

method.name: get_h_offset
method.description: Returns the X displacement this node has from its parent [Path].

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Returns the distance along the path in 3D units.

method.name: get_rotation_mode
method.description: Returns the rotation mode. The constants below list which axes are allowed to rotate for each mode.

method.name: get_unit_offset
method.description: Returns the distance along the path as a number in the range 0.0 (for the first vertex) to 1.0 (for the last).

method.name: get_v_offset
method.description: Returns the Y displacement this node has from its parent [Path].

method.name: has_loop
method.description: Returns whether this node wraps its offsets around, or truncates them to the path ends.

method.name: set_cubic_interpolation
method.description: The points along the [Curve3D] of the [Path] are precomputed before use, for faster calculations. The point at the requested offset is then calculated interpolating between two adjacent cached points. This may present a problem if the curve makes sharp turns, as the cached points may not follow the curve closely enough. There are two answers to this problem: Either increase the number of cached points and increase memory consumption, or make a cubic interpolation between two points at the cost of (slightly) slower calculations. This method controls whether the position between two cached points is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

method.name: set_h_offset
method.description: Moves this node in the X axis. As this node's position will be set every time its offset is set, this allows many PathFollow to share the same curve (and thus the same movement pattern), yet not return the same position for a given path offset. A similar effect may be achieved moving the this node's descendants.

method.name: set_loop
method.description: If set, any offset outside the path's length (whether set by [method set_offset] or [method set_unit_offset] will wrap around, instead of stopping at the ends. Set it for cyclic paths.

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Sets the distance from the first vertex, measured in 3D units along the path. This sets this node's position to a point within the path.

method.name: set_rotation_mode
method.description: Allows or forbids rotation on one or more axes, per the constants below.

method.name: set_unit_offset
method.description: Sets the distance from the first vertex, considering 0.0 as the first vertex and 1.0 as the last. This is just another way of expressing the offset within the path, as the offset supplied is multiplied internally by the path's length.

method.name: set_v_offset
method.description: Moves this node in the Y axis, for the same reasons of [method set_h_offset].

constants.constant: Allows the PathFollow to rotate in the Y axis only.
Allows the PathFollow to rotate in both the X, and Y axes.
Allows the PathFollow to rotate in any axis.

class.name: PathFollow2D
class.description: This node takes its parent [Path2D], and returns the coordinates of a point within it, given a distance from the first vertex. It is useful for making other nodes follow a path, without coding the movement pattern. For that, the nodes must be descendants of this node. Then, when setting an offset in this node, the descendant nodes will move accordingly.

method.name: get_cubic_interpolation
method.description: This method returns whether the position between two cached points (see [method set_cubic_interpolation]) is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

method.name: get_h_offset
method.description: Returns the horizontal displacement this node has from its parent [Path2D].

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Returns the distance along the path in pixels.

method.name: get_unit_offset
method.description: Returns the distance along the path as a number in the range 0.0 (for the first vertex) to 1.0 (for the last).

method.name: get_v_offset
method.description: Returns the vertical displacement this node has from its parent [Path2D].

method.name: has_loop
method.description: Returns whether this node wraps its offsets around, or truncates them to the path ends.

method.name: is_rotating
method.description: Returns whether this node rotates to follow the path.

method.name: set_cubic_interpolation
method.description: The points along the [Curve2D] of the [Path2D] are precomputed before use, for faster calculations. The point at the requested offset is then calculated interpolating between two adjacent cached points. This may present a problem if the curve makes sharp turns, as the cached points may not follow the curve closely enough. There are two answers to this problem: Either increase the number of cached points and increase memory consumption, or make a cubic interpolation between two points at the cost of (slightly) slower calculations. This method controls whether the position between two cached points is interpolated linearly, or cubicly.

method.name: set_h_offset
method.description: Moves this node horizontally. As this node's position will be set every time its offset is set, this allows many PathFollow2D to share the same curve (and thus the same movement pattern), yet not return the same position for a given path offset. A similar effect may be achieved moving this node's descendants.

method.name: set_loop
method.description: If set, any offset outside the path's length (whether set by [method set_offset] or [method set_unit_offset] will wrap around, instead of stopping at the ends. Set it for cyclic paths.

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Sets the distance from the first vertex, measured in pixels along the path. This sets this node's position to a point within the path.

method.name: set_rotate
method.description: If set, this node rotates to follow the path, making its descendants rotate.

method.name: set_unit_offset
method.description: Sets the distance from the first vertex, considering 0.0 as the first vertex and 1.0 as the last. This is just another way of expressing the offset within the path, as the offset supplied is multiplied internally by the path's length.

method.name: set_v_offset
method.description: Moves the PathFollow2D vertically, for the same reasons of [method set_h_offset].

class.name: Physics2DDirectBodyState
class.brief_description: Direct access object to a physics body in the [Physics2DServer].
class.description: Direct access object to a physics body in the [Physics2DServer]. This object is passed via the direct state callback of rigid/character bodies, and is intended for changing the direct state of that body.

method.name: get_angular_velocity
method.description: Return the angular velocity of the body.

method.name: get_contact_collider
method.description: Return the [RID] of the collider.

method.name: get_contact_collider_id
method.description: Return the object id of the collider.

method.name: get_contact_collider_object
method.description: Return the collider object, this depends on how it was created (will return a scene node if such was used to create it).

method.name: get_contact_collider_pos
method.description: Return the contact position in the collider.

method.name: get_contact_collider_shape
method.description: Return the collider shape index.

method.name: get_contact_collider_shape_metadata
method.description: Return the metadata of the collided shape. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data].

method.name: get_contact_collider_velocity_at_pos
method.description: Return the linear velocity vector at contact point of the collider.

method.name: get_contact_count
method.description: Return the amount of contacts this body has with other bodies. Note that by default this returns 0 unless bodies are configured to log contacts.

method.name: get_contact_local_normal
method.description: Return the local normal (of this body) of the contact point.

method.name: get_contact_local_pos
method.description: Return the local position (of this body) of the contact point.

method.name: get_contact_local_shape
method.description: Return the local shape index of the collision.

method.name: get_inverse_inertia
method.description: Return the inverse of the inertia of the body.

method.name: get_inverse_mass
method.description: Return the inverse of the mass of the body.

method.name: get_linear_velocity
method.description: Return the current linear velocity of the body.

method.name: get_space_state
method.description: Return the current state of space, useful for queries.

method.name: get_step
method.description: Return the timestep (delta) used for the simulation.

method.name: get_total_angular_damp
method.description: Return the rate at which the body stops rotating, if there are not any other forces moving it.

method.name: get_total_gravity
method.description: Return the total gravity vector being currently applied to this body.

method.name: get_total_linear_damp
method.description: Return the rate at which the body stops moving, if there are not any other forces moving it.

method.name: get_transform
method.description: Return the transform matrix of the body.

method.name: integrate_forces
method.description: Call the built-in force integration code.

method.name: is_sleeping
method.description: Return true if this body is currently sleeping (not active).

method.name: set_angular_velocity
method.description: Change the angular velocity of the body.

method.name: set_linear_velocity
method.description: Change the linear velocity of the body.

method.name: set_sleep_state
method.description: Set the sleeping state of the body, only affects character/rigid bodies.

method.name: set_transform
method.description: Change the transform matrix of the body.

class.name: Physics2DDirectBodyStateSW
class.description: Software implementation of [Physics2DDirectBodyState]. This object exposes no new methods or properties and should not be used, as [Physics2DDirectBodyState] selects the best implementation available.

class.name: Physics2DDirectSpaceState
class.brief_description: Direct access object to a space in the [Physics2DServer].
class.description: Direct access object to a space in the [Physics2DServer]. It's used mainly to do queries against objects and areas residing in a given space.

method.name: cast_motion
method.description: Check whether the shape can travel to a point. If it can, the method will return an array with two floats: The first is the distance the shape can move in that direction without colliding, and the second is the distance at which it will collide. If the shape can not move, the array will be empty.

method.name: collide_shape
method.description: Check the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. The resulting array contains a list of points where the shape intersects another. Like with [method intersect_shape], the number of returned results can be limited to save processing time.

method.name: get_rest_info
method.description: Check the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. If it collides with more than a shape, the nearest one is selected. The returned object is a dictionary containing the following fields: pointo: Place where the shapes intersect. normal: Normal of the object at the point where the shapes intersect. shape: Shape index within the object against which the shape intersected. metadata: Metadata of the shape against which the shape intersected. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object against which the shape intersected. collider: Object against which the shape intersected. rid: [RID] of the object against which the shape intersected. linear_velocity: The movement vector of the object the shape intersected, if it was a body. If it was an area, it is (0,0). If the shape did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary (dir.empty()==true) is returned instead.

method.name: intersect_point
method.description: Check whether a point is inside any shape. The shapes the point is inside of are returned in an array containing dictionaries with the following fields: shape: Shape index within the object the point is in. metadata: Metadata of the shape the point is in. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object the point is in. collider: Object the point is inside of. rid: [RID] of the object the point is in. Additionally, the method can take an array of objects or [RID]s that are to be excluded from collisions, a bitmask representing the physics layers to check in, and another bitmask for the types of objects to check (see TYPE_MASK_* constants).

method.name: intersect_ray
method.description: Intersect a ray in a given space. The returned object is a dictionary with the following fields: position: Place where ray is stopped. normal: Normal of the object at the point where the ray was stopped. shape: Shape index within the object against which the ray was stopped. metadata: Metadata of the shape against which the ray was stopped. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object against which the ray was stopped. collider: Object against which the ray was stopped. rid: [RID] of the object against which the ray was stopped. If the ray did not intersect anything, then an empty dictionary (dir.empty()==true) is returned instead. Additionally, the method can take an array of objects or [RID]s that are to be excluded from collisions, a bitmask representing the physics layers to check in, and another bitmask for the types of objects to check (see TYPE_MASK_* constants).

method.name: intersect_shape
method.description: Check the intersections of a shape, given through a [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters] object, against the space. The intersected shapes are returned in an array containing dictionaries with the following fields: shape: Shape index within the object the shape intersected. metadata: Metadata of the shape intersected by the shape given through the [Physics2DShapeQueryParameters]. This metadata is different from [method Object.get_meta], and is set with [method Physics2DServer.shape_set_data]. collider_id: Id of the object the shape intersected. collider: Object the shape intersected. rid: [RID] of the object the shape intersected. The number of intersections can be limited with the second parameter, to reduce the processing time.

constants.constant: Check for collisions with static bodies.
Check for collisions with kinematic bodies.
Check for collisions with rigid bodies.
Check for collisions with rigid bodies in character mode.
Check for collisions with any kind of bodies (but not areas).

class.name: Physics2DServer
class.description: Physics 2D Server is the server responsible for all 2D physics. It can create many kinds of physics objects, but does not insert them on the node tree.

method.name: area_add_shape
method.description: Add a shape to the area, along with a transform matrix. Shapes are usually referenced by their index, so you should track which shape has a given index.

method.name: area_attach_object_instance_ID
method.description: Assign the area to a descendant of [Object], so it can exist in the node tree.

method.name: area_clear_shapes
method.description: Remove all shapes from an area. It does not delete the shapes, so they can be reassigned later.

method.name: area_create
method.description: Create an [Area2D].

method.name: area_get_object_instance_ID
method.description: Get the instance ID of the object the area is assigned to.

method.name: area_get_param
method.description: Return an area parameter value.

method.name: area_get_shape
method.description: Return the [RID] of the nth shape of an area.

method.name: area_get_shape_count
method.description: Return the number of shapes assigned to an area.

method.name: area_get_shape_transform
method.description: Return the transform matrix of a shape within an area.

method.name: area_get_space
method.description: Return the space assigned to the area.

method.name: area_get_space_override_mode
method.description: Return the space override mode for the area.

method.name: area_get_transform
method.description: Return the transform matrix for an area.

method.name: area_remove_shape
method.description: Remove a shape from an area. It does not delete the shape, so it can be reassigned later.

method.name: area_set_collision_mask
method.description: Set which physics layers the area will monitor.

method.name: area_set_layer_mask
method.description: Assign the area to one or many physics layers.

method.name: area_set_monitor_callback
method.description: Set the function to call when any body/area enters or exits the area. This callback will be called for any object interacting with the area, and takes five parameters: 1: AREA_BODY_ADDED or AREA_BODY_REMOVED, depending on whether the object entered or exited the area. 2: [RID] of the object that entered/exited the area. 3: Instance ID of the object that entered/exited the area. 4: The shape index of the object that entered/exited the area. 5: The shape index of the area where the object entered/exited.

method.name: area_set_param
method.description: Set the value for an area parameter. A list of available parameters is on the AREA_PARAM_* constants.

method.name: area_set_shape
method.description: Substitute a given area shape by another. The old shape is selected by its index, the new one by its [RID].

method.name: area_set_shape_transform
method.description: Set the transform matrix for an area shape.

method.name: area_set_space
method.description: Assign a space to the area.

method.name: area_set_space_override_mode
method.description: Set the space override mode for the area. The modes are described in the constants AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_*.

method.name: area_set_transform
method.description: Set the transform matrix for an area.

method.name: body_add_collision_exception
method.description: Add a body to the list of bodies exempt from collisions.

method.name: body_add_force
method.description: Add a positioned force to the applied force and torque. As with [method body_apply_impulse], both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates. A force differs from an impulse in that, while the two are forces, the impulse clears itself after being applied.

method.name: body_add_shape
method.description: Add a shape to the body, along with a transform matrix. Shapes are usually referenced by their index, so you should track which shape has a given index.

method.name: body_apply_impulse
method.description: Add a positioned impulse to the applied force and torque. Both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

method.name: body_attach_object_instance_ID
method.description: Assign the area to a descendant of [Object], so it can exist in the node tree.

method.name: body_clear_shapes
method.description: Remove all shapes from a body.

method.name: body_create
method.description: Create a physics body. The first parameter can be any value from constants BODY_MODE*, for the type of body created. Additionally, the body can be created in sleeping state to save processing time.

method.name: body_get_collision_mask
method.description: Return the physics layer or layers a body can collide with.

method.name: body_get_continuous_collision_detection_mode
method.description: Return the continuous collision detection mode.

method.name: body_get_layer_mask
method.description: Return the physics layer or layers a body belongs to.

method.name: body_get_max_contacts_reported
method.description: Return the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [method body_set_max_contacts_reported].

method.name: body_get_mode
method.description: Return the body mode.

method.name: body_get_object_instance_ID
method.description: Get the instance ID of the object the area is assigned to.

method.name: body_get_one_way_collision_direction
method.description: Return the direction used for one-way collision detection.

method.name: body_get_one_way_collision_max_depth
method.description: Return how far a body can go through the given one, when it allows one-way collisions.

method.name: body_get_param
method.description: Return the value of a body parameter.

method.name: body_get_shape
method.description: Return the [RID] of the nth shape of a body.

method.name: body_get_shape_count
method.description: Return the number of shapes assigned to a body.

method.name: body_get_shape_metadata
method.description: Return the metadata of a shape of a body.

method.name: body_get_shape_transform
method.description: Return the transform matrix of a body shape.

method.name: body_get_space
method.description: Return the [RID] of the space assigned to a body.

method.name: body_get_state
method.description: Return a body state.

method.name: body_is_omitting_force_integration
method.description: Return whether a body uses a callback function to calculate its own physics (see [method body_set_force_integration_callback]).

method.name: body_is_shape_set_as_trigger
method.description: Return whether a body's shape is marked as a trigger.

method.name: body_remove_collision_exception
method.description: Remove a body from the list of bodies exempt from collisions.

method.name: body_remove_shape
method.description: Remove a shape from a body. The shape is not deleted, so it can be reused afterwards.

method.name: body_set_axis_velocity
method.description: Set an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

method.name: body_set_collision_mask
method.description: Set the physics layer or layers a body can collide with.

method.name: body_set_continuous_collision_detection_mode
method.description: Set the continuous collision detection mode from any of the CCD_MODE_* constants. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided.

method.name: body_set_force_integration_callback
method.description: Set the function used to calculate physics for an object, if that object allows it (see [method body_set_omit_force integration]).

method.name: body_set_layer_mask
method.description: Set the physics layer or layers a body belongs to.

method.name: body_set_max_contacts_reported
method.description: Set the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

method.name: body_set_mode
method.description: Set the body mode, from one of the constants BODY_MODE*.

method.name: body_set_omit_force_integration
method.description: Set whether a body uses a callback function to calculate its own physics (see [method body_set_force_integration_callback]).

method.name: body_set_one_way_collision_direction
method.description: Set a direction in which bodies can go through the given one. If this value is different from (0,0), any movement within 90 degrees of this vector is considered a valid movement. Set this direction to (0,0) to disable one-way collisions.

method.name: body_set_one_way_collision_max_depth
method.description: Set how far a body can go through the given one, if it allows one-way collisions (see [method body_set_one_way_collision_direction]).

method.name: body_set_param
method.description: Set a body parameter (see BODY_PARAM* constants).

method.name: body_set_shape
method.description: Substitute a given body shape by another. The old shape is selected by its index, the new one by its [RID].

method.name: body_set_shape_as_trigger
method.description: Mark a body's shape as a trigger. A trigger shape cannot affect other bodies, but detects other shapes entering and exiting it.

method.name: body_set_shape_metadata
method.description: Set metadata of a shape within a body. This metadata is different from [method Object.set_meta], and can be retrieved on shape queries.

method.name: body_set_shape_transform
method.description: Set the transform matrix for a body shape.

method.name: body_set_space
method.description: Assign a space to the body (see [method create_space]).

method.name: body_set_state
method.description: Set a body state (see BODY_STATE* constants).

method.name: body_test_motion
method.description: Return whether a body can move from a given point in a given direction. Apart from the boolean return value, a [Physics2DTestMotionResult] can be passed to return additional information in.

method.name: damped_spring_joint_create
method.description: Create a damped spring joint between two bodies. If not specified, the second body is assumed to be the joint itself.

method.name: damped_string_joint_get_param
method.description: Return the value of a damped spring joint parameter.

method.name: damped_string_joint_set_param
method.description: Set a damped spring joint parameter. Parameters are explained in the DAMPED_STRING* constants.

method.name: free_rid
method.description: Destroy any of the objects created by Physics2DServer. If the [RID] passed is not one of the objects that can be created by Physics2DServer, an error will be sent to the console.

method.name: get_process_info
method.description: Return information about the current state of the 2D physics engine. The states are listed under the INFO_* constants.

method.name: groove_joint_create
method.description: Create a groove joint between two bodies. If not specified, the bodyies are assumed to be the joint itself.

method.name: joint_get_param
method.description: Return the value of a joint parameter.

method.name: joint_get_type
method.description: Return the type of a joint (see JOINT_* constants).

method.name: joint_set_param
method.description: Set a joint parameter. Parameters are explained in the JOINT_PARAM* constants.

method.name: pin_joint_create
method.description: Create a pin joint between two bodies. If not specified, the second body is assumed to be the joint itself.

method.name: set_active
method.description: Activate or deactivate the 2D physics engine.

method.name: shape_create
method.description: Create a shape of type SHAPE_*. Does not assign it to a body or an area. To do so, you must use [method area_set_shape] or [method body_set_shape].

method.name: shape_get_data
method.description: Return the shape data.

method.name: shape_get_type
method.description: Return the type of shape (see SHAPE_* constants).

method.name: shape_set_data
method.description: Set the shape data that defines its shape and size. The data to be passed depends on the kind of shape created [method shape_get_type].

method.name: space_create
method.description: Create a space. A space is a collection of parameters for the physics engine that can be assigned to an area or a body. It can be assigned to an area with [method area_set_space], or to a body with [method body_set_space].

method.name: space_get_direct_state
method.description: Return the state of a space, a [Physics2DDirectSpaceState]. This object can be used to make collision/intersection queries.

method.name: space_get_param
method.description: Return the value of a space parameter.

method.name: space_is_active
method.description: Return whether the space is active.

method.name: space_set_active
method.description: Mark a space as active. It will not have an effect, unless it is assigned to an area or body.

method.name: space_set_param
method.description: Set the value for a space parameter. A list of available parameters is on the SPACE_PARAM_* constants.

constants.constant: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a pair of bodies has to move before their collision status has to be recalculated.
Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can be from another before they are considered separated.
Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can penetrate another shape before it is considered a collision.
Constant to set/get the linear velocity threshold. Bodies slower than this will be marked as potentially inactive.
Constant to set/get the angular velocity threshold. Bodies slower than this will be marked as potentially inactive.
Constant to set/get the maximum time of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after this time.

Constant to set/get the default solver bias for all physics constraints. A solver bias is a factor controlling how much two objects "rebound", after violating a constraint, to avoid leaving them in that state because of numerical imprecision.
This is the constant for creating line shapes. A line shape is an infinite line with an origin point, and a normal. Thus, it can be used for front/behind checks.
This is the constant for creating segment shapes. A segment shape is a line from a point A to a point B. It can be checked for intersections.
This is the constant for creating circle shapes. A circle shape only has a radius. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.
This is the constant for creating rectangle shapes. A rectangle shape is defined by a width and a height. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.
This is the constant for creating capsule shapes. A capsule shape is defined by a radius and a length. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.

This is the constant for creating convex polygon shapes. A polygon is defined by a list of points. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks. Unlike the method [method CollisionPolygon2D.set_polygon], polygons modified with [method shape_set_data] do not verify that the points supplied form, in fact, a convex polygon.
This is the constant for creating concave polygon shapes. A polygon is defined by a list of points. It can be used for intersections checks, but not for inside/outside checks.
This constant is used internally by the engine. Any attempt to create this kind of shape results in an error.
Constant to set/get gravity strength in an area.
Constant to set/get gravity vector/center in an area.
Constant to set/get whether the gravity vector of an area is a direction, or a center point.
Constant to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity of an area. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.
This constant was used to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity. It has been superseded by AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE.
Constant to set/get the linear dampening factor of an area.
Constant to set/get the angular dampening factor of an area.
Constant to set/get the priority (order of processing) of an area.
This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them.
This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects.
This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one.
This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas.
This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.
Constant for rigid bodies in character mode. In this mode, a body can not rotate, and only its linear velocity is affected by physics.
Constant to set/get a body's bounce factor.
Constant to set/get a body's friction.
Constant to set/get a body's mass.
Constant to set/get a body's inertia.
Constant to set/get a body's gravity multiplier.
Constant to set/get a body's linear dampening factor.
Constant to set/get a body's angular dampening factor.
This is the last ID for body parameters. Any attempt to set this property is ignored. Any attempt to get it returns 0.
Constant to set/get the current transform matrix of the body.
Constant to set/get the current linear velocity of the body.
Constant to set/get the current angular velocity of the body.
Constant to sleep/wake up a body, or to get whether it is sleeping.
Constant to set/get whether the body can sleep.
Constant to create damped spring joints.
Set the resting length of the spring joint. The joint will always try to go to back this length when pulled apart.
Set the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.
Set the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).
Disables continuous collision detection. This is the fastest way to detect body collisions, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.
Enables continuous collision detection by raycasting. It is faster than shapecasting, but less precise.
Enables continuous collision detection by shapecasting. It is the slowest CCD method, and the most precise.
The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object enters one of its shapes.
The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object exits one of its shapes.
Constant to get the number of objects that are not sleeping.
Constant to get the number of possible collisions.
Constant to get the number of space regions where a collision could occur.

class.name: Physics2DServerSW
class.description: Software implementation of [Physics2DServer]. This class exposes no new methods or properties and should not be used, as [Physics2DServer] automatically selects the best implementation available.

class.name: Physics2DShapeQueryParameters
class.brief_description: Parameters to be sent to a 2D shape physics query.
class.description: This class contains the shape and other parameters for intersection/collision queries.

method.name: get_exclude
method.description: Return the list of objects, or object [RID]s, that will be excluded from collisions.

method.name: get_layer_mask
method.description: Return the physics layer(s) the shape belongs to.

method.name: get_margin
method.description: Return the collision margin for the shape.

method.name: get_motion
method.description: Return the current movement speed of the shape.

method.name: get_object_type_mask
method.description: Return the type of object the shape belongs to.

method.name: get_shape_rid
method.description: Return the [RID] of the shape queried.

method.name: get_transform
method.description: Return the transform matrix of the shape queried.

method.name: set_exclude
method.description: Set the list of objects, or object [RID]s, that will be excluded from collisions.

method.name: set_layer_mask
method.description: Set the physics layer(s) the shape belongs to.

method.name: set_margin
method.description: Set the collision margin for the shape. A collision margin is an amount (in pixels) that the shape will grow when computing collisions, to account for numerical imprecision.

method.name: set_motion
method.description: Set the current movement speed of the shape.

method.name: set_object_type_mask
method.description: Set the type of object the shape belongs to (see Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_*).

method.name: set_shape
method.description: Set the [Shape2D] that will be used for collision/intersection queries.

method.name: set_shape_rid
method.description: Set the [RID] of the shape to be used in queries.

method.name: set_transform
method.description: Set the transormation matrix of the shape. This is necessary to set its position/rotation/scale.

class.name: PhysicsBody
class.brief_description: Base class for different types of Physics bodies.
class.description: PhysicsBody is an abstract base class for implementing a physics body. All PhysicsBody types inherit from it.

class.name: PhysicsBody2D
class.brief_description: Base class for all objects affected by physics.
class.description: PhysicsBody2D is an abstract base class for implementing a physics body. All *Body2D types inherit from it.

method.name: add_collision_exception_with
method.description: Adds a body to the collision exception list. This list contains bodies that this body will not collide with.

method.name: get_collision_layer
method.description: Return the physics layer this area is in.

method.name: get_collision_layer_bit
method.description: Return an individual bit on the collision mask.

method.name: get_collision_mask
method.description: Return the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

method.name: get_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Return an individual bit on the collision mask.

method.name: get_one_way_collision_direction
method.description: Return the direction used for one-way collision detection.

method.name: get_one_way_collision_max_depth
method.description: Return how far a body can go through this one, when it allows one-way collisions.

method.name: remove_collision_exception_with
method.description: Removes a body from the collision exception list.

method.name: set_collision_layer
method.description: Set the physics layers this area is in. Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers are not visual, but more of a tagging system instead. A collidable can use these layers/tags to select with which objects it can collide, using [method set_collision_mask]. A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.

method.name: set_collision_layer_bit
method.description: Set/clear individual bits on the layer mask. This makes getting a body in/out of only one layer easier.

method.name: set_collision_mask
method.description: Set the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.

method.name: set_collision_mask_bit
method.description: Set/clear individual bits on the collision mask. This makes selecting the areas scanned easier.

method.name: set_one_way_collision_direction
method.description: Set a direction in which bodies can go through this one. If this value is different from (0,0), any movement within 90 degrees of this vector is considered a valid movement. Set this direction to (0,0) to disable one-way collisions.

method.name: set_one_way_collision_max_depth
method.description: Set how far a body can go through this one, when it allows one-way collisions (see [method set_one_way_collision_direction]).
