constants.constant: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them.
This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects.
This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one.
This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas.
This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.

class.name: PhysicsShapeQueryResult
class.brief_description: Result of a shape query in Physics2DServer.

class.name: PinJoint2D
class.description: Pin Joint for 2D Rigid Bodies. It pins 2 bodies (rigid or static) together, or a single body to a fixed position in space.

class.name: Plane
class.description: Plane represents a normalized plane equation. Basically, "normal" is the normal of the plane (a,b,c normalized), and "d" is the distance from the origin to the plane (in the direction of "normal"). "Over" or "Above" the plane is considered the side of the plane towards where the normal is pointing.

method.name: Plane
method.description: Creates a plane from the three parameters "a", "b", "c" and "d".

method.name: Plane
method.description: Creates a plane from three points.

method.name: Plane
method.description: Creates a plane from the normal and the plane's distance to the origin.

method.name: center
method.description: Returns the center of the plane.

method.name: distance_to
method.description: Returns the shortest distance from the plane to the position "point".

method.name: get_any_point
method.description: Returns a point on the plane.

method.name: has_point
method.description: Returns true if "point" is inside the plane (by a very minimum threshold).

method.name: intersect_3
method.description: Returns the intersection point of the three planes "b", "c" and this plane. If no intersection is found null is returned.

method.name: intersects_ray
method.description: Returns the intersection point of a ray consisting of the position "from" and the direction normal "dir" with this plane. If no intersection is found null is returned.

method.name: intersects_segment
method.description: Returns the intersection point of a segment from position "begin" to position "end" with this plane. If no intersection is found null is returned.

method.name: is_point_over
method.description: Returns true if "point" is located above the plane.

method.name: normalized
method.description: Returns a copy of the plane, normalized.

method.name: project
method.description: Returns the orthogonal projection of point "p" into a point in the plane.

class.name: Polygon2D
class.description: A Polygon2D is defined by a set of n vertices connected together by line segments, meaning that the vertex 1 will be connected with vertex 2, vertex 2 with vertex 3 ..., vertex n-1 with vertex n and vertex n with vertex 1 in order to close the loop and define a polygon.

method.name: get_color
method.description: Return the polygon fill color.

method.name: get_invert
method.description: Return whether this polygon is inverted or not.

method.name: get_invert_border
method.description: Return the added padding around the bounding box.

method.name: get_offset
method.description: Return the offset for the polygon vertices.

method.name: get_polygon
method.description: Return the set of vertices that defines this polygon.

method.name: get_texture
method.description: Return the polygon texture

method.name: get_texture_offset
method.description: Return the polygon texture offset.

method.name: get_texture_rotation
method.description: Return the rotation in radians of the texture polygon.

method.name: get_texture_scale
method.description: Return the uv coordinate multiplier.

method.name: get_uv
method.description: Return the texture coordinates associated with every vertex of the polygon.

method.name: get_vertex_colors
method.description: Return the list of vertex colors.

method.name: set_color
method.description: Set the polygon fill color. If the polygon has a texture defined, the defined texture will be multiplied by the polygon fill color. This, also, is the default color for those vertices that are not defined by [method get_vertex_colors].

method.name: set_invert
method.description: Set the polygon as the defined polygon bounding box minus the defined polygon (the defined polygon will appear as a hole on the square that contains the defined polygon).

method.name: set_invert_border
method.description: Add extra padding around the bounding box, making it bigger. Too small a value can make the polygon triangulate strangely, due to numerical imprecision.

method.name: set_offset
method.description: Set the an offset that will be added to the vertices' position. E.g. if the offset is set to (10,10) then all the polygon points will move 10 units to the right and 10 units to the bottom.

method.name: set_polygon
method.description: Define the set of vertices that will represent the polygon.

method.name: set_texture
method.description: Set the polygon texture.

method.name: set_texture_offset
method.description: Set the offset of the polygon texture. Initially the texture will appear anchored to the polygon position, the offset is used to move the texture location away from that point (notice that the texture origin is set to its top left corner, so when offset is 0,0 the top left corner of the texture is at the polygon position), for example setting the offset to 10, 10 will move the texture 10 units to the left and 10 units to the top.

method.name: set_texture_rotation
method.description: Set the amount of rotation of the polygon texture, [code]texture_rotation[/code] is specified in radians and clockwise rotation.

method.name: set_texture_scale
method.description: Set the value that will multiply the uv coordinates ([method get_uv]) when applying the texture. Larger values make the texture smaller, and vice versa.

method.name: set_uv
method.description: Set the texture coordinates for every vertex of the polygon. There should be one uv vertex for every vertex in the polygon. If there are less, the undefined ones will be assumed to be (0,0). Extra uv vertices are ignored.

method.name: set_vertex_colors
method.description: Set the color for each vertex of the polygon. There should be one color for every vertex in the polygon. If there are less, the undefined ones will be assumed to be [method get_color]. Extra color entries are ignored. Colors are interpolated between vertices, resulting in smooth gradients when they differ.

class.name: PoolByteArray
class.description: Raw byte array. Contains bytes. Optimized for memory usage, can't fragment the memory.

method.name: PoolByteArray
method.description: Create from a generic array.

method.name: append_array
method.description: Append an [PoolByteArray] at the end of this array.

method.name: get_string_from_ascii
method.description: Returns a copy of the array's contents formatted as String. Fast alternative to get_string_from_utf8(), assuming the content is ASCII-only (unlike the UTF-8 function, this function maps every byte to a character in the string, so any multibyte sequence will be torn apart).

method.name: get_string_from_utf8
method.description: Returns a copy of the array's contents formatted as String, assuming the array is formatted as UTF-8. Slower than get_string_from_ascii(), but works for UTF-8. Usually you should prefer this function over get_string_from_ascii() to support international input.

method.name: insert
method.description: Insert a new element at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array (pos==size()).

method.name: invert
method.description: Reverse the order of the elements in the array (so first element will now be the last).

method.name: push_back
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Set the size of the [PoolByteArray]. If larger than the current size it will reserve some space beforehand, and if it is smaller it will cut off the array.

method.name: set
method.description: Change the byte at the given index.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the size of the array.

method.name: subarray
method.description: Returns the slice of the [PoolByteArray] between indices (inclusive) as a new [RawArray]. Any negative index is considered to be from the end of the array.

class.name: PoolColorArray
class.description: Array of Color, can only contains colors. Optimized for memory usage, can't fragment the memory.

method.name: PoolColorArray
method.description: Create from a generic array.

method.name: append
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array (alias of [method push_back]).

method.name: append_array
method.description: Append an [PoolColorArray] at the end of this array.

method.name: insert
method.description: Insert a new element at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array (pos==size()).

method.name: invert
method.description: Reverse the order of the elements in the array (so first element will now be the last).

method.name: push_back
method.description: Append a value to the array.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Set the size of the [PoolColorArray]. If larger than the current size it will reserve some space beforehand, and if it is smaller it will cut off the array.

method.name: set
method.description: Change the [Color] at the given index.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the array size.

class.name: PoolIntArray
class.description: Integer Array. Array of integers. Can only contain integers. Optimized for memory usage, can't fragment the memory.

method.name: PoolIntArray
method.description: Create from a generic array.

method.name: append
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array (alias of [method push_back]).

method.name: append_array
method.description: Append an [PoolIntArray] at the end of this array.

method.name: insert
method.description: Insert a new int at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array (pos==size()).

method.name: invert
method.description: Reverse the order of the elements in the array (so first element will now be the last).

method.name: push_back
method.description: Append a value to the array.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Set the size of the [PoolIntArray]. If larger than the current size it will reserve some space beforehand, and if it is smaller it will cut off the array.

method.name: set
method.description: Change the int at the given index.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the array size.

class.name: PoolRealArray
class.description: Real Array. Array of floating point values. Can only contain floats. Optimized for memory usage, can't fragment the memory.

method.name: PoolRealArray
method.description: Create from a generic array.

method.name: append
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array (alias of [method push_back]).

method.name: append_array
method.description: Append an [RealArray] at the end of this array.

method.name: insert
method.description: Insert a new element at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array (pos==size()).

method.name: invert
method.description: Reverse the order of the elements in the array (so first element will now be the last).

method.name: push_back
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Set the size of the [RealArray]. If larger than the current size it will reserve some space beforehand, and if it is smaller it will cut off the array.

method.name: set
method.description: Change the float at the given index.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the size of the array.

class.name: PoolStringArray
class.description: String Array. Array of strings. Can only contain strings. Optimized for memory usage, can't fragment the memory.

method.name: PoolStringArray
method.description: Create from a generic array.

method.name: append
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array (alias of [method push_back]).

method.name: append_array
method.description: Append an [StringArray] at the end of this array.

method.name: insert
method.description: Insert a new element at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array (pos==size()).

method.name: join
method.description: Reverse the order of the elements in the array (so first element will now be the last).

method.name: push_back
method.description: Append a string element at end of the array.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Set the size of the [StringArray]. If larger than the current size it will reserve some space beforehand, and if it is smaller it will cut off the array.

method.name: set
method.description: Change the [String] at the given index.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the size of the array.

class.name: PoolVector2Array
class.description: An Array specifically designed to hold Vector2.

method.name: PoolVector2Array
method.description: Construct a new [PoolVector2Array]. Optionally, you can pass in an Array that will be converted.

method.name: append
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array (alias of [method push_back]).

method.name: append_array
method.description: Append an [PoolVector2Array] at the end of this array.

method.name: insert
method.description: Insert a new element at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array (pos==size()).

method.name: invert

method.name: push_back
method.description: Insert a [Vector2] at the end.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize

method.name: set
method.description: Change the [Vector2] at the given index.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the size of the array.

class.name: PoolVector3Array
class.description: An Array specifically designed to hold Vector3.

method.name: PoolVector3Array
method.description: Construct a new PoolVector3Array. Optionally, you can pass in an Array that will be converted.

method.name: append
method.description: Append an element at the end of the array (alias of [method push_back]).

method.name: append_array
method.description: Append an [PoolVector3Array] at the end of this array.

method.name: insert
method.description: Insert a new element at a given position in the array. The position must be valid, or at the end of the array (pos==size()).

method.name: invert
method.description: Reverse the order of the elements in the array (so first element will now be the last).

method.name: push_back
method.description: Insert a Vector3 at the end.

method.name: remove
method.description: Remove an element from the array by index.

method.name: resize
method.description: Set the size of the PoolVector3Array. If larger than the current size it will reserve some space beforehand, and if it is smaller it will cut off the array.

method.name: set
method.description: Change the [Vector3] at the given index.

method.name: size
method.description: Return the size of the array.

class.name: Popup
class.brief_description: Base container control for popups and dialogs.
class.description: Popup is a base [Control] used to show dialogs and popups. It's a subwindow and modal by default (see [Control]) and has helpers for custom popup behavior.

method.name: is_exclusive
method.description: Returns whether the popup will hide other popups when shown on the screen.

method.name: popup
method.description: Popup (show the control in modal form).

method.name: popup_centered
method.description: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, at the current size, or at a size determined by "size".

method.name: popup_centered_minsize
method.description: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, ensuring the size is never smaller than [code]minsize[/code].

method.name: popup_centered_ratio
method.description: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, scaled at a ratio of size of the screen.

method.name: set_exclusive
method.description: Make the popup hide other popups when shown on the screen.

signal.name: about_to_show
signal.description: This signal is emitted when a popup is about to be shown. (often used in [PopupMenu] for clearing the list of options and creating a new one according to the current context).

signal.name: popup_hide
signal.description: This signal is emitted when a popup is hidden.

constants.constant: Notification sent right after the popup is shown.
Notification sent right after the popup is hidden.

class.name: PopupDialog
class.description: PopupDialog is a base class for popup dialogs, along with [WindowDialog].

class.name: PopupMenu
class.brief_description: PopupMenu displays a list of options.
class.description: PopupMenu is the typical Control that displays a list of options. They are popular in toolbars or context menus.

method.name: add_check_item
method.description: Add a new checkable item with text "label". An id can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: add_icon_check_item
method.description: Add a new checkable item with text "label" and icon "texture". An id can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: add_icon_item
method.description: Add a new item with text "label" and icon "texture". An id can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator keybinding. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: add_item
method.description: Add a new item with text "label". An id can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator keybinding. If no id is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: add_separator
method.description: Add a separator between items. Separators also occupy an index.

method.name: add_submenu_item
method.description: Adds an item with a submenu. The submenu is the name of a child PopupMenu node that would be shown when the item is clicked. An id can optionally be provided, but if is isn't provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the popup menu, in effect removing all items.

method.name: get_item_ID
method.description: Return the id of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_accelerator
method.description: Return the accelerator of the item at index "idx". Accelerators are special combinations of keys that activate the item, no matter which control is focused.

method.name: get_item_count
method.description: Return the amount of items.

method.name: get_item_icon
method.description: Return the icon of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_index
method.description: Find and return the index of the item containing a given id.

method.name: get_item_metadata
method.description: Return the metadata of an item, which might be of any type. You can set it with [method set_item_metadata], which provides a simple way of assigning context data to items.

method.name: get_item_submenu
method.description: Return the submenu name of the item at index "idx".

method.name: get_item_text
method.description: Return the text of the item at index "idx".

method.name: is_hide_on_item_selection
method.description: Returns a boolean that indicates whether or not the PopupMenu will hide on item selection.

method.name: is_item_checkable
method.description: Return whether the item at index "idx" has a checkbox. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: is_item_checked
method.description: Return the checkstate status of the item at index "idx".

method.name: is_item_disabled
method.description: Return whether the item at index "idx" is disabled. When it is disabled it can't be selected, or its action invoked.

method.name: is_item_separator
method.description: Return whether the item is a seperator. If it is, it would be displayed as a line.

method.name: remove_item
method.description: Removes the item at index "idx" from the menu. Note that the indexes of items after the removed item are going to be shifted by one.

method.name: set_hide_on_item_selection
method.description: Sets whether or not the PopupMenu will hide on item selection.

method.name: set_item_ID
method.description: Set the id of the item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_accelerator
method.description: Set the accelerator of the item at index "idx". Accelerators are special combinations of keys that activate the item, no matter which control is focused.

method.name: set_item_as_checkable
method.description: Set whether the item at index "idx" has a checkbox. Note that checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: set_item_as_separator
method.description: Mark the item at index "idx" as a seperator, which means that it would be displayed as a mere line.

method.name: set_item_checked
method.description: Set the checkstate status of the item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_disabled
method.description: Sets whether the item at index "idx" is disabled or not. When it is disabled it can't be selected, or its action invoked.

method.name: set_item_icon
method.description: Set the icon of the item at index "idx".

method.name: set_item_metadata
method.description: Sets the metadata of an item, which might be of any type. You can later get it with [method get_item_metadata], which provides a simple way of assigning context data to items.

method.name: set_item_submenu
method.description: Sets the submenu of the item at index "idx". The submenu is the name of a child PopupMenu node that would be shown when the item is clicked.

method.name: set_item_text
method.description: Set the text of the item at index "idx".

signal.name: id_pressed
signal.description: This event is emitted when an item of some id is pressed or its accelerator is activated.

signal.name: index_pressed
signal.description: This event is emitted when an item of some index is pressed or its accelerator is activated.

class.name: PopupPanel
class.brief_description: Class for displaying popups with a panel background.
class.description: Class for displaying popups with a panel background. In some cases it might be simpler to use than [Popup], since it provides a configurable background. If you are making windows, better check [WindowDialog].

class.name: Portal
class.brief_description: Portals provide virtual openings to rooms.
class.description: Portals provide virtual openings to [VisualInstance] nodes, so cameras can look at them from the outside. Note that portals are a visibility optimization technique, and are in no way related to the game of the same name (as in, they are not used for teleportation). For more information on how rooms and portals work, see [VisualInstance]. Portals are represented as 2D convex polygon shapes (in the X,Y local plane), and are placed on the surface of the areas occupied by a [VisualInstance], to indicate that the room can be accessed or looked-at through them. If two rooms are next to each other, and two similar portals in each of them share the same world position (and are parallel and opposed to each other), they will automatically "connect" and form "doors" (for example, the portals that connect a kitchen to a living room are placed in the door they share). Portals must always have a [VisualInstance] node as a parent, grandparent or far parent, or else they will not be active.

method.name: get_connect_range
method.description: Return the range for auto-connecting two portals from different rooms sharing the same space.

method.name: get_disable_distance
method.description: Return the distance threshold for disabling the portal. Every time that the portal goes beyond "distance", it disables itself, becoming the opaque color (see [method set_disabled_color]).

method.name: get_disabled_color
method.description: Return the color for when the portal goes beyond the disable distance (see [method set_disable_distance]) and becomes disabled.

method.name: get_shape
method.description: Return the portal shape. The shape is an array of [Vector2] points, representing a convex polygon in the X,Y plane.

method.name: is_enabled
method.description: Return whether the portal is active. When disabled it causes the parent [VisualInstance] to not be visible any longer when looking through the portal.

method.name: set_connect_range
method.description: Set the range for auto-connecting two portals from different rooms sharing the same space.

method.name: set_disable_distance
method.description: Set the distance threshold for disabling the portal. Every time that the portal goes beyond "distance", it disables itself, becoming the opaque color (see [method set_disabled_color]).

method.name: set_disabled_color
method.description: When the portal goes beyond the disable distance (see [method set_disable_distance]), it becomes opaque and displayed with color "color".

method.name: set_enabled
method.description: Enable the portal (it is enabled by default though), disabling it will cause the parent [VisualInstance] to not be visible any longer when looking through the portal.

method.name: set_shape
method.description: Set the portal shape. The shape is an array of [Vector2] points, representing a convex polygon in the X,Y plane.

class.name: Position2D
class.description: Generic 2D Position hint for editing. It's just like a plain [Node2D] but displays as a cross in the 2D-Editor at all times.

class.name: Position3D
class.description: Generic 3D Position hint for editing. It's just like a plain [Spatial] but displays as a cross in the 3D-Editor at all times.

class.name: ProgressBar
class.description: General purpose progress bar. Shows fill percentage from right to left.

class.name: ProximityGroup
class.description: General purpose proximity-detection node.

class.name: Quat
class.description: Quaternion is a 4 dimensional vector that is used to represent a rotation. It mainly exists to perform SLERP (spherical-linear interpolation) between two rotations. Multiplying quaternions also cheaply reproduces rotation sequences. However quaternions need to be often renormalized, or else they suffer from precision issues.

method.name: Quat
method.description: Returns a quaternion that will rotate around the given axis by the specified angle. The axis must be a normalized vector.

method.name: Quat
method.description: Returns the rotation matrix corresponding to the given quaternion.

method.name: dot
method.description: Returns the dot product of two quaternions.

method.name: inverse
method.description: Returns the inverse of the quaternion.

method.name: length
method.description: Returns the length of the quaternion.

method.name: length_squared
method.description: Returns the length of the quaternion, squared.

method.name: normalized
method.description: Returns a copy of the quaternion, normalized to unit length.

method.name: slerp
method.description: Perform a spherical-linear interpolation with another quaternion.

class.name: RID
class.description: The RID type is used to access the unique integer ID of a resource. They are opaque, so they do not grant access to the associated resource by themselves. They are used by and with the low-level Server classes such as [VisualServer].

method.name: RID
method.description: Create a new RID instance with the ID of a given resource. When not handed a valid resource, silently stores the unused ID 0.

method.name: get_id
method.description: Retrieve the ID of the referenced resource.

class.name: Range
class.brief_description: Abstract base class for range-based controls.
class.description: Range is a base class for [Control] nodes that change a floating point [i]value[/i] between a [i]minimum[/i] and a [i]maximum[/i], using [i]step[/i] and [i]page[/i], for example a [ScrollBar].

method.name: get_as_ratio
method.description: Return value mapped to 0 to 1 range.

method.name: get_max
method.description: Return the maximum value.

method.name: get_min
method.description: Return the minimum value.

method.name: get_page
method.description: Return the page size, if page is 0, paging is disabled.

method.name: get_step
method.description: Return the stepping, if step is 0, stepping is disabled.

method.name: set_as_ratio
method.description: Set value mapped to 0 to 1 (unit) range, it will then be converted to the actual value within min and max.

method.name: set_min
method.description: Set minimum value, clamped range value to it if it's less.

method.name: set_page
method.description: Set page size. Page is mainly used for scrollbars or anything that controls text scrolling.

method.name: set_step
method.description: Set step value. If step is 0, stepping will be disabled.

signal.name: changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when min, max, range or step change.

signal.name: value_changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when value changes.

class.name: RayCast
class.brief_description: Query the closest object intersecting a ray.
class.description:
A RayCast represents a line from its origin to its destination position [code]cast_to[/code], it is used to query the 3D space in order to find the closest object intersecting with the ray.
RayCast can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], setting proper filtering with layers, or by filtering object types with type masks.
Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions!
RayCast calculates intersection every fixed frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between fixed frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.

method.name: add_exception
method.description: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified [code]node[/code].

method.name: clear_exceptions
method.description: Removes all collision exception for this ray.

method.name: force_raycast_update
method.description: Updates the collision information in case if this object's properties changed during the current frame (for example position, rotation or the cast_point). Note, [code]set_enabled[/code] is not required for this to work.

method.name: get_cast_to
method.description: Return the destination point of this ray object.

method.name: get_collider
method.description: Return the closest object the ray is pointing to. Note that this does not consider the length of the vector, so you must also use [method is_colliding] to check if the object returned is actually colliding with the ray.

method.name: get_collider_shape
method.description: Returns the collision shape of the closest object the ray is pointing to.

method.name: get_collision_normal
method.description: Returns the normal of the intersecting object shape face containing the collision point.

method.name: get_collision_point
method.description: Returns collision point. This point is in [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

method.name: get_layer_mask
method.description: Returns the layer mask for this ray.

method.name: get_type_mask
method.description: Returns the type mask (types of objects to detect) for this ray. The value is a sum (bitwise OR'd) of constants available for [PhysicsDirectSpaceState].

method.name: is_colliding
method.description: Return whether the closest object the ray is pointing to is colliding with the vector (considering the vector length).

method.name: is_enabled
method.description: Returns whether this raycast is enabled or not.

method.name: remove_exception
method.description: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified [code]node[/code].

method.name: set_cast_to
method.description: Sets to which point ray should be casted. This point is in [b]local[/b] coordinate system.

method.name: set_enabled
method.description: Enables the RayCast2D. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions.

method.name: set_layer_mask
method.description: Set the mask to filter objects. Only objects with at least the same mask element set will be detected.

method.name: set_type_mask
method.description: Set the types of objects to detect. For [code]mask[/code] use a logic sum (OR operation) of constants defined in [PhysicsDirectSpaceState], eg. [code]PhysicsDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY | PhysicsDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY[/code] to detect only those two types.

class.name: RayCast2D
class.brief_description: Query the closest object intersecting a ray.
class.description:
A RayCast2D represents a line from its origin to its destination position [code]cast_to[/code], it is used to query the 2D space in order to find the closest object intersecting with the ray.
RayCast2D can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], setting proper filtering with layers, or by filtering object types with type masks.
Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions!
RayCast2D calculates intersection every fixed frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between fixed frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.

method.name: add_exception
method.description: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified [code]node[/code].

method.name: clear_exceptions
method.description: Removes all collision exception for this ray.

method.name: force_raycast_update
method.description: Updates the collision information in case if this object's properties changed during the current frame (for example position, rotation or the cast_point). Note, [code]set_enabled[/code] is not required for this to work.

method.name: get_cast_to
method.description: Return the destination point of this ray object.

method.name: get_collider
method.description: Return the closest object the ray is pointing to. Note that this does not consider the length of the vector, so you must also use [method is_colliding] to check if the object returned is actually colliding with the ray.

method.name: get_collider_shape
method.description: Returns the collision shape of the closest object the ray is pointing to.

method.name: get_collision_normal
method.description: Returns the normal of the intersecting object shape face containing the collision point.

method.name: get_collision_point
method.description: Returns the collision point in which the ray intersects the closest object. This point is in [b]global[/b] coordinate system.

method.name: get_exclude_parent_body
method.description: Returns whether this ray should hit your parent node, if it's a body.

method.name: get_layer_mask
method.description: Returns the layer mask for this ray.

method.name: get_type_mask
method.description: Returns the type mask (types of objects to detect) for this ray. The value is a sum (bitwise OR'd) of constants available for [Physics2DDirectSpaceState].

method.name: is_colliding
method.description: Return whether the closest object the ray is pointing to is colliding with the vector (considering the vector length).

method.name: is_enabled
method.description: Returns whether this raycast is enabled or not.

method.name: remove_exception
method.description: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified [code]node[/code].

method.name: set_cast_to
method.description: Sets the ray destination point, so that the ray will test from the ray's origin to [code]local_point[/code]

method.name: set_enabled
method.description: Enables the RayCast2D. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions.

method.name: set_exclude_parent_body
method.description: Toggle whether this ray should hit your parent node, if it's a body.

method.name: set_layer_mask
method.description: Set the mask to filter objects. Only objects with at least the same mask element set will be detected.

method.name: set_type_mask
method.description: Set the types of objects to detect. For [code]mask[/code] use a logic sum (OR operation) of constants defined in [Physics2DDirectSpaceState], eg. [code]Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY | Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY[/code] to detect only those two types.

class.name: RayShape2D
class.description: Ray 2D shape resource for physics. A ray is not really a collision body, instead it tries to separate itself from whatever is touching its far endpoint. It's often useful for characters.

method.name: get_length
method.description: Return the length of the ray.

method.name: set_length
method.description: Set the length of the ray.

class.name: Rect2
class.description: Rect2 provides an 2D Axis-Aligned Bounding Box. It consists of a position, a size, and several utility functions. It is typically used for fast overlap tests.

method.name: Rect2
method.description: Construct a [Rect2] by position and size.

method.name: Rect2
method.description: Construct a [Rect2] by x, y, width and height.

method.name: clip
method.description: Returns the intersection of this [Rect2] and b.

method.name: encloses
method.description: Returns true if this [Rect2] completely encloses another one.

method.name: expand
method.description: Return this [Rect2] expanded to include a given point.

method.name: get_area
method.description: Get the area of the [Rect2].

method.name: grow
method.description: Return a copy of the [Rect2] grown a given amount of units towards all the sides.

method.name: has_no_area
method.description: Return true if the [Rect2] is flat or empty.

method.name: has_point
method.description: Return true if the [Rect2] contains a point.

method.name: intersects
method.description: Return true if the [Rect2] overlaps with another.

method.name: merge
method.description: Combine this [Rect2] with another, a larger one is returned that contains both.

members.member: Ending corner.
Position (starting corner).
Size from position to end.

class.name: Rect3
class.description: Rect3 provides an 3D Axis-Aligned Bounding Box. It consists of a position, a size, and several utility functions. It is typically used for simple (fast) overlap tests.

method.name: Rect3
method.description: Optional constructor, accepts position and size.

method.name: encloses
method.description: Return true if this [Rect3] completely encloses another one.

method.name: expand
method.description: Return this [Rect3] expanded to include a given point.

method.name: get_area
method.description: Get the area of the [Rect3].

method.name: get_endpoint
method.description: Get the position of the 8 endpoints of the [Rect3] in space.

method.name: get_longest_axis
method.description: Return the normalized longest axis of the [Rect3].

method.name: get_longest_axis_index
method.description: Return the index of the longest axis of the [Rect3] (according to [Vector3]::AXIS* enum).

method.name: get_longest_axis_size
method.description: Return the scalar length of the longest axis of the [Rect3].

method.name: get_shortest_axis
method.description: Return the normalized shortest axis of the [Rect3].

method.name: get_shortest_axis_index
method.description: Return the index of the shortest axis of the [Rect3] (according to [Vector3]::AXIS* enum).

method.name: get_shortest_axis_size
method.description: Return the scalar length of the shortest axis of the [Rect3].

method.name: get_support
method.description: Return the support point in a given direction. This is useful for collision detection algorithms.

method.name: grow
method.description: Return a copy of the [Rect3] grown a given amount of units towards all the sides.

method.name: has_no_area
method.description: Return true if the [Rect3] is flat or empty.

method.name: has_no_surface
method.description: Return true if the [Rect3] is empty.

method.name: has_point
method.description: Return true if the [Rect3] contains a point.

method.name: intersection
method.description: Return the intersection between two [Rect3]. An empty AABB (size 0,0,0) is returned on failure.

method.name: intersects
method.description: Return true if the [Rect3] overlaps with another.

method.name: intersects_plane
method.description: Return true if the [Rect3] is at both sides of a plane.

method.name: intersects_segment
method.description: Return true if the [Rect3] intersects the line segment between from and to

method.name: merge
method.description: Combine this [Rect3] with another, a larger one is returned that contains both.

members.member: Ending corner.
Position (starting corner).
Size from position to end.

class.name: RectangleShape2D
class.description: Rectangle Shape for 2D Physics. This shape is useful for modeling box-like 2D objects.

method.name: get_extents
method.description: Return the half extents, the actual width and height of this shape is twice the half extents.

method.name: set_extents
method.description: Set the half extents, the actual width and height of this shape is twice the half extents.

class.name: Reference
class.brief_description: Base class for anything that keeps a reference count.
class.description: Base class for anything that keeps a reference count. Resource and many other helper objects inherit this. References keep an internal reference counter so they are only released when no longer in use.

method.name: reference
method.description: Increase the internal reference counter. Use this only if you really know what you are doing.

method.name: unreference
method.description: Decrease the internal reference counter. Use this only if you really know what you are doing.

class.name: ReferenceRect
class.description: Reference frame for GUI. It's just like an empty control, except a red box is displayed while editing around its size at all times.

class.name: RegEx
class.description: Class for finding text patterns in a string using regular expressions. It can not perform replacements. Regular expressions are a way to define patterns of text to be searched. Details on writing patterns are too long to explain here but the Internet is full of tutorials and detailed explanations. Once created, the RegEx object needs to be compiled with the pattern before it can be used. The pattern must be escaped first for gdscript before it is escaped for the expression. For example: [code]var exp = RegEx.new()[/code] [code]exp.compile("\\d+")[/code] would be read by RegEx as [code]\d+[/code] Similarly: [code]exp.compile("\"(?:\\\\.|[^\"])*\"")[/code] would be read as [code]"(?:\\.|[^"])*"[/code] Currently supported features: * Capturing [code]()[/code] and non-capturing [code](?:)[/code] groups * Named capturing groups [code](?P<name>)[/code] * Any character [code].[/code] * Shorthand character classes [code]\w \W \s \S \d \D[/code] * User-defined character classes such as [code][A-Za-z][/code] * Simple quantifiers [code]?[/code], [code]*[/code] and [code]+[/code] * Range quantifiers [code]{x,y}[/code] * Lazy (non-greedy) quantifiers [code]*?[/code] * Beginning [code]^[/code] and end [code]$[/code] anchors * Alternation [code]|[/code] * Backreferences [code]\1[/code], [code]\g{1}[/code], and [code]\g<name>[/code] * POSIX character classes [code][[:alnum:]][/code] * Lookahead [code](?=)[/code], [code](?!)[/code] and lookbehind [code](?<=)[/code], [code](?<!)[/code] * ASCII [code]\xFF[/code] and Unicode [code]\uFFFF[/code] code points (in a style similar to Python) * Word boundaries [code]\b[/code], [code]\B[/code]

method.name: clear
method.description: This method resets the state of the object, as it was freshly created. Namely, it unassigns the regular expression of this object.

method.name: compile
method.description: Compiles and assign the regular expression pattern to use.

method.name: get_group_count
method.description: Returns the number of numeric capturing groups.

method.name: get_names
method.description: Returns an array of names of named capturing groups.

method.name: get_pattern
method.description: Returns the expression used to compile the code.

method.name: is_valid
method.description: Returns whether this object has a valid regular expression assigned.

method.name: search
method.description: Searches the text for the compiled pattern. Returns a [RegExMatch] container of the first matching reult if found, otherwise null. The region to search within can be specified without modifying where the start and end anchor would be.

method.name: sub
method.description: Searches the text for the compiled pattern and replaces it with the specified string. Escapes and backreferences such as [code]\1[/code] and [code]\g<name>[/code] expanded and resolved. By default only the first instance is replaced but it can be changed for all instances (global replacement). The region to search within can be specified without modifying where the start and end anchor would be.

method.name: expand
method.description: Using results from the search, returns the specified string with escapes and backreferences such as [code]\1[/code] and [code]\g<name>[/code] expanded and resolved.

method.name: get_end
method.description: Returns the end position of the match in the string. An integer can be specified for numeric groups or a string for named groups. Returns -1 if that group wasn't found or doesn't exist. Defaults to 0 (whole pattern).

method.name: get_group_array
method.description: Returns an array of the results of the numeric groups.

method.name: get_group_count
method.description: Returns the number of numeric capturing groups.

method.name: get_name_dict
method.description: Returns a dictionary containing the named capturing groups and their results.

method.name: get_names
method.description: Returns an array of names of named capturing groups.

method.name: get_start
method.description: Returns the starting position of the match in the string. An integer can be specified for numeric groups or a string for named groups. Returns -1 if that group wasn't found or doesn't exist. Defaults to 0 (whole pattern).

method.name: get_string
method.description: Returns the result of the match in the string. An integer can be specified for numeric groups or a string for named groups. Returns -1 if that group wasn't found or doesn't exist. Defaults to 0 (whole pattern).

class.name: Resource
class.description: Resource is the base class for all resource types. Resources are primarily data containers. They are reference counted and freed when no longer in use. They are also loaded only once from disk, and further attempts to load the resource will return the same reference (all this in contrast to a [Node], which is not reference counted and can be instanced from disk as many times as desired). Resources can be saved externally on disk or bundled into another object, such as a [Node] or another resource.

method.name: get_name
method.description: Return the name of the resources, any name is valid (it doesn't have to be unique). Name is for descriptive purposes only.

method.name: get_path
method.description: Return the path of the resource. This is useful mainly for editors when saving/loading, and shouldn't be changed by anything else.

method.name: get_rid
method.description: Return the RID of the resource (or an empty RID). Many resources (such as [Texture], [Mesh], etc) are high level abstractions of resources stored in a server, so this function will return the original RID.

method.name: set_name
method.description: Set the name of the resources, any name is valid (it doesn't have to be unique). Name is for descriptive purposes only.

method.name: set_path
method.description: Set the path of the resource. This is useful mainly for editors when saving/loading, and shouldn't be changed by anything else. Fails if another [Resource] already has path "path".

method.name: take_over_path
method.description: Set the path of the resource. Differs from set_path(), if another [Resource] exists with "path" it over-takes it, instead of failing.

class.name: ResourceInteractiveLoader
class.description: Interactive Resource Loader. This object is returned by ResourceLoader when performing an interactive load. It allows to load with high granularity, so this is mainly useful for displaying load bars/percentages.

method.name: get_resource
method.description: Return the loaded resource (only if loaded). Otherwise, returns null.

method.name: get_stage
method.description: Return the load stage. The total amount of stages can be queried with [method get_stage_count]

method.name: get_stage_count
method.description: Return the total amount of stages (calls to [method poll]) needed to completely load this resource.

method.name: poll
method.description: Poll the load. If OK is returned, this means poll will have to be called again. If ERR_EOF is returned, them the load has finished and the resource can be obtained by calling [method get_resource].

class.name: ResourceLoader
class.description: Resource Loader. This is a static object accessible as [ResourceLoader]. GDScript has a simplified load() function, though.

method.name: get_recognized_extensions_for_type
method.description: Return the list of recognized extensions for a resource type.

method.name: load_interactive
method.description: Load a resource interactively, the returned object allows to load with high granularity.

method.name: set_abort_on_missing_resources
method.description: Change the behavior on missing sub-resources. Default is to abort load.

class.name: ResourcePreloader
class.description: Resource Preloader Node. This node is used to preload sub-resources inside a scene, so when the scene is loaded all the resources are ready to use and be retrieved from here.

method.name: add_resource
method.description: Add a resource to the preloader. Set the text-id that will be used to identify it (retrieve it/erase it/etc).

method.name: get_resource
method.description: Return the resource given a text-id.

method.name: get_resource_list
method.description: Return the list of resources inside the preloader.

method.name: has_resource
method.description: Return true if the preloader has a given resource.

method.name: remove_resource
method.description: Remove a resource from the preloader by text id.

method.name: rename_resource
method.description: Rename a resource inside the preloader, from a text-id to a new text-id.

class.name: ResourceSaver
class.description: Resource Saving Interface. This interface is used for saving resources to disk.

method.name: get_recognized_extensions
method.description: Return the list of extensions available for saving a resource of a given type.

method.name: save
method.description: Save a resource to disk, to a given path.

class.name: RichTextLabel
class.description: Label that displays rich text. Rich text can contain custom text, fonts, images and some basic formatting. It also adapts itself to given width/heights.

method.name: get_text
method.description: Returns the raw text, stripping out the formatting information.

method.name: is_selection_enabled
method.description: Return true if selecting the text inside this richtext is allowed.

method.name: set_selection_enabled
method.description: Set to true if selecting the text inside this richtext is allowed.

class.name: RigidBody
class.description: Rigid body node. This node is used for placing rigid bodies in the scene. It can contain a number of shapes, and also shift mode between regular Rigid body, Kinematic, Character or Static.

method.name: _integrate_forces
method.description: Called during physics processing, allowing you to read and safely modify the simulation state for the object. By default it works in addition to the usual physics behavior, but [method set_use_custom_integrator] allows you to disable the default behavior and do fully custom force integration for a body.

method.name: apply_impulse
method.description: Apply a positioned impulse (which will be affected by the body mass and shape). This is the equivalent of hitting a billiard ball with a cue: a force that is applied once, and only once. Both the impulse and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

method.name: get_angular_damp
method.description: Return the current body angular damp. Default is -1.

method.name: get_angular_velocity
method.description: Return the current body angular velocity.

method.name: get_axis_lock
method.description: Return the current axis lock of the body. One of AXIS_LOCK_* enum.

method.name: get_bounce
method.description: Return the current body bounciness.

method.name: get_colliding_bodies
method.description: Return a list of the bodies colliding with this one. By default, number of max contacts reported is at 0 , see [method set_max_contacts_reported] to increase it.

method.name: get_friction
method.description: Return the current body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (max friction).

method.name: get_gravity_scale
method.description: Return the current body gravity scale.

method.name: get_linear_damp
method.description: Return the current body linear damp. Default is -1.

method.name: get_linear_velocity
method.description: Return the current body linear velocity.

method.name: get_mass
method.description: Return the current body mass.

method.name: get_max_contacts_reported
method.description: Return the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [method set_max_contacts_reported].

method.name: get_mode
method.description: Return the current body mode, see [method set_mode].

method.name: get_weight
method.description: Return the current body weight, given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8).

method.name: is_able_to_sleep
method.description: Return whether the body has the ability to fall asleep when not moving. See [method set_can_sleep].

method.name: is_contact_monitor_enabled
method.description: Return whether contact monitoring is enabled.

method.name: is_sleeping
method.description: Return whether the body is sleeping.

method.name: is_using_continuous_collision_detection
method.description: Return whether this body is using continuous collision detection.

method.name: is_using_custom_integrator
method.description: Return whether the body is using a custom integrator.

method.name: set_angular_damp
method.description: Set the angular damp for this body. Default of -1, cannot be less than -1. If this value is different from -1, any angular damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

method.name: set_angular_velocity
method.description: Set the body angular velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

method.name: set_axis_lock
method.description: Set the axis lock of the body, from the AXIS_LOCK_* enum. Axis lock stops the body from moving along the specified axis(X/Y/Z) and rotating along the other two axes.

method.name: set_axis_velocity
method.description: Set an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

method.name: set_bounce
method.description: Set the body bounciness, from 0 (no bounciness) to 1 (max bounciness).

method.name: set_can_sleep
method.description: Set the body ability to fall asleep when not moving. This saves an enormous amount of processor time when there are plenty of rigid bodies (non static) in a scene. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] / [method set_applied_force] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

method.name: set_contact_monitor
method.description: Enable contact monitoring. This allows the body to emit signals when it collides with another.

method.name: set_friction
method.description: Set the body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (max friction).

method.name: set_gravity_scale
method.description: Set the gravity factor. This factor multiplies gravity intensity just for this body.

method.name: set_linear_damp
method.description: Set the linear damp for this body. Default of -1, cannot be less than -1. If this value is different from -1, any linear damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

method.name: set_linear_velocity
method.description: Set the body linear velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

method.name: set_mass
method.description: Set the body mass.

method.name: set_max_contacts_reported
method.description: Set the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

method.name: set_mode
method.description: Set the body mode, from the MODE_* enum. This allows to change to a static body or a character body.

method.name: set_sleeping
method.description: Set whether a body is sleeping or not. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

method.name: set_use_continuous_collision_detection
method.description: Set the continuous collision detection mode from the enum CCD_MODE_*. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided. The first is more precise, and misses less impacts by small, fast-moving objects. The second is faster to compute, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

method.name: set_use_custom_integrator
method.description: Pass true to disable the internal force integration (like gravity or air friction) for this body. Other than collision response, the body will only move as determined by the [method _integrate_forces] function, if defined.

method.name: set_weight
method.description: Set the body weight given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8).

signal.name: body_entered
signal.description: Emitted when a body enters into contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work.

signal.name: body_exited
signal.description: Emitted when a body shape exits contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work.

signal.name: body_shape_entered
signal.description: Emitted when a body enters into contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work. This signal not only receives the body that collided with this one, but also its [RID] (body_id), the shape index from the colliding body (body_shape), and the shape index from this body (local_shape) the other body collided with.

signal.name: body_shape_exited
signal.description: Emitted when a body shape exits contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work. This signal not only receives the body that stopped colliding with this one, but also its [RID] (body_id), the shape index from the colliding body (body_shape), and the shape index from this body (local_shape) the other body stopped colliding with.

signal.name: sleeping_state_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the body changes its sleeping state. Either by sleeping or waking up.

constants.constant: Static mode. The body behaves like a [StaticBody], and can only move by user code.
Kinematic body. The body behaves like a [KinematicBody], and can only move by user code.
Rigid body. This is the "natural" state of a rigid body. It is affected by forces, and can move, rotate, and be affected by user code.
Character body. This behaves like a rigid body, but can not rotate.

class.name: RigidBody2D
class.description: Rigid body 2D node. This node is used for placing rigid bodies in the scene. It can contain a number of shapes, and also shift state between regular Rigid body, Kinematic, Character or Static. Character mode forbids the node from being rotated. This node can have a custom force integrator function, for writing complex physics motion behavior per node. As a warning, don't change this node position every frame or very often. Sporadic changes work fine, but physics runs at a different granularity (fixed hz) than usual rendering (process callback) and maybe even in a separate thread, so changing this from a process loop will yield strange behavior.

method.name: _integrate_forces
method.description: Called during physics processing, allowing you to read and safely modify the simulation state for the object. By default it works in addition to the usual physics behavior, but [method set_use_custom_integrator] allows you to disable the default behavior and do fully custom force integration for a body.

method.name: add_force
method.description: Add a positioned force to the applied force and torque. As with [method apply_impulse], both the force and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

method.name: apply_impulse
method.description: Apply a positioned impulse (which will be affected by the body mass and shape). This is the equivalent of hitting a billiard ball with a cue: a force that is applied once, and only once. Both the impulse and the offset from the body origin are in global coordinates.

method.name: get_angular_damp
method.description: Return the angular damp for this body.

method.name: get_angular_velocity
method.description: Return the body angular velocity. This changes by physics granularity. See [method set_angular_velocity].

method.name: get_applied_force
method.description: Return the applied force vector.

method.name: get_applied_torque
method.description: Return the torque which is being applied to this body.

method.name: get_bounce
method.description: Return the body bounciness.

method.name: get_colliding_bodies
method.description: Return a list of the bodies colliding with this one. By default, number of max contacts reported is at 0 , see [method set_max_contacts_reported] to increase it. You must also enable contact monitor, see [method set_contact_monitor]

method.name: get_continuous_collision_detection_mode
method.description: Return whether this body is using continuous collision detection.

method.name: get_friction
method.description: Return the body friction.

method.name: get_gravity_scale
method.description: Return the gravity factor.

method.name: get_inertia
method.description: Return the body's moment of inertia. This is usually automatically computed from the mass and the shapes. Note that this doesn't seem to work in a [code]_ready[/code] function: it apparently has not been auto-computed yet.

method.name: get_linear_damp
method.description: Return the linear damp for this body.

method.name: get_linear_velocity
method.description: Return the body linear velocity. This changes by physics granularity. See [method set_linear_velocity].

method.name: get_mass
method.description: Return the body mass.

method.name: get_max_contacts_reported
method.description: Return the maximum contacts that can be reported. See [method set_max_contacts_reported].

method.name: get_mode
method.description: Return the current body mode, see [method set_mode].

method.name: get_weight
method.description: Return the body weight given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8).

method.name: is_able_to_sleep
method.description: Return true if the body has the ability to fall asleep when not moving. See [method set_can_sleep].

method.name: is_contact_monitor_enabled
method.description: Return whether contact monitoring is enabled.

method.name: is_sleeping
method.description: Return whether the body is sleeping.

method.name: is_using_custom_integrator
method.description: Return true if the body is not doing any built-in force integration.

method.name: set_angular_damp
method.description: Set the angular damp for this body. If this value is different from -1, any angular damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

method.name: set_angular_velocity
method.description: Set the body angular velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

method.name: set_applied_force
method.description: Set the applied force vector. This is the equivalent of pushing a box over the ground: the force applied is applied constantly.

method.name: set_applied_torque
method.description: Set a constant torque which will be applied to this body.

method.name: set_axis_velocity
method.description: Set an axis velocity. The velocity in the given vector axis will be set as the given vector length. This is useful for jumping behavior.

method.name: set_bounce
method.description: Set the body bounciness, from 0 (no bounce) to 1 (full bounce).

method.name: set_can_sleep
method.description: Set the body ability to fall asleep when not moving. This saves an enormous amount of processor time when there are plenty of rigid bodies (non static) in a scene. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] / [method set_applied_force] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

method.name: set_contact_monitor
method.description: Enable contact monitoring. This allows the body to emit signals when it collides with another.

method.name: set_continuous_collision_detection_mode
method.description: Set the continuous collision detection mode from the enum CCD_MODE_*. Continuous collision detection tries to predict where a moving body will collide, instead of moving it and correcting its movement if it collided. The first is more precise, and misses less impacts by small, fast-moving objects. The second is faster to compute, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.

method.name: set_friction
method.description: Set the body friction, from 0 (frictionless) to 1 (full friction).

method.name: set_gravity_scale
method.description: Set the gravity factor. This factor multiplies gravity intensity just for this body.

method.name: set_inertia
method.description: Set the body's moment of inertia. This is like mass, but for rotation: it determines how much torque it takes to rotate the body. The moment of inertia is usually computed automatically from the mass and the shapes, but this function allows you to set a custom value. Set 0 (or negative) inertia to return to automatically computing it.

method.name: set_linear_damp
method.description: Set the linear damp for this body. If this value is different from -1, any linear damp derived from the world or areas will be overridden.

method.name: set_linear_velocity
method.description: Set the body linear velocity. Can be used sporadically, but [b]DON'T SET THIS IN EVERY FRAME[/b], because physics may be running in another thread and definitely runs at a different granularity. Use [method _integrate_forces] as your process loop if you want to have precise control of the body state.

method.name: set_mass
method.description: Set the body mass.

method.name: set_max_contacts_reported
method.description: Set the maximum contacts to report. Bodies can keep a log of the contacts with other bodies, this is enabled by setting the maximum amount of contacts reported to a number greater than 0.

method.name: set_mode
method.description: Set the body mode, from the MODE_* enum. This allows to change to a static body or a character body.

method.name: set_sleeping
method.description: Set whether a body is sleeping or not. Sleeping bodies are not affected by forces until a collision or an [method apply_impulse] / [method set_applied_force] wakes them up. Until then, they behave like a static body.

method.name: set_use_custom_integrator
method.description: Pass true to disable the internal force integration (like gravity or air friction) for this body. Other than collision response, the body will only move as determined by the [method _integrate_forces] function, if defined.

method.name: set_weight
method.description: Set the body weight given standard earth-weight (gravity 9.8). Not really useful for 2D since most measures for this node are in pixels.

method.name: test_motion
method.description: Return whether the body would collide, if it tried to move in the given vector. This method allows two extra parameters: A margin, which increases slightly the size of the shapes involved in the collision detection, and an object of type [Physics2DTestMotionResult], which will store additional information about the collision (should there be one).

signal.name: body_entered
signal.description: Emitted when a body enters into contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work.

signal.name: body_exited
signal.description: Emitted when a body exits contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work.

signal.name: body_shape_entered
signal.description: Emitted when a body enters into contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work. This signal not only receives the body that collided with this one, but also its [RID] (body_id), the shape index from the colliding body (body_shape), and the shape index from this body (local_shape) the other body collided with.

signal.name: body_shape_exited
signal.description: Emitted when a body shape exits contact with this one. Contact monitor and contacts reported must be enabled for this to work. This signal not only receives the body that stopped colliding with this one, but also its [RID] (body_id), the shape index from the colliding body (body_shape), and the shape index from this body (local_shape) the other body stopped colliding with.

signal.name: sleeping_state_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the body changes its sleeping state. Either by sleeping or waking up.

constants.constant: Static mode. The body behaves like a [StaticBody2D], and can only move by user code.
Kinematic body. The body behaves like a [KinematicBody2D], and can only move by user code.
Rigid body. This is the "natural" state of a rigid body. It is affected by forces, and can move, rotate, and be affected by user code.
Character body. This behaves like a rigid body, but can not rotate.
Disables continuous collision detection. This is the fastest way to detect body collisions, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.
Enables continuous collision detection by raycasting. It is faster than shapecasting, but less precise.
Enables continuous collision detection by shapecasting. It is the slowest CCD method, and the most precise.

class.name: Room
class.description: Room contains the data to define the bounds of a scene (using a BSP Tree). It is instanced by a [VisualInstance] node to create rooms. See that class documentation for more information about rooms.

method.name: has_network_peer
method.description: Returns true if there is a [NetworkedMultiplayerPeer] set (with [method SceneTree.set_network_peer]).

method.name: is_network_server
method.description: Returns true if this SceneTree's [NetworkedMultiplayerPeer] is in server mode (listening for connections).

method.name: set_network_peer
method.description: Set the peer object to handle the RPC system (effectively enabling networking). Depending on the peer itself, the SceneTree will become a network server (check with [method is_network_server()]) and will set root node's network mode to master (see NETWORK_MODE_* constants in [Node]), or it will become a regular peer with root node set to slave. All child nodes are set to inherit the network mode by default. Handling of networking-related events (connection, disconnection, new clients) is done by connecting to SceneTree's signals.

class.name: Script
class.description: Base class for scripts. Any script that is loaded becomes one of these resources, which can then create instances.

method.name: can_instance
method.description: Return true if this script can be instance (ie not a library).

method.name: get_source_code
method.description: Return the script source code (if available).

method.name: has_source_code
method.description: Return true if the script contains source code.

method.name: instance_has
method.description: Return true if a given object uses an instance of this script.

method.name: set_source_code
method.description: Set the script source code.

class.name: ScrollBar
class.description: Scrollbars are a [Range] based [Control], that display a draggable area (the size of the page). Horizontal ([HScrollBar]) and Vertical ([VScrollBar]) versions are available.

class.name: ScrollContainer
class.brief_description: A helper node for displaying scrollable elements (e.g. lists).
class.description: A ScrollContainer node with a [Control] child and scrollbar child ([HScrollbar], [VScrollBar], or both) will only draw the Control within the ScrollContainer area. Scrollbars will automatically be drawn at the right (for vertical) or bottom (for horizontal) and will enable dragging to move the viewable Control (and its children) within the ScrollContainer. Scrollbars will also automatically resize the grabber based on the minimum_size of the Control relative to the ScrollContainer. Works great with a [Panel] control. You can set EXPAND on children size flags, so they will upscale to ScrollContainer size if ScrollContainer size is bigger (scroll is invisible for chosen dimension).

method.name: get_h_scroll
method.description: Return current horizontal scroll value.

method.name: get_v_scroll
method.description: Return current vertical scroll value.

method.name: is_h_scroll_enabled
method.description: Return true if horizontal scroll is allowed.

method.name: is_v_scroll_enabled
method.description: Return true if vertical scroll is allowed.

method.name: set_enable_h_scroll
method.description: Set allows horizontal scroll.

method.name: set_enable_v_scroll
method.description: Set allows vertical scroll.

method.name: set_h_scroll
method.description: Set horizontal scroll value.

method.name: set_v_scroll
method.description: Set vertical scroll value.

class.name: SegmentShape2D
class.description: Segment Shape for 2D Collision Detection, consists of two points, 'a' and 'b'.

method.name: get_a
method.description: Return the first point's position.

method.name: get_b
method.description: Return the second point's position.

method.name: set_a
method.description: Set the first point's position.

method.name: set_b
method.description: Set the second point's position.

class.name: Semaphore
class.description: A synchronization Semaphore. Element used in multi-threadding. Initialized to zero on creation.

method.name: post
method.description: Lowers the [Semaphore], allowing one more thread in.

method.name: wait
method.description: Tries to wait for the [Semaphore], if its value is zero, blocks until non-zero.

class.name: Separator
class.description: Separator is a [Control] used for separating other controls. It's purely a visual decoration. Horizontal ([HSeparator]) and Vertical ([VSeparator]) versions are available.

class.name: Shader
class.description: To be changed, ignore.

class.name: Shape2D
class.description: Base class for all 2D Shapes. All 2D shape types inherit from this.

method.name: collide
method.description: Return whether this shape is colliding with another. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), and the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]).

method.name: collide_and_get_contacts
method.description: Return a list of the points where this shape touches another. If there are no collisions, the list is empty. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), and the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]).

method.name: collide_with_motion
method.description: Return whether this shape would collide with another, if a given movement was applied. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the movement to test on this shape ([code]local_motion[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]), and the movement to test onto the other object ([code]shape_motion[/code]).

method.name: collide_with_motion_and_get_contacts
method.description: Return a list of the points where this shape would touch another, if a given movement was applied. If there are no collisions, the list is empty. This method needs the transformation matrix for this shape ([code]local_xform[/code]), the movement to test on this shape ([code]local_motion[/code]), the shape to check collisions with ([code]with_shape[/code]), the transformation matrix of that shape ([code]shape_xform[/code]), and the movement to test onto the other object ([code]shape_motion[/code]).

method.name: get_custom_solver_bias
method.description: Return the custom solver bias.

method.name: set_custom_solver_bias
method.description: Use a custom solver bias. No need to change this unless you really know what you are doing. The solver bias is a factor controlling how much two objects "rebound" off each other, when colliding, to avoid them getting into each other because of numerical imprecision.

class.name: Skeleton
class.brief_description: Skeleton for characters and animated objects.
class.description: Skeleton provides a hierarchical interface for managing bones, including pose, rest and animation (see [Animation]). Skeleton will support rag doll dynamics in the future.

method.name: add_bone
method.description: Add a bone, with name "name". [method get_bone_count] will become the bone index.

method.name: bind_child_node_to_bone
method.description: Deprecated soon.
