signal.name: item_selected
signal.description: Emitted when an item is selected with right mouse button.

class.name: Tween
class.brief_description: Node useful for animations with unknown start and end points.
class.description: Node useful for animations with unknown start and end points, procedural animations, making one node follow another, and other simple behavior. Because it is easy to get it wrong, here is a quick usage example: [codeblock] var tween = get_node("Tween") tween.interpolate_property(get_node("Node2D_to_move"), "transform/pos", Vector2(0,0), Vector2(100,100), 1, Tween.TRANS_LINEAR, Tween.EASE_IN_OUT) tween.start() [/codeblock] Some of the methods of this class require a property name. You can get the property name by hovering over the property in the inspector of the editor. Many of the methods accept [code]trans_type[/code] and [code]ease_type[/code]. The first accepts an TRANS_* constant, and refers to the way the timing of the animation is handled (you might want to see [code]http://easings.net/[/code] for some examples). The second accepts an EASE_* constant, and controls the where [code]trans_type[/code] is applied to the interpolation (in the beginning, the end, or both). If you don't know which transision and easing to pick, you can try different TRANS_* constants with EASE_IN_OUT, and use the one that looks best.

method.name: follow_method
method.description: Follow [code]method[/code] of [code]object[/code] and apply the returned value on [code]target_method[/code] of [code]target[/code], beginning from [code]initial_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] later. Methods are animated by calling them with consequitive values. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

method.name: follow_property
method.description: Follow [code]property[/code] of [code]object[/code] and apply it on [code]target_property[/code] of [code]target[/code], beginning from [code]initial_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. Note that [code]target:target_property[/code] would equal [code]object:property[/code] at the end of the tween. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

method.name: get_runtime
method.description: Returns the time needed for all tweens to end in seconds, measured from the start. Thus, if you have two tweens, one ending 10 seconds after the start and the other - 20 seconds, it would return 20 seconds, as by that time all tweens would have finished.

method.name: get_speed_scale
method.description: Returns the speed that has been set from editor GUI or [method set_repeat].

method.name: get_tween_process_mode
method.description: Returns the process mode that has been set from editor GUI or [method set_tween_process_mode]

method.name: interpolate_callback
method.description: Call [code]callback[/code] of [code]object[/code] after [code]duration[/code]. [code]arg1[/code]-[code]arg5[/code] are arguments to be passed to the callback.

method.name: interpolate_deferred_callback
method.description: Call [code]callback[/code] of [code]object[/code] after [code]duration[/code] on the main thread (similar to [methog Object.call_deferred). [code]arg1[/code]-[code]arg5[/code] are arguments to be passed to the callback.

method.name: interpolate_method
method.description: Animate [code]method[/code] of [code]object[/code] from [code]initial_val[/code] to [code]final_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. Methods are animated by calling them with consecuitive values. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

method.name: interpolate_property
method.description: Animate [code]property[/code] of [code]object[/code] from [code]initial_val[/code] to [code]final_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

method.name: is_active
method.description: Returns true if any tweens are currently running, and false otherwise. Note that this method doesn't consider tweens that have ended.

method.name: is_repeat
method.description: Returns true if repeat has been set from editor GUI or [method set_repeat].

method.name: remove
method.description: Stop animating and completely remove a tween, given its object and property/method pair. Passing empty String as key will remove all tweens for given object.

method.name: remove_all
method.description: Stop animating and completely remove all tweens.

method.name: reset
method.description: Resets a tween to the initial value (the one given, not the one before the tween), given its object and property/method pair. Passing empty String as key will reset all tweens for given object.

method.name: reset_all
method.description: Resets all tweens to their initial values (the ones given, not those before the tween).

method.name: resume
method.description: Continue animating a stopped tween, given its object and property/method pair. Passing empty String as key will resume all tweens for given object.

method.name: resume_all
method.description: Continue animating all stopped tweens.

method.name: seek
method.description: Seek the animation to the given [code]time[/code] in seconds.

method.name: set_active
method.description: Activate/deactivate the tween. You can use this for pausing animations, though [method stop_all] and [method resume_all] might be more fit for this.

method.name: set_repeat
method.description: Make the tween repeat after all tweens have finished.

method.name: set_speed_scale
method.description: Set the speed multiplier of the tween. Set it to 1 for normal speed, 2 for two times nromal speed, and 0.5 for half of the normal speed. Setting it to 0 would pause the animation, but you might consider using [method set_active] or [method stop_all] and [method resume_all] for this.

method.name: set_tween_process_mode
method.description: Set whether the Tween uses [code]_process[/code] or [code]_fixed_process[/code] (accepts TWEEN_PROCESS_IDLE and TWEEN_PROCESS_FIXED constants, respectively).

method.name: start
method.description: Start the tween node. You can define tweens both before and after this.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop animating a tween, given its object and property/method pair. Passing empty String as key will stop all tweens for given object.

method.name: stop_all
method.description: Stop animating all tweens.

method.name: targeting_method
method.description: Animate [code]method[/code] of [code]object[/code] from the value returned by [code]initial.initial_method[/code] to [code]final_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. Methods are animated by calling them with consecuitive values. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

method.name: targeting_property
method.description: Animate [code]property[/code] of [code]object[/code] from the current value of the [code]initial_val[/code] property of [code]initial[/code] to [code]final_val[/code] for [code]duration[/code] seconds, [code]delay[/code] seconds later. [code]trans_type[/code] accepts TRANS_* constants, and is the way the animation is interpolated, while [code]ease_type[/code] accepts EASE_* constants, and controls the place of the interpolation (the beginning, the end, or both). You can read more about them in the class description.

method.name: tell
method.description: Returns the current time of the tween.

signal.name: tween_completed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when a tween ends.

signal.name: tween_started
signal.description: This signal is emitted when a tween starts.

signal.name: tween_step
signal.description: This signal is emitted each step of the tweening.

constants.constant: The [Tween] should use [code]_fixed_process[/code] for timekeeping when this is enabled.
The [Tween] should use [code]_process[/code] for timekeeping when this is enabled (default).
Means that the animation is interpolated linearly.
Means that the animation is interpolated using a sine wave.
Means that the animation is interpolated with a quinary (to the power of 5) function.
Means that the animation is interpolated with a quartic (to the power of 4) function.
Means that the animation is interpolated with a quadratic (to the power of 2) function.
Means that the animation is interpolated with a exponential (some number to the power of x) function.
Means that the animation is interpolated with elasticity, wiggling around the edges.
Means that the animation is interpolated with a cubic (to the power of 3) function.
Means that the animation is interpolated with a function using square roots.
Means that the animation is interpolated by bouncing at, but never surpassing, the end.
Means that the animation is interpolated backing out at edges.
Signifies that the interpolation should be focused in the beginning.
Signifies that the interpolation should be focused in the end.
Signifies that the interpolation should be focused in both ends.
Signifies that the interpolation should be focused in both ends, but they should be switched (a bit hard to explain, try it for yourself to be sure).

class.name: UndoRedo
class.brief_description: Helper to manage UndoRedo in the editor or custom tools.
class.description: Helper to maange UndoRedo in the editor or custom tools. It works by storing calls to functions in both 'do' an 'undo' lists. Common behavior is to create an action, then add do/undo calls to functions or property changes, then committing the action.

method.name: add_do_property
method.description: Set a property with a custom value.

method.name: add_do_reference
method.description: Add a 'do' reference that will be erased if the 'do' history is lost. This is useful mostly for new nodes created for the 'do' call. Do not use for resources.

method.name: add_undo_property
method.description: Undo setting of a property with a custom value.

method.name: add_undo_reference
method.description: Add an 'undo' reference that will be erased if the 'undo' history is lost. This is useful mostly for nodes rmoved with the 'do' call (not the 'undo' call!).

method.name: clear_history
method.description: Clear the undo/redo history and associated references.

method.name: commit_action
method.description: Commit the action. All 'do' methods/properties are called/set when this function is called.

method.name: create_action
method.description: Create a new action. After this is called, do all your calls to [method add_do_method], [method add_undo_method], [method add_do_property] and [method add_un do_property].

method.name: get_current_action_name
method.description: Get the name of the current action.

method.name: get_version
method.description: Get the version, each time a new action is committed, the version number of the UndoRedo is increased automatically. This is useful mostly to check if something changed from a saved version.

class.name: VBoxContainer
class.description: Vertical box container. See [BoxContainer].

class.name: VButtonArray
class.description: Vertical button array. See [ButtonArray].

class.name: VScrollBar
class.brief_description: Vertical version of [ScrollBar], which goes from left (min) to right (max).

class.name: VSeparator
class.description: Vertical version of [Separator]. It is used to separate objects horizontally, though (but it looks vertical!).

class.name: VSlider
class.description: Vertical slider. See [Slider]. This one goes from left (min) to right (max).

class.name: VSplitContainer
class.description: Vertical split container. See [SplitContainer]. This goes from left to right.

class.name: Vector2
class.description: 2-element structure that can be used to represent positions in 2d-space, or any other pair of numeric values.

method.name: Vector2
method.description: Constructs a new Vector2 from the given x and y.

method.name: angle
method.description: Returns the result of atan2 when called with the Vector's x and y as parameters (Math::atan2(x,y)). Be aware that it therefore returns an angle oriented clockwise with regard to the (0, 1) unit vector, and not an angle oriented counter-clockwise with regard to the (1, 0) unit vector (which would be the typical trigonometric representation of the angle when calling Math::atan2(y,x)).

method.name: angle_to
method.description: Returns the angle in radians between the two vectors.

method.name: angle_to_point
method.description: Returns the angle in radians between the line connecting the two points and the x coordinate.

method.name: aspect
method.description: Returns the ratio of X to Y.

method.name: bounce
method.description: Bounce returns the vector "bounced off" from the given plane, specified by its normal vector.

method.name: cubic_interpolate
method.description: Cubicly interpolates between this Vector and "b", using "pre_a" and "post_b" as handles, and returning the result at position "t".

method.name: distance_squared_to
method.description: Returns the squared distance to vector "b". Prefer this function over "distance_to" if you need to sort vectors or need the squared distance for some formula.

method.name: distance_to
method.description: Returns the distance to vector "b".

method.name: dot
method.description: Returns the dot product with vector "b".

method.name: floor
method.description: Remove the fractional part of x and y.

method.name: length
method.description: Returns the length of the vector.

method.name: length_squared
method.description: Returns the squared length of the vector. Prefer this function over "length" if you need to sort vectors or need the squared length for some formula.

method.name: linear_interpolate
method.description: Returns the result of the linear interpolation between this vector and "b", by amount "t".

method.name: normalized
method.description: Returns a normalized vector to unit length.

method.name: reflect
method.description: Reflects the vector along the given plane, specified by its normal vector.

method.name: rotated
method.description: Rotates the vector by "phi" radians.

method.name: slide
method.description: Slide returns the component of the vector along the given plane, specified by its normal vector.

method.name: snapped
method.description: Snaps the vector to a grid with the given size.

method.name: tangent
method.description: Returns a perpendicular vector.

members.member: Height of the vector (Same as Y).
Width of the vector (Same as X).
X component of the vector.
Y component of the vector.

class.name: Vector3
class.brief_description: Vector class, which performs basic 3D vector math operations.
class.description: Vector3 is one of the core classes of the engine, and includes several built-in helper functions to perform basic vector math operations.

method.name: Vector3
method.description: Returns a Vector3 with the given components.

method.name: abs
method.description: Returns a new vector with all components in absolute values (e.g. positive).

method.name: bounce
method.description: Bounce returns the vector "bounced off" from the given plane, specified by its normal vector.

method.name: ceil
method.description: Returns a new vector with all components rounded up.

method.name: cross
method.description: Return the cross product with b.

method.name: cubic_interpolate
method.description: Perform a cubic interpolation between vectors pre_a, a, b, post_b (a is current), by the given amount (t).

method.name: distance_squared_to
method.description: Return the squared distance (distance minus the last square root) to b. Prefer this function over distance_to if you need to sort vectors or need the squared distance for some formula.

method.name: distance_to
method.description: Return the distance to b.

method.name: dot
method.description: Return the dot product with b.

method.name: floor
method.description: Returns a new vector with all components rounded down.

method.name: inverse
method.description: Returns the inverse of the vector. This is the same as Vector3( 1.0 / v.x, 1.0 / v.y, 1.0 / v.z )

method.name: length
method.description: Return the length of the vector.

method.name: length_squared
method.description: Return the length of the vector, squared. Prefer this function over "length" if you need to sort vectors or need the squared length for some formula.

method.name: linear_interpolate
method.description: Linearly interpolates the vector to a given one (b), by the given amount (t).

method.name: max_axis
method.description: Returns AXIS_X, AXIS_Y or AXIS_Z depending on which axis is the largest.

method.name: min_axis
method.description: Returns AXIS_X, AXIS_Y or AXIS_Z depending on which axis is the smallest.

method.name: normalized
method.description: Return a copy of the normalized vector to unit length. This is the same as v / v.length().

method.name: outer
method.description: Return the outer product with b.

method.name: reflect
method.description: Reflects the vector along the given plane, specified by its normal vector.

method.name: rotated
method.description: Rotates the vector around some axis by phi radians. The axis must be a normalized vector.

method.name: slide
method.description: Slide returns the component of the vector along the given plane, specified by its normal vector.

method.name: snapped
method.description: Return a copy of the vector, snapped to the lowest neared multiple.

method.name: to_diagonal_matrix
method.description: Return a diagonal matrix with the vector as main diagonal.

members.member: X component of the vector.
Y component of the vector.
Z component of the vector.

constants.constant: Enumerated value for the X axis. Returned by functions like max_axis or min_axis.
Enumerated value for the Y axis.
Enumerated value for the Z axis.

method.name: get_linear_velocity
method.description: Returns the VehicleBody's velocity vector. To get the absolute speed in scalar value, get the length of the return vector in pixels/second. Example: [codeblock] # vehicle is an instance of VehicleBody var speed = vehicle.get_linear_velocity().length() [/codeblock]

class.name: VideoPlayer
class.description: This control has the ability to play video streams. The only format accepted is the OGV Theora, so any other format must be converted before using in a project.

method.name: get_audio_track
method.description: Get the selected audio track (for multitrack videos).

method.name: get_buffering_msec
method.description: Get the amount of miliseconds to store in buffer while playing.

method.name: get_stream
method.description: Get the video stream.

method.name: get_stream_name
method.description: Get the name of the video stream.

method.name: get_stream_pos
method.description: Get the current position of the stream, in seconds.

method.name: get_video_texture
method.description: Get the current frame of the video as a [Texture].

method.name: get_volume
method.description: Get the volume of the audio track as a linear value.

method.name: get_volume_db
method.description: Get the volume of the audio track in decibels.

method.name: has_autoplay
method.description: Get whether or not the video is set as autoplay.

method.name: has_expand
method.description: Get whether or not the expand property is set.

method.name: is_paused
method.description: Get whether or not the video is paused.

method.name: is_playing
method.description: Get whether or not the video is playing.

method.name: play
method.description: Start the video playback.

method.name: set_audio_track
method.description: Set the audio track (for multitrack videos).

method.name: set_autoplay
method.description: Set whether this node should start playing automatically.

method.name: set_buffering_msec
method.description: Set the amount of miliseconds to buffer during playback.

method.name: set_expand
method.description: Set the expand property. If enabled, the video will grow or shrink to fit the player size, otherwise it will play at the stream resolution.

method.name: set_paused
method.description: Set whether the video should pause the playback.

method.name: set_stream
method.description: Set the video stream for this player.

method.name: set_volume
method.description: Set the audio volume as a linear value.

method.name: set_volume_db
method.description: Set the audio volume in decibels.

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop the video playback.

class.name: Viewport
class.brief_description: Creates a sub-view into the screen.
class.description: A Viewport creates a different view into the screen, or a sub-view inside another viewport. Children 2D Nodes will display on it, and children Camera 3D nodes will render on it too. Optionally, a viewport can have its own 2D or 3D world, so they don't share what they draw with other viewports. If a viewport is a child of a [Control], it will automatically take up its same rect and position, otherwise they must be set manually. Viewports can also choose to be audio listeners, so they generate positional audio depending on a 2D or 3D camera child of it. Also, viewports can be assigned to different screens in case the devices have multiple screens. Finally, viewports can also behave as render targets, in which case they will not be visible unless the associated texture is used to draw.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the viewport manually.

method.name: find_world
method.description: Return the 3D world of the viewport, or if no such present, the one of the parent viewport.

method.name: find_world_2d
method.description: Return the 2D world of the viewport.

method.name: get_camera
method.description: Return the active 3D camera.

method.name: get_canvas_transform
method.description: Get the canvas transform of the viewport.

method.name: get_clear_on_new_frame
method.description: Return whether automatic clearing of the render target on each frame is enabled.

method.name: get_final_transform
method.description: Get the total transform of the viewport.

method.name: get_global_canvas_transform
method.description: Get the global canvas transform of the viewport.

method.name: get_hdr
method.description: Get whether the rendered texture has filters enabled.

method.name: get_mouse_pos
method.description: Get the mouse position, relative to the viewport.

method.name: get_physics_object_picking
method.description: Get whether picking for all physics objects inside the viewport is enabled.

method.name: get_screen_capture
method.description: Return the captured screenshot after [method queue_screen_capture]. You might need to check more than one frame until the right image is returned.

method.name: get_size
method.description: Return the viewport rect. If the viewport is child of a control, it will use the same rect as the parent. Otherwise, if the rect is empty, the viewport will use all the allowed space.

method.name: get_size_override
method.description: Get the size override set with [method set_size_override].

method.name: get_texture
method.description: Get the viewport's texture, for use with various objects that you want to texture with the viewport.

method.name: get_update_mode
method.description: Get when the viewport would be updated, will be one of the [code]UPDATE_*[/code] constants.

method.name: get_vflip
method.description: Set whether the render target is flipped on the Y axis.

method.name: get_viewport_rid
method.description: Get the viewport RID from the [VisualServer].

method.name: get_visible_rect
method.description: Return the final, visible rect in global screen coordinates.

method.name: get_world
method.description: Return the 3D world of the viewport.

method.name: get_world_2d
method.description: Return the 2D world of the viewport.

method.name: gui_get_drag_data
method.description: Returs the drag data from the GUI, that was previously returned by [method Control.get_drag_data].

method.name: gui_has_modal_stack
method.description: Returs whether there are shown modals on-screen.

method.name: has_transparent_background
method.description: Return whether the viewport lets whatever is behind it to show.

method.name: is_audio_listener
method.description: Returns whether the viewport sends sounds to the speakers.

method.name: is_audio_listener_2d
method.description: Returns whether the viewport sends soundsfrom 2D emitters to the speakers.

method.name: is_input_disabled
method.description: Return whether input to the viewport is disabled.

method.name: is_size_override_enabled
method.description: Get the enabled status of the size override set with [method set_size_override].

method.name: is_size_override_stretch_enabled
method.description: Get the enabled status of the size strech override set with [method set_size_override_stretch].

method.name: is_using_own_world
method.description: Return whether the viewport is using a world separate from the parent viewport's world.

method.name: queue_screen_capture
method.description: Queue a multithreaded screenshot, you can retrive it at a later frame via [method get_screen_capture].

method.name: set_as_audio_listener
method.description: Makes the viewport send sounds to the speakers.

method.name: set_as_audio_listener_2d
method.description: Makes the viewport send sounds from 2D emitters to the speakers.

method.name: set_canvas_transform
method.description: Set the canvas transform of the viewport, useful for changing the on-screen positions of all child [CanvasItem]s. This is relative to the global canvas transform of the viewport.

method.name: set_disable_input
method.description: Set whether input to the viewport is disabled.

method.name: set_global_canvas_transform
method.description: Set the global canvas transform of the viewport. The canvas transform is relative to this.

method.name: set_physics_object_picking
method.description: Enable/disable picking for all physics objects inside the viewport.

method.name: set_size
method.description: Set the size of the viewport.

method.name: set_size_override
method.description: Set the size override of the viewport. If the enable parameter is true, it would use the override, otherwise it would use the default size. If the size parameter is equal to [code](-1, -1)[/code], it won't update the size.

method.name: set_size_override_stretch
method.description: Set whether the size override affects stretch as well.

method.name: set_transparent_background
method.description: If this viewport is a child of another viewport, keep the previously drawn background visible.

method.name: set_update_mode
method.description: Set when the render target would be updated, using the [code]UPDATE_*[/code] constants

method.name: set_use_own_world
method.description: Make the viewport use a world separate from the parent viewport's world.

method.name: set_vflip
method.description: Set whether the viewport is flipped on the Y axis.

method.name: set_world
method.description: Change the 3D world of the viewport.

method.name: update_worlds
method.description: Force update of the 2D and 3D worlds.

method.name: warp_mouse
method.description: Warp the mouse to a position, relative to the viewport.

signal.name: size_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the size of the viewport is changed, whether by [method set_size_override], resize of window, or some other means.

constants.constant: Do not update the render target.
Update the render target once, then switch to [code]UPDATE_DISABLED[/code]
Update the render target only when it is visible. This is the default value.

class.name: VisibilityEnabler
class.brief_description: Enable certain nodes only when visible.
class.description: The VisibilityEnabler will disable [RigidBody] and [AnimationPlayer] nodes when they are not visible. It will only affect other nodes within the same scene as the VisibilityEnabler itself.

method.name: is_enabler_enabled
method.description: Returns whether the specified enabler was set to true or not.

method.name: set_enabler
method.description: Set an enabler to true for all nodes of its type to be disabled when the VisibilityEnabler is not in view. See the constants for enablers and what they affect.

class.name: VisibilityEnabler2D
class.brief_description: Enable certain nodes only when visible.
class.description: The VisibilityEnabler2D will disable [RigidBody2D], [AnimationPlayer], and other nodes when they are not visible. It will only affect other nodes within the same scene as the VisibilityEnabler2D itself.

method.name: is_enabler_enabled
method.description: Returns whether the specified enabler was set to true or not.

method.name: set_enabler
method.description: Set an enabler to true for all nodes of its type to be disabled when the VisibilityEnabler2D is not in view. See the constants for enablers and what they affect.

constants.constant: This enabler will stop the parent's _process function.
This enabler will stop the parent's _fixed_process function.

class.name: VisibilityNotifier
class.brief_description: Detect when the node is visible on screen.
class.description: The VisibilityNotifier is used to notify when its bounding box enters the screen, is visible on the screen, or when it exits the screen.

method.name: get_aabb
method.description: Return the visibility bounding box of the VisibilityNotifier.

method.name: is_on_screen
method.description: Return true if any part of the bounding box is on the screen.

method.name: set_aabb
method.description: Set the visibility bounding box of the VisibilityNotifier.

signal.name: camera_entered
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier enters a [Camera]'s view.

signal.name: camera_exited
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier exits a [Camera]'s view.

signal.name: screen_entered
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier enters the screen.

signal.name: screen_exited
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier exits the screen.

class.name: VisibilityNotifier2D
class.brief_description: Detect when the node is visible on screen.
class.description: The VisibilityNotifier2D is used to notify when its bounding rectangle enters the screen, is visible on the screen, or when it exits the screen.

method.name: get_rect
method.description: Return the visibility bounding rectangle of the VisibilityNotifier2D.

method.name: is_on_screen
method.description: Return true if any part of the bounding rectangle is on the screen.

method.name: set_rect
method.description: Set the visibility bounding rectangle of the VisibilityNotifier2D.

signal.name: screen_entered
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier2D enters the screen.

signal.name: screen_exited
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier2D exits the screen.

signal.name: viewport_entered
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier2D enters a [Viewport]'s view.

signal.name: viewport_exited
signal.description: Emitted when the VisibilityNotifier2D exits a [Viewport]'s view.

class.name: VisualServer
class.description: Server for anything visible. The visual server is the API backend for everything visible. The whole scene system mounts on it to display. The visual server is completely opaque, the internals are entirely implementation specific and cannot be accessed.

class.name: WeakRef
class.brief_description: Holds an [Object], but does not contribute to the reference count if the object is a reference.
class.description: A weakref can hold a [Reference], without contributing to the reference counter. A weakref can be created from an [Object] using [method @GDScript.weakref]. If this object is not a reference, weakref still works, however, it does not have any effect on the object. Weakrefs are useful in cases where multiple classes have variables that refer to eachother. Without weakrefs, using these classes could lead to memory leaks, since both references keep eachother from being released. Making part of the variables a weakref can prevent this cyclic dependency, and allows the references to be released.

method.name: get_ref
method.description: Returns the [Object] this weakref is referring to.

class.name: WindowDialog
class.description: Windowdialog is the base class for all window-based dialogs. It's a by-default toplevel [Control] that draws a window decoration and allows motion and resizing.

method.name: get_close_button
method.description: Return the close [TextureButton].

method.name: get_title
method.description: Return the title of the window.

method.name: set_title
method.description: Set the title of the window.

class.name: World
class.brief_description: Class that has everything pertaining to a world.
class.description: Class that has everything pertaining to a world. A physics space, a visual scenario and a sound space. Spatial nodes register their resources into the current world.

class.name: World2D
class.brief_description: Class that has everything pertaining to a 2D world.
class.description: Class that has everything pertaining to a 2D world. A physics space, a visual scenario and a sound space. 2D nodes register their resources into the current 2D world.

method.name: get_canvas
method.description: Retrieve the [RID] of this world's canvas resource. Used by the [VisualServer] for 2D drawing.

method.name: get_direct_space_state
method.description: Retrieve the state of this world's physics space. This allows arbitrary querying for collision.

method.name: get_sound_space
method.description: Retrieve the [RID] of this world's sound space resource. Used by the [SpatialSound2DServer] for 2D spatial audio.

method.name: get_space
method.description: Retrieve the [RID] of this world's physics space resource. Used by the [Physics2DServer] for 2D physics, treating it as both a space and an area.

class.name: XMLParser
class.brief_description: Low-level class for creating parsers for XML files.
class.description: This class can serve as base to make custom XML parsers. Since XML is a very flexible standard, this interface is low level so it can be applied to any possible schema.

method.name: get_attribute_count
method.description: Get the amount of attributes in the current element.

method.name: get_attribute_name
method.description: Get the name of the attribute specified by the index in [code]idx[/code] argument.

method.name: get_attribute_value
method.description: Get the value of the attribute specified by the index in [code]idx[/code] argument.

method.name: get_current_line
method.description: Get the current line in the parsed file (currently not implemented).

method.name: get_named_attribute_value
method.description: Get the value of a certain attribute of the current element by name. This will raise an error if the element has no such attribute.

method.name: get_named_attribute_value_safe
method.description: Get the value of a certain attribute of the current element by name. This will return an empty [String] if the attribute is not found.

method.name: get_node_data
method.description: Get the contents of a text node. This will raise an error in any other type of node.

method.name: get_node_name
method.description: Get the name of the current element node. This will raise an error if the current node type is not [code]NODE_ELEMENT[/code] nor [code]NODE_ELEMENT_END[/code]

method.name: get_node_offset
method.description: Get the byte offset of the current node since the beginning of the file or buffer.

method.name: get_node_type
method.description: Get the type of the current node. Compare with [code]NODE_*[/code] constants.

method.name: has_attribute
method.description: Check whether or not the current element has a certain attribute.

method.name: is_empty
method.description: Check whether the current element is empty (this only works for completely empty tags, e.g. <element \>).

method.name: open
method.description: Open a XML file for parsing. This returns an error code.

method.name: open_buffer
method.description: Open a XML raw buffer for parsing. This returns an error code.

method.name: read
method.description: Read the next node of the file. This returns an error code.

method.name: seek
method.description: Move the buffer cursor to a certain offset (since the beginning) and read the next node there. This returns an error code.

method.name: skip_section
method.description: Skips the current section. If the node contains other elements, they will be ignored and the cursor will go to the closing of the current element.

constants.constant: There's no node (no file or buffer opened)

class.name: YSort
class.brief_description: Sort all child nodes based on their Y positions.
class.description: Sort all child nodes based on their Y positions. The child node must inherit from [CanvasItem] for it to be sorted. Nodes that have a higher Y position will be drawn later, so they will appear on top of nodes that have a lower Y position.

method.name: is_sort_enabled
method.description: Returns true if the children nodes are being sorted.

method.name: set_sort_enabled
method.description: Set whether the children nodes are sorted or not. (default true)

class.name: bool
class.description: Boolean built-in type.

method.name: bool
method.description: Cast an [int] value to a boolean value, this method will return true if called with an integer value different to 0 and false in other case.

method.name: bool
method.description: Cast a [float] value to a boolean value, this method will return true if called with a floating point value different to 0 and false in other case.

method.name: bool
method.description: Cast a [String] value to a boolean value, this method will return true if called with a non empty string and false in other case. Examples: [code]bool('False')[/code] returns true, [code]bool('')[/code]. returns false

class.name: float
class.description: Float built-in type.

method.name: float
method.description: Cast a [bool] value to a floating point value, [code]float(true)[/code] will be equals to 1.0 and [code]float(false)[/code] will be equals to 0.0.

method.name: float
method.description: Cast an [int] value to a floating point value, [code]float(1)[/code] will be equals to 1.0.

method.name: float
method.description: Cast a [String] value to a floating point value. This method accepts float value strings like [code] '1.23' [/code] and exponential notation strings for its parameter so calling [code] float('1e3') [/code] will return 1000.0 and calling [code] float('1e-3') [/code] will return -0.001.

class.name: int
class.description: Integer built-in type.

method.name: int
method.description: Cast a [bool] value to an integer value, [code]int(true)[/code] will be equals to 1 and [code]int(false)[/code] will be equals to 0.

method.name: int
method.description: Cast a float value to an integer value, this method simply removes the number fractions, so for example [code]int(2.7)[/code] will be equals to 2, [code]int(.1)[/code] will be equals to 0 and [code]int(-2.7)[/code] will be equals to -2.

method.name: int
method.description: Cast a [String] value to an integer value, this method is an integer parser from a string, so calling this method with an invalid integer string will return 0, a valid string will be something like [code]'1.7'[/code]. This method will ignore all non-number characters, so calling [code]int('1e3')[/code] will return 13.
